Text: Long-standing presence in industry coupled with part of TVS group

The Company, being in the business of manufacturing of auto components, is poised to benefit from the synergies and goodwill offered by the group and its long-standing presence in the industry. As informed, nearly 75% of the revenue is from the group of companies. The Company also has other major customers like Honeywell Turbo Technologies (part of Honeywell International Inc.) and Cummins Turbo Technologies Limited India, however majority of sales is still from the group. Long term business association with the group, which is one of the leading business houses, supports he the business risk profile of the Company. Through its association with the group companies, the Company benefits in multiple ways like steady revenue visibility, moving up the value chain, bargaining power, global visibility amongst others. It also helps the Company to mitigate debtor?s realization risk and helps in scouting prospective customers. Though independently managed, ABI benefits from its long-standing business relationship with group of Companies and its long-standing presence in the industry.

The debt equity ratio has been low during the review period. The same stood at 0.21 times as on 31st March 2019 on the back of additional term loans and short term working capital loans undertaken from bank. The Company undertook significant capital expenditure mainly in the form of land and building, and plant and machinery in the last three years for setting up a plant to manufacture value added SS castings. The capex done so far has mainly been funded through internal accruals. Moreover, for the ongoing capex of about INR 75.00 Crore in pipeline, the Company is planning to fund the same through internal accruals and loans from banks. Given that the internal cash accruals of the Company are about INR 87 Crore in FY 2019, the same is likely to have little impact on the gearing levels of the Company. Low dependency on external debt has also resulted in adequate interest coverage ratio for the review period. Low gearing gives financial flexibility to the Company to raise additional funds for future capex plans.
Efficient working capital management coupled with adequate liquidity

The Company?s working capital cycle remained moderate between 60-90 days during the review period. The Company managed its working capital requirements efficiently through payables, internal accruals which led to low reliance on external debt. In FY 2019, there is a marginal decline in working capital cycle on the back of decline in collection, inventory and at the same time decline in payable period. The net cash accruals of the Company have also been adequate at INR 878,395 thousand against short term debt obligations of 692,309 thousand in FY 2019. Further, with improved working capital cycle, the Company?s liquidity profile improved during the review period on account of reduction in short term borrowings which in-turn led to improvement in current ratio.
Established player in e-Governance solution with proven track record of order execution

The Company is in the business of providing e-governance software and solutions since 1998 and has established its presence in B2G market through thorough insights in implementing and institutionalizing e-Governance in the Indian context. This is evident from the various proven and sustained e-Governance solutions implemented by the Company, of which few of the major ones are highlighted below:
Developing web portal for setting up a centralized reservation system for Maharashtra Tourism Development Corporation (MTDC)
Implementation of MAINet? solution across all 231 ULBs in the state of Maharashtra
Accrual based double entry accounting for Cantonment Board (Defense)

The Company has executed these projects on standalone basis as well as in consortium with IT giants like Siemens Limited, HCL Technologies Limited, amongst others. As informed by the management, the Company has pending order book position of INR 215 crore as on September 2019. Also, it has order worth INR 15 crore in hand for which Company won the tender, but finalization of contract terms is pending.
System Integrator for supply, implementation and support of 5D digital project management platform for Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation Limited worth ~INR 122 crore
Implementation of integrated ERP solutions for Thane Smart City Project worth ~INR 14 crore
Complete e-governance and ERP scope for Aligarh Smart City Project worth ~INR 14 crore
Complete e-governance and ERP scope for Dehradun Smart City Project worth ~INR 16 crore
SAP Implementation for Orissa Power Utility worth ~INR 15 crore
Implementation and management of BhawanSewa Portal & associated activities under building plan management in ULBs of Chhattisgarh for State Urban Development Agency worth ~INR10 crore
State wide implementation and support of e-nagarpalika solution across Madhya Pradesh worth ~INR 14 crore.

Thus, the presence of the Company in e-governance segment under IT industry for around two decades together with proven track record of successful implementation of the projects provides revenue visibility to the Company.
Strong financial profile marked by unleveraged capital structure and adequate liquidity position

The financial profile of the Company remained strong backed by its unleveraged capital structure and healthy interest coverage ratio. The Company was debt free coupled with its adequate liquidity position. Its adequate liquidity position was backed by cash balance which stood at INR 348,843 thousand (including fixed deposits and margin money deposits) as on 31st March 2019. This coupled with surplus parked in mutual funds amounting INR 417,406 thousand as against total payables of INR 9,143 thousand also supports the liquidity of the Company.
Operational support and synergy derived from the Agility Group enables it to provide end-to-end freight solutions across industries

Agility offers air and ocean freight forwarding, warehousing & distribution and specialized services in project, pharma and chemical logistics amongst others. The Company manages its logistic activities through leased warehouses, owned fleet of vehicles and third-party transporters.

Agility Logistics Private Limited is a part of the multinational ?Agility Group?. Established in 1979, the Agility Group is based in Kuwait with ~500 offices spread across ~100 countries. It is an integrated logistics provider with over 22,000 employees. The Group is organized into two business segments: the logistic and related services segment provides logistics offering to its clients, including freight forwarding, transportation, contract logistics, project logistics and fairs and events logistics, and the Infrastructure segment provides other services, which include industrial real estate airport and airplane ground handling and cleaning services, customs consulting, private equity and waste recycling.

Agility operates under the logistic vertical of the Group and provides customized solutions in freight management. With the help of Group companies, the Company operates as an integrated freight forwarding service provider. Also, the Company is benefitted from the wide established network of the Group within the country with presence in nearly all the major port (10 ports) in India.

Further, the Company has consistently received financial support in the form of equity infusion and issue of debentures from the Group. Financial funding from Group supports the Company to manage its working capital requirement reducing the Company?s reliance on external debt.

Further, the Company is managed by chief operating officer and whole-time director - Mr. Ventkitachalam Krishnakumar who has a vast industry experience of more than two decades. Mr. Krishnakumar is ably supported by experienced board members and second tier management who regulate the day-to-day operations of the Company. Long standing presence in the industry has helped the Company establish strong relationships with its customer and has enabled cross selling of solutions to Group company clients. Strong business relationships with clients provides the Company a stable and diversified revenue stream and procure recurring orders thereby providing revenue visibility.

The Company?s reliance on external borrowings remained low. Its debt equity ratio remained below unity and stood at 0.21 times as on 31st March 2018. Debt comprised compulsory convertible debentures with an interest rate of 11.25% issued to Group company indicating zero reliance on external debt for funding operations of the Company. Further, though collection period is high, it is primarily funded through extended creditor days. Moreover, the financial support from the Group is also visible in the form of infusion of funds by holding company in the form of equity and debentures during the review period. This funding has helped the Company in repaying its debt obligations and managing its working capital and capital expenditure. On the back of lower debt, Company?s interest coverage ratio remained uneven and stood adequate at 3.45 times during FY 2018. Furthermore, Company?s liquidity position improved and remained adequate with increasing cash accruals sufficient to meet its maturing debt obligations and current ratio of 1.54 times as on 31st March 2018. Lower dependence on external borrowings provides financial flexibility to the Company to leverage further in case of any business exigencies or to fund its incremental working capital requirements.
Well-diversified product portfolio across therapeutic segments coupled with wide geographical reach

The Company has a long track record of more than 4 decades which corroborates its ability to survive economic and business cycles as well as its execution and networking capabilities. Being in the industry for more than four decades and backed by the strong research and development capabilities, the Company has created a product basket of more than 400 products with more than 1,700 product registration in the emerging markets. Ajanta?s focus on innovation through its strong R&D capabilities has enabled it to penetrate the market with more ?first to market? launches in the specialty product portfolio The Company caters to various therapeutic segments which include anti- malarial, cardiology, dermatology, male erectile dysfunction, ophthalmology, musculoskeletal, respiratory, and others having emphasis on ophthalmology, dermatology, cardiology and pain management across various dosage forms including tablets, capsules, liquids, injectable, powder and ointment. Apart from the focus on these therapeutic segments, it has developed some niche products in other areas as well viz. bile acid-induced diseases, gastric acid-related diseases, gout, muscle relaxant, pain and inflammation, constipation, neuropathic pain, nausea & vomiting, and vertigo.

Ajanta caters to domestic as well as international market with the latter contributing about 66% of the total revenue in FY 2019. It has a wide geographical base spreading across 30 countries which includes emerging markets such as India, Africa, Middle East, Latin America and others as well as regulated markets (USA) along with more than 3,000 marketing representatives to promote its products. As informed, none of the country contributed more than 5% to the topline. Continued innovation coupled with penetration into newer geographies will help the Company to scale up its operations over the near to medium term.

Ajanta was formed in 1973 by the Agrawal family and is the flagship Company of the Ajanta group. The Company is currently led by second generation entrepreneurs Mr. Yogesh Agrawal, Managing Director and Mr. Rajesh Agrawal, Joint Managing Director, who have an experience of more than two decades in the pharmaceutical industry. They have re-invented the business by focusing on niche therapies and launching first-to-market products in India. This has helped the Company to establish a healthy market position in the domestic market. The long-standing presence of the Managing Directors in the industry has helped the Company to establish a healthy relationship with its customers and suppliers, thus resulting in repeat orders and ease in the sourcing of raw materials. With the focus on profitability, it has been able to generate profits adequately y-o-y.

As informed, Ajanta is the 4th largest pharmaceutical Company is Franco Africa (Mauritania, Senegal, Mali, French Guinea, Ivory Coast, Burkina Faso), Benin and Niger) and 17th largest pharmaceutical Company in Philippines.

Experienced management provides comfort that the Company would be able to carry out its R&D initiatives more effectively to continuously expand its product portfolio. The Company would continue to benefit from the extensive industry experience of promoters which could help on scaling up the operations going forward.
Strong in-house research and development capabilities along with accredited manufacturing facilities

Ajanta, engaged in manufacturing of pharmaceutical products, has seven manufacturing facilities (6 in India and 1 in Mauritius). As informed, the facilities are well- equipped and certified with USFDA, Brazil ANVISA, and WHO certifications. Also, it has recently commissioned facility in Dahej and Guwahati. Plant in Dahej has been commissioned with USFDA certification. Dahej plant, which will help Ajanta to expand its generic business in the US and emerging markets, is already complete and is undergoing product registration processes. Ramp up is expected by FY 2021. The new Guwahati plant will focus on its key branded generic therapeutic segments of dermatology (commissioned in March 2018), ophthalmology (commission planned by end of Q3 FY 2020), and a set up for manufacturing larger dosages for oral dosages (by Q1 FY 2021). Current capacity utilization at Dahej and Guwahati facilities are in the range of 15-20% and these capacities will start operating at optimal capacity from FY 2021. Negative impact is higher opex cost but at the same time it will give access to emerging markets for few drugs as it will allow direct inspection of its facilities. Earlier, since manufacturing was on loan licensing it could not cater to those products or product sub segments where the client?s demanded high degree of facility inspection. Once operating leverage kicks in from these plants, the bottom line will improve.

The Company has in-house R&D center which undertakes research and development for formulations and Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API?s). It has a team of more than 750 scientists developing novel formulations. R&D center is further divided into regional teams which focus on the respective markets. The R&D activities have helped the Company to launch new products y-o-y basis across different therapeutic segments, especially in the emerging markets. In the last 10 years, it has launched 160+ first-to-market products in India. The Company?s R&D expenses increased substantially to around 13.61% of the total revenue during FY 2019 against 9% in the preceding year. Ajanta launched 25 new products in the market in FY 2019, 6 new products launched and commercialized in US market, 13 New ANDAs filed with US Food and Drug Administration (FDA), 6 APIs are ready for scale-up at the plant for the regulated market, etc. It also launched 7 products in domestic formulations in FY 2019, which enjoyed the first-to-market advantage. Further, It launched 35 new products in Rest of Asia & Africa markets during FY 2019.

The R&D Centre of the Company is recognized by the Department of Scientific & Industrial Research, Ministry of Science and Technology, Government of India. R&D achievements are in the anti-malarial segment with its flagship brand, ?Artefan? which has been pre-qualified by the World Health Organization (WHO), Geneva. Other key brands include Kamagra (Sildenafil Citrate) & Apcalis-SX (Tadalafil), both used in the treatment of Male Erectile Dysfunction, Met XL in cardiology segment and others.
Thus, a strong R&D base will help the Company to further expand its product basket and compete with other large multinational and domestic companies.

The Company?s financial risk profile is supported by low leverage and strong debt protection measures, marked by a gearing of 0.01 times as on 31st March 2019. Majority of its capital expenditure and working capital requirements are met through internal accruals which coupled with healthy net worth base, resulted in low reliance on external borrowings. A lower debt component when compared with Company?s healthy tangible networth would provide the Group financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Further, low existing debt exposure makes the Group more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of the ability of the Company to service the loan. Low debt resulted in minimal interest expenditure thereby reducing the fixed obligations. Thus, almost debt-free capital structure will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.

The Company has a customer base spread across the globe and its strong and established customer base has resulted in low collection cycle. The Company?s receivable days have been in the range of 66 to 90 days during the review period. The inventory days of the Company remained at around 126 days on an average for last three years. In spite of higher levels of inventory (and hence higher working capital), the Company?s working capital requirements were largely funded through extended credit from suppliers and advance from customers resulting in low dependency on borrowings. As informed, inventory holding increased on account of increased penetration in US market where the inventory requirement is high, and the Company is increasing product launches there.

Efficient management of working capital is also reflected in adequate liquidity position of the Company as witnessed in current ratio and quick ratio which stood at 3.42 times and 2.04 times as on 31st March 2019. Further, cash flow from operating activities stood positive throughout the review period and the Company had adequate cash and cash equivalents of INR 351,200 thousand and current investment of INR 647,400 thousand as on 31st March 2019.
Furthermore, strong accruals of the Company led to y-o-y decline in its external borrowings; despite continuous capex and R&D plans undertaken by the Company.

On the back of new launches, the Company has been able to register healthy profitability margins. Despite pressure of increased overheads emanating from commissioning of two new plants and decline in institutional sales, operating and net margins remained comfortable above 20% in FY 2019. Adequate margins led to sufficient returns over the review period as shown in table below:

However, slowdown in margins and relatively tepid sales in FY 2018 and FY 2019, owing to capex related expenditure where operating leverage is yet to kick in (current capacity utilisation at Dahej and Guwahati facilities are in the range of 15-20%) coupled with penetration in the USA market where Company is present in generics segment which fetches relatively lower margins. Also, institutional sales in Africa declined sharply (from 22% of the total revenue in FY 2017 to 9% in FY 2019). This is on account of lower volumes and offtake in institutional sales business (as Global Funds (wing of WHO) received lower donations) and hence procurements have reduced. This also impacted the margins apart from revenue pressure. Further, as informed, Company estimates margin to remain on similar lines for FY 2020 and it will improve from FY 2021. Current capacity utilization at Dahej and Guwahati facilities is 15-20%.This is expected to improve over the medium term once the new plant starts operating at reasonable capacity. Further, net margins are expected to get a benefit of 100% tax exemption available on Dahej and Guwahati plant for 5 and 10 years respectively.
Experienced management reflecting from rapid scale-up of operations through wide product portfolio and well expanded infrastructure

Established by Mr. Sanjeev Jain and Mr. Sandeep Jain under the guidance of their father Mr. D C Jain, Akums Group has rapidly scaled up to become one of the largest formulations development and contract manufacturer in the country to achieve a turnover of ~INR 20,000,000 crore since inception. The promoters have been instrumental in this journey where along with their qualified and experienced team of professional management, the promoters have constantly developed additional formulations while building capacities. Till date, the Group has obtained 704 DCGI approvals, obtained 329 FSSAI approvals and filed for 62 process patents (2 granted). In the exports market, the Akums Group has registered more than a 1,300 dossiers till date and expects to increase its revenue from exports in the years to come.

The Group has 9 manufacturing plants manufacturing almost all forms of dosages including tablets, hard gelatin capsules, soft gelatin capsules, powder in sachets, liquid syrups and suspensions, injections, eye/ear drops, ointments, creams, gels, lotions, etc. The Group has dedicated plants for manufacture of nutraceuticals/ayurvedic formulations and also for antibiotics along with several plants for solid and liquid dosages and injectables. Further, besides the R&D centres in each of its plants, the Group has a centralized R&D centre and a centralized large stability chamber as also a warehouse to facilitate efficient storage. The strong experience of the promoters has thus helped the Group to form a strong and diversified product profile catering to numerous therapeutic segments through its development and manufacturing capabilities. This ensures y-o-y revenue visibility for the Group.
One of the largest contract manufacturer in India with large and reputed client base and regulatory approvals from several semi-regulated markets

The Group has 9 manufacturing facilities catering to different segments and has formed a large customer base comprising majority of the strong pharmaceutical players in India. Some of its customers include Abbott Healthcare Private Limited, Abbott India Limited, Cipla Limited, Blue CrossÿLaboratories Private Limited, Lupin Limited, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Limited, Mankind Pharma Limited, Torrent PharmaceuticalsÿLimited, Dr.ÿReddy'sÿLaboratories Limited, Akumentis Healthcare Limited, IPCA Laboratories Limited, etc. The Group operates on a model where it develops formulations, takes approval for the same from DCGI and then offers the products to various pharmaceutical companies (customers). This offers the Group an advantage where its customers cannot easily defect to other players in the market for these products as the development technology for the product remains with the Group. Further, Akum sources its API and other raw material requirements from renowned players like Abbott India Limited, Nectar Lifesciences Limited, Sterile India Private Limited, Pfizer Service Company Bvba, etc.

Further, the Group has obtained various approvals and certifications. The Group?s manufacturing facilities have been approved by regulatory bodies of various countries including ANVISA - Brazil; NAFDAC - Nigeria; FDB Ghana; PMPB - Malawi; MOH - Libya; MOH - Cambodia; DDA - Nepal; CD&DA - Sri Lanka; MOH - Vietnam; NDA - Uganda, PPB - Kenya, MOH - Belarus; DPM - Ivory Coast, etc. Further, the Group has obtained more than 704 New Drug Approvals from DCGI, 329 FSSAI approvals and filed 62 process patents (2 have been approved).

The manufacturing and R&D facilities of the Group have been accredited with WHO ? GMP, ISO 9001:2008, ISO 14001:2004, ISO 17025:2004, GLP and QMS ? HACCP, GMP - Ayush certificates, which have been instituted and awarded by international bodies. The Group observes Global Standards as per ICH, SHE as well as Industrial hygiene and good environmental control. The Group has strong product quality review system and conducts stability studies to ensure quality till shelf life. Further, the Group?s R&D facilities have been approved by Government of India, DSIR. The market credibility combined with the manufacturing capabilities and the registrations obtained are expected to continue and aid the Group in improving its scale and reach in the future.

The capital structure of the Group remained comfortable throughout the review period as total debt equity ratio stood at 0.31 times as on 31st March 2019. Despite the presence of various entities which required funding for capital expenditure as well as for working capital requirements, the Group has been able to fund its requirements mainly through internal accruals while keeping the external borrowings at a comfortable level. The same is apparent in the interest coverage ratio which, though declined during FY 2019, has remained comfortable at 7.05 times during the year despite decline in profitability. Further, the current portion of long-term debt due in FY 2020 stood at INR 420,987 thousand against net cash accruals of INR 1,240,050 thousand during FY 2019.

As on 31st March 2019, the current and quick ratios of the Group remained moderate at 1.59 times and 1.07 times respectively. However, the net cash flow from operating activities remained negative at INR 2,272,020 thousand during the year due to increase in working capital requirements driven by increase in receivables and reduction in payables as on year end. As informed, the external borrowings of the Group vary as per its liquidity position which is in turn governed by its capex and working capital requirements. Accordingly, the total debt of the Group has increased in FY 2019 due to increased working capital requirement. Despite this, the capital structure has remained comfortable.

However, going ahead, the Group has several expansion plans including the acquisition of PDL for a consideration of ~INR 1,000,000 thousand to be paid in three tranches (INR 150,000 thousand + INR 150,000 thousand + INR 700,000 thousand) in three years. Further, the Group will also need additional funds to clear the liabilities on the books of PDL. Besides this, the Group also has other expansion plans to be executed through existing subsidiaries which would require additional liquidity. The ability of the Company to maintain its capital structure in the midst of its expansion plans will also remain critical.
Experienced management and strong track record of over four decades in the capacitor industry

Established in 1978, the Company has a track record of more than four decades of operation. Further, since inception the Company has operated under the leadership of Mr. Anup Sachdev, (Chairman and Managing Director) who oversees all functional aspects including corporate strategy and growth of the Company. Mr. Sachdev has an experience of more than four decades in electronics industry. Such relevant experience facilitates in sound business decision making and increase in overall performance of the Company. Moreover, the day-to-day operations of the Company are managed by Mr. Siddharth Anup Sachdev who forms the next line of succession and has been working with the Company since 2004. After nearly 14 years of experience with the Company, Mr. Siddharth has been appointed as the Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director in April 2018. The Company in the last few years has diversified as apparent in the scale-up in film capacitors division in FY 2015 and launch of other new products which has driven growth by a CAGR of 17.08% during the review period. The leadership team and the strong track record of the Company has also helped the Company garner various established customers across sectors.
Established presence in the capacitor industry with reputed and leading customers across industries

With more than four decades of presence in capacitors industry, the Company has established itself as a qualified component supplier and a customized product manufacturer for power electronics industry.

The Company manufactures capacitors used across the power electronics industry in applications including UPS systems & AC drives, railway applications including electric vehicle charging, resonant converters and auxiliary converters, MRI and X-ray system for healthcare, telecommunications and renewable energy systems. During recent years, the Company has also focused on manufacturing custom designed capacitors, which find application in wind and solar energy, defense and industrial electronic equipment like welding and pulse magnetizing. Due to this wide range of products used across industries, it has been able to garner reputed customers including Wipro ? General Electric Healthcare Private Limited, ABB Limited, Siemens ? Gamesa, Toshiba- Mitsubishi, Emerson (Vertiv Energy) without specific customer or sectoral concentration.

Further, the capacitors manufactured find application in components which require high level of precision and quality adherence by the manufacturer along with appropriate supply chain arrangement. Accordingly, there is high level of co-ordination between Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and the component manufacturers. In addition, as informed by the management since there is high switching cost the demand for component is normally seen till the end of the product lifecycle. This helps the Company to form a deeper relationship with the customer and thus increase the switching costs for the client.

The profitability margins of the Company have improved during the review period aided by addition of new products yielding higher margins and increased contribution of exports to overall revenue. The profitability ratios shown were also affected by high depreciation expenses as seen from the OPBDIT margin linked to addition of new capacity during the review period. The impact of the higher margins film capacitors product line can be seen from the reducing cost of raw materials and finished goods consumed as a percentage of revenue from 56.6% in FY 2017 to 53.52% in FY 2018. Further, the healthy accretion to reserves have helped control the dependence on external working capital borrowings leading to an adequate capital structure supported by adequate debt protection indicators. Despite the increase in both external long term as well as short term borrowing, the gearing of the Company stood below unity at 0.75 times as on 31st March 2019. Moreover, the interest coverage ratio remained strong at 6.54 times for FY 2019, exhibiting ability to take in additional leverage if required.
Robust R&D and continuous product launches resulting in strong product pipeline and ANDA filings

The Company has an in-house R&D centre which undertakes research and development of generic drugs and formulations. The R&D activities have helped the Company to launch new products y-o-y basis, especially in the regulated markets. During FY 2019, Alembic filed for 29 ANDA (Abbreviated new drug applications) in the United States of America.

Strong R&D activities have helped the Company to grow its topline at a CAGR of 15.69% during the review period. The Company is currently working on more than 235 new R&D projects. Alembic has robust pipeline of 72 ANDAs under various stages of approval and more than 122 filings in other regulated markets. The Company has also entered into JV with Orbicular Pharmaceuticals Private Limited. This alliance enabled the Company to venture in dermatology segment. Moreover, it has entered into a Joint Venture Agreement with SPH SINE Pharmaceutical Laboratories Co Ltd, China & Adia (Shanghai) Pharma Co Ltd, China to promote and sell pharmaceutical products for the Chinese market.

Its cumulative Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) filing stood at 161 and has received 89 approvals till 31st March 2019 including 12 in tentative stage. Out of the 161 ANDAs, the Company filed 29 Abbreviated New Drug Applications (ANDAs) in FY 2019. As of 31st March 2019, the Company has filed for 689 patents for Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) and Intermediates as well as 285 patents for formulations.
Alembic?s robust R&D activities have resulted in its large product portfolio with around 185 brands for domestic market, largely treating to chronic therapeutic segment.
Extensive promoter experience coupled with reputed clientele base

The management of the Company has a strong and vast industry experience. Mr. Chirayu Ramanbhai Amin, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, has more than five decades of experience in the pharmaceutical field. Other board members too are well qualified and have relevant industry experience. Long-standing experience of the promoters in the business has helped the Company to establish strong market position in the domestic formulations market. The Company?s established market position is supported by its diversified product basket comprising of around 185 brands. The holistic approach towards quality and strict adherence of compliance norms laid by regulators has led to regular approvals of facilities and products of the Company from various regulatory bodies.

Furthermore, the promoters? presence in the industry has helped the Company to establish healthy relationship of around a decade with reputed customers in international market like Trigen Laboratories LLC, Pfizer Asia Manufacturing Pte Ltd. amongst others. This ensures repeat orders from them. For domestic market, it has established strong marketing team of more than 5,000 employees to facilitate reach on PAN India basis. This is reflected in the Company?s compounded annual growth rate of 15.69% for the five years ended FY 2019. Established customer relationship, established market position and promoters? extensive experience will help the Company to sustain its business risk profile.
Comfortable financial profile and adequate liquidity along with moderate margins

The Company?s financial risk profile has remained healthy supported by its comfortable capital structure and debt protection indicators. Its tangible networth was INR 27,124,100 thousand as on 31st March 2019, backed by its healthy accretions to reserves, resulting from its adequate profitability levels. Healthy networth coupled with effective management of the working capital requirements have resulted in low reliance on external debt throughout the review period.

The Company has a customer base spread across the globe and its strong and established customer base has resulted in low collection cycle. The Company?s receivable days have been in the range of 47 to 80 days during the review period. The inventory days of the Company remained at around 146 days on an average for last three years. In spite of higher levels of inventory (and hence higher working capital), the Company?s working capital requirements were largely funded through extended credit from suppliers and advance from customers resulting in low dependency on borrowings.

Furthermore, strong accruals of the Company led to y-o-y decline in its external borrowings; despite continuous capex and R&D plans undertaken by the Company. The Company stood debt free as on year end FY 2017. However, in FY 2018 the gearing increased to 0.29 times due to increase in long term borrowing for R&D activities and short term loans for working capital management. It increased further to 0.39 times in FY 2019 owing to unsecured commercial paper availed. Low debt along with adequate profitability led to comfortable interest coverage ratio as shown in table below:

Revenue of the Company increased by 23.94% in FY 2019 on account of 48% increase in international generics segment, 18% increase in API segment, and 9% increase in domestic branded segment. Growth in international generic segment was driven as the Company was able to capitalize on the shortage of hypertension drug, Valsartan in the USA. Along with the Company?s sound financial and adequate liquidity, its profitability also remained adequate, despite a fluctuation. The margins remained in the range of 14% to 17%; except for FY 2016, where the margins were high on account of launch of Abilify drug. Despite the pricing pressure on both the international and domestic markets and increase in R&D expenses, the Company has been able to protect its margins based on the launch of new products and targeting new therapeutic segments.
Thus, improving margins and scaling up remains critical for the Company.
Long track record of experienced management facilitating wide presence in the domestic market and well-established client base in turn supporting topline growth

The Company is currently led by Mr. Ashok Kumar Rameshwar Lal Jhanwar and Mr. Rajendra Prasad Jhanwar, who have an experience of more than four decades in the petrochemical business. Domain knowledge and experience of the promoters and the management team provided the Company with a significant competitive advantage to grow in the domestic market and enter new geographies. This extensive experience of management and their track record in driving the Company?s growth till date provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company which would help in driving the growth of business. A good track record of growing revenues y-o-y with no instance of revenue declines reflects the strength of the business model and management capabilities.

The Company has three branches each in Ahmedabad, New Delhi, and Hyderabad apart from its corporate office in Mumbai to cater to its customers spread across India. Moreover, it has set-up customer relationship management (CRM) in FY 2019 to manage its wide client base of 1,200 customers and increase customer engagement through efficient management. It has 50-60 customers with whom it has an established relationship. The aforementioned factors have resulted in strong topline growth of over 30% in the past two years. The Company has already recorded INR 180 crore until September 2018 and targets to continue with the same growth momentum in FY 2019 as well.
Diverse product portfolio to provide stable revenue stream

The Company has a diversified portfolio within petrochemicals which account for approx. 90% of the total revenue. Further, since the past four years, the Company has diversified into wood based products to support its topline and improve its bottom-line. It opened a showroom for veneer and allied products and has plans to expand this business with a couple of more showrooms in the medium term. This move is a lateral diversification from chemicals, adhesives and resins used in the wood industry to the trading of wood panels to retail showroom of veneers. With its wide range of traded goods, the Company caters to a diverse range of industries like refineries, fertilizers, power plants, pharmaceuticals, paint, explosives, dyes, plywood/particle board, agro, etc.

Diversified product portfolio and their application in varied industries coupled with positive growth prospects of the domestic petrochemical industry would ensure that the revenue stream of the Company is insulated from the slowdown in demand.

Diversified product portfolio is expected to sustain and further improve the Company?s scale of operations as the Company can appeal to a larger customer base with an enhanced offering. Further wide end-user industry application provides comfort from the fact that the Company?s revenues are not largely impacted by the cyclical downtrend suffered in any one end-use industry.

The Company is led by, Chairman and Managing Director, Mr. Rajarathinasamy Baskaran who has more than two and a half decades of experience in the steel casting and valve manufacturing business. The Chairman is also supported by Mr. Baskaran Anandkumar, Joint Managing Director who holds a degree in Master in Business Administration and also has more than two decades of experience in the related field. This relevant experience and business networking of the managing directors help to drive the business of the Company. Mr. Baskaran has been felicitated with Certificate of Excellence in recognition of Sterling Merit Excellent Performance and Outstanding contribution for the progress of the Nation and Worldwide by Global Achievers Foundation. Under this leadership, the Company has tackled downturns and unforeseen circumstances to continue and normalize operations. The Managing Directors are also ably supported by other directors and a managerial team who are equally qualified and have extensive business experiences thereby providing comfort over the execution capabilities. This extensive experience of management and their ability in driving the Company?s growth till date provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company which would help in driving the growth of business.
Diversified product portfolio coupled with established relationship with customers driving business growth

The Company is engaged in the production of industrial valve castings. It manufactures castings mainly for gate valve, globe valve, swing check valve, strainer valve, control valve, knife gate valve, safety relief valve, ball valve, butterfly valve, plug valve and flame arrester valve. It also manufactures various types of valve components which include valve body, valve bonnet, yoke, yoke cum bonnet, wedge, seat ring, plug cage, safety relief valves body, etc. As informed, majority of its revenue is contributed from sale of valve body, valve bonnet, yoke and wedge products. The castings are supplied to valve manufacturers who cater to general engineering, petroleum, power, chemical and oil & gas industries. As informed, the Company supplies majorly to oil & gas and chemical industries which contributes to more than 75% to the total revenue. Diversified product portfolio is expected to sustain and further improve the Entity?s scale of operations as the Company can appeal to a larger customer base with an enhanced offering. Wide end-user industry application also provides safety from cyclical downtrend suffered in an industry. Hence, comfort can be taken from the fact that its revenues are not largely impacted by the cyclical downtrend suffered in any one end-use industry.

The Company?s customer base includes Samson Group, Xomox International GmbH & Co. OHG, Phonix Armaturen-werke Bregel GmbH, amongst others. The Company has a strong business relationship of more than 15 years with these customers; which has helped it gain y-o-y repeat orders. Established relationship of credible customers providing repeat orders to the Company ensures steady revenue visibility for the future and mitigates the risk of realization from debtors.
Strong capital structure provides greater financial flexibility and has resulted in a healthy liquidity profile

The Company?s financial risk profile is strengthened by low leverage metrics and strong debt protection measures throughout the review period. Driven by a business model relying majorly on internal cash accruals for its working capital requirement has enabled the Company to considerably have lower dependence on short term borrowings to fund the working capital requirements thereby resulting in negligible debt to equity ratio during the review period. Further, the Company had healthy net cash accruals during the review period which enabled the Company to fund its capex primarily from internal accruals and with modest external debt funding. Liquidity is further bolstered by modest solvency ratio (current ratio and quick ratio of 2.56 and 1.62 times as on FY 2019) during the review period. Further, the Company?s net cash accruals remained comfortable and exhibited an improving trend in FY 2019; with adequate cash and bank balances of INR 36,948 thousand as on 31st March 2019.

A lower debt component when compared with Company?s healthy tangible networth would provide the Company financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Further, low existing debt exposure makes the Company more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of the ability of the Company to service the loan. Furthermore, low reliance on external debt has led to low incidence of interest costs has resulted in comfortable interest coverage ratio of 28.41 times in FY 2019 thereby indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations. Thus, a low debt-equity ratio will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.

The Company manufactures as well as trades in menthol and allied products which find application in the fragrance and flavour industry. It manufactures menthol crystals, menthol flakes, peppermint oil, spearmint oil, and other products as well as trades in essential oils such as basil oil, camphor, citerita, linseed oil, palmarosa oil, lemongrass oil and others. It has a portfolio of more than 40 products which are manufactured and traded. These products find application across industries which primarily includes fragrance and flavour along with pharmaceuticals, tobacco and others of which flavour and fragrance industry accounts for around 70% of the revenue while pharmaceutical and tobacco accounts for 20% and 10% respectively. These wide offerings have helped the Company to cater to demand across various industries resulting in y-o-y improvement in its scale of operations as reflected in the compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of around 47% over the five-year period ending FY 2019.
Adequate financial profile with lowering of debt resulting from prudent management of working capital requirements

The Company?s financial profile remained adequate marked by moderate debt levels and improving tangible networth supported by retention of entire profits in the business. The lowering of debt was on account of improvement in working capital requirements during the review period. The working capital cycle of the Company improved from 122 days as on 31st March 2015 to 39 days as on 31st March 2019 backed by good collection cycle and low inventory holding. The harvest season for the raw material is commences from June wherein the Company stocks inventory and therefore the inventory level in March is low. As informed, the Company holds inventory of around one to one and half month.
The working capital requirements have been funded through bank borrowings, advances from customers, creditors and net cash accruals generated by the Company.

With increasing tangible networth and repayment of unsecured loans driven by low incremental capital expenditure and working capital requirements, its capital structure remained in the range of 0.62 times to 1.14 times over the five year period. The total debt majorly included unsecured loans which have been repaid entirely during the review period. With moderate debt levels and improvement in profitability during FY 2019, the interest coverage substantially increased during the same period.

Although the Company has capex plans to the tune of INR 3 crore, the same are expected to be funded through internal accruals. With increasing scale of operations, it remains critical for the Company to prudently manage its working capital requirements to lower its dependence on borrowings.
Extensive experience of management resulting in established relationship with customers and suppliers

The Company was promoted by Mr. Arvind Kumar Arora who has been in the business of manufacturing and trading of aroma chemicals/ speciality chemicals for more than four decades. His long-standing presence in the industry has helped the Company to establish good relationships with customers and suppliers thus ensuring repeat business and ease in souring of materials. The Company has set up six collection centers for sourcing of raw materials (mentha oil) from farmers and stockists and traders. It has also been able to penetrate into different geographies of USA, China, Germany, France, Spain, Singapore and others to tap the demands of international players. Some of its customers include Atlantic Chemical Trading Co., Hetero Labs Limited, The Himalaya Drug Company, Essex Laboratories LLC., and others. The extensive experience and understanding on the industry dynamics is expected to benefit the Company to further improve and sustain its business profile over the medium to long term.
Wide product offering with large customer/supplier base supporting revenue growth

The Company trades in over 1,800 F&F ingredients and maintains stock of ~900 products at any given point in time. Further, the Company can cater to varying order quantities ranging from 100 grams to 100 MT requirements where smaller orders are catered through repackaging undertaken by the Company while the larger orders are shipped in barrels or even containers depending on the customer requirement. The Company currently has packing and distribution centers in Mumbai. It makes the products available as per the customer requirement. The customers comprise a mix of F&F and FMCG manufacturers along with traders, wholesalers and retailers.

The Company also has a good pan India reach. As the Company keeps a wide range of ingredients and maintains a 2-2.5 month stock of products, it is preferred vendor to many of its customers. It supplies to over 800 customers with about 50% of revenues from top 25 customers indicating low customer concentration risk. Some of its top customers include Khattri Perfumers Private Limited, Keva Group, Karomas Aromatics, N R Aromas Group, Amar Trading House amongst others. It also deals with ~90 suppliers/principals including the manufacturers like Eternis Fine Chemicals Limited, Tide Industries, Privi Organics Limited, Jiaxing Shengyuan Imp & Exp Co. Ltd., NHU (Hongkong) Trading Company Limited amongst others. Pan India presence, long established relations with suppliers and customers and its wide product offering along with the fast growing FMCG market has supported revenue growth with a CAGR of ~26% during the last three year period.
Improvement in the gearing ratio and high interest coverage provides financial flexibility

The Company?s gearing level improved from 1.11 times as on 31st March 2017 to 0.28 times as on 31st March 2019. Strong revenue growth along with increasing profitability led to low dependence on external debt. Further, about 74% of the total debt is advanced by the promoters. On exclusion of promoter?s debt, the total gearing would reduce to less than 1 throughout the review period. Also, as informed, the Company has repaid almost all its debt as on date further improving the capital structure. Low gearing level provides financial flexibility to Company to raise funds as and when required.

Furthermore, a comfortable capital structure and improved profitability has led to y-o-y increase in interest coverage ratio. Interest coverage remained comfortable at 13.90 times as on 31st March 2019.

The Company?s gross margins increased significantly from 9.71% in FY 2017 to 15.40% in FY 2019. As informed, the Company deals in wide variety of aroma chemicals/essential oils, which yield good margins.

In FY 2019 and FY 2018, the Company reported substantial gross margin of ~15-16% vis-a-vis earlier years due to spike in the prices (wherein prices of some products witnesses a threefold increase) caused by temporary market disruptions. The accidental shutdown of the key plants of big F&F manufacturers led to this abnormal price increase. The Company?s ability to maintain a large stock (through its custom bonded warehouse) enabled it to take advantage of the price spike seen in F&F chemicals which led to the high margins in FY 2018 and FY 2019. The increased prices of some chemicals are expected to normalize over the next year leading to normalized profitability in FY 2020. Nevertheless, the net profitability would continue to remain adequate at about 5% because of the nature of products traded and the reduced interest cost due to minimized external borrowings. Further, the high prices also led to increased revenue during FY 2018 and FY 2019. With normalization in FY 2020, the revenue of the Company is expected to moderate as well. As informed, the Company has recorded revenue of INR 1,960,000 thousand in H1 FY 2019 and targets a revenue in excess of INR 3,500,000 thousand in FY 2020.

High profitability (considering the trading nature) and low capital requirement led to high return ratios. with ROTNW (Return on Tangible Net Worth) and Return on Capital Employed (ROCE) at about 35% and 46% respectively as on 31st March 2019. The key profit margins and return ratios are shown below:
Experienced management and established relations with the customers and suppliers

The Company is managed and controlled by Mr. Ajaykiran Gudka, Managing Director who has an experience of around three decades in the related field of business. Further, he is supported by Mr. Nayan Gudka who has similar experience in the industry. The vast experience of the promoters has helped the Company expand its product portfolio. The Company offers more than 1,800 products of which ~900 products are on shelf at any given point in time. As informed, the Company maintains stock of about INR 800,000 thousand (~853 tonnes) which is equivalent to 2-2.5 months of inventory. Over the years, the management has built strong relations with its principals/suppliers and customers and same is reflected through the average length of 10 years relationship with it top 5 suppliers and customers. This relevant experience and business networking has facilitated the business of the Company and the same is reflected through y-o-y improvement in its revenue and margins.

AAPL is mainly engaged in trading. As a result, most of the Company?s sources of funds are engaged in funding its working capital requirement. The Company?s operations are working capital intensive with the inventory of 62 days and collection period of 84 days as on 31st March 2019. These requirements were mainly funded through internal cash accruals along with loans availed from directors and through supplier credit.

Further, in the absence of long term loans, the Company did not have any term loan repayment obligations against net cash accruals of INR 391,749 thousand. The high profitability of the Company further contributed to building its liquidity position. As informed, as on date, the Company has repaid almost its entire debt availed from both directors as well as banks. Moreover, the Company will continue to minimally utilize its working capital bank facilities. This will provide the Company with sufficiently flexible liquidity to manage its operations. The Company is therefore expected to maintain its comfortable liquidity position in the near term.

The Company is led by Promoter, and Director, Mr. Vitalapai Rajagopal, who has a rich industry experience of more than three decades in design and engineering services. He is also ably supported by Mr. Joegy Joseph, Director who is a part of the organisation since its inception. The directors are also aided in the efficient management of the Company by a second tier of management and staffs with high level of industry expertise and skillsets in multiple disciplines of architectural and civil designs and detailed engineering avenues.

This extensive experience of management and their track record in driving the Company?s growth till date provides comfort about the project execution and networking capabilities of the Company which would help in driving the growth of business. Further, it has also enabled them to maintain long-term relationship with client like Triton Valves Limited, Schindler India Private Limited and Rockhan Industries Limited. Furthermore, under their able leadership the Company has executed projects across India and is also well poised to undertake projects even in SAARC and middle-east countries. Also having completely recovered from the difficulties in FY 2016 the company has grown y-o-y as can be seen in the table below. The improving track record of revenue growth testifies the efficiency of the business model applied by the Company.
Enhancing business opportunities by providing value additions to traditional services

The Company provides a wide range services in the field of comprehensive design and detailed engineering services. It further provides services with a philosophy of ?Total Design? wherein it tries to collaborate all design decisions together, and integrate the whole process as a single delivery. The clients also stand to gain from this holistic approach as complete design encompassing all the nuances of a civil engineering project removes flaws and improves efficiency in the project with the involvement of lesser teams for execution of a singular project. Further the Company is also using its wide expertise and has ventured into allied activities including offering of services like survey of commercial or industrial property for making informed decisions on purchase/disposal of properties. Another important value add solution that Besten provides is in the form of procurement support and project management ensuring smooth execution of the project from inception till the close out and handover of the project. The wide bouquet of service offering ensures improved client satisfaction and increase chances of future business engagement giving Besten opportunities to enhance its operational scale.
Underleveraged capital structure marked with adequate interest coverage

Owing to the inherent service nature of the business in which Besten operates, the capex requirement is low and operations are not highly capital intensives. Besten has largely funded its operations from internal cash accrual and extended payables, reliance on bank funding for meeting its working capital requirement has been low or nil. Due to these reasons the leverage remained low throughout the review period except in FY 2016 when new vehicle loans were availed. However, with steady repayments post FY 2016 has improved the leverage and enhanced the financial flexibility. Accordingly, debt equity ratio stood at a comfortable level of 0.11 times in FY 2019. Lower debt levels entailed lower interest expenses which coupled with improved profitability resulted in comfortable interest coverage ratio of 45.75 times in FY 2019.
Improving profit margins (operating and net level) driven by improvement in scale of operations thereby resulting in high returns

Although the profitability of the Company has fluctuated during the review period; the same has improved at all levels in FY 2019 and FY 2018 (net profit margin has improved y-o-y from FY 2017 onward). The increase in project execution during the review period has helped Besten to achieve improved margins. The improvement in profitability has also helped in achieving improved and healthy returns as can be witnessed in the table below. However, overall profitability at operating level remains constrained driven by moderate scale of operations thereby resulting into underutilization of the existing resources to their fullest potential.

Further, the increased revenue has also helped in absorption of fixed and semi-variable cost over an improving revenue base leading to economies of scale and thereby improving profitability. However, sustenance of profitability and return indicators while scaling up operations will remain crucial.
Long track record and experienced and qualified management

The Company has a long track record of more than two and a half decades which indicates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. It has an experienced management team that is currently led by Mr. Bharatkumar Chhotalal Shah ? Managing Director, has more than four decades in the injection moulds and injection moulded thermoplastic components industry. The promoter intitally started with manufacturing for white good industry and subsequently expanded to tooling and manufacturing injection moulded components. Currently, it operates through 4 plants and is undertaking expansion at Sanand, Gujarat.

The Company?s operations are managed by Mr. Bharatkumar Shah and his two sons- Mr. Rahul Shah and Mr. Rushabh Shah who are into the business of rmore than 7 years. This extensive experience provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company. The long-standing experience of the management has helped the Company to build established relationships with customers and suppliers, thus ensuring repeat orders and ease in sourcing of materials. The extensive experience of the management is expected to sustain the business profile of the Company over the medium term.
Wide product portfolio coupled with established business relationship with reputed clients driving business growth

The Company has a has a wide product basket covering segments like Exterior Parts Console & Armrest Child Parts HVAC Parts, IP Parts, Pillar Trims, Roof Console Parts, Seating Parts, Door Parts and Safety Parts. A wide product portfolio helps in widening the customer base (currently its customer base comprises of 20-22 customers). This has also enabled the Company to form a business relationship with customers like Mahindra Two Wheelers Limited, Ford Motor Company, Tata AutoComp Systems Limited, DENSO Corporation, Reydel Automotive (India) Private Limited, Yanfeng India Automotive Interior Systems Private Limited, Magneti Marelli Motherson Auto System Limited, Grupo Antolin India Private Limited, Lear Automotive India Private Limited and MAHLE Engineering Services India Private Limited amongst others. The Company has a strong business relationship of more than 5 years with these customers; which has helped it gain y-o-y repeat orders. Established relationship of credible customers providing repeat orders to the Company ensures steady revenue visibility for the future and mitigates the risk of realization from debtors.
Large network of agents helps in penetrating into diversified geographies leading to robust growth during the review period

The Company has a large network of distributors and agents across nation as well as in the overseas market. As indicated, the Company has a clientele base of around 500 customers across the globe including distributors and agents. The laminating adhesives are primarily sold to the flexible packaging industries and mainly cater to FMCG companies (food segment). However, since the product does not directly come in contact with food, it is not necessary for the product to be food grade. Some of BPPL?s customers include Parle Products Private Limited, Balaji Wafers Private Limited, Uma Polymers, etc.

With large network of agents for distribution, the Company has been able to tap various geographies which includes UAE, Singapore, Nigeria, Nepal, Sri Lanka and others. Although the Company has relationship of around 2 to 6 years with its customers, it has built healthy relationship with them which has resulted in repeat business rendering revenue visibility which is reflected in Company?s growth at a CAGR of ~58% over the past three years through FY 2019. Reputed clientele base with large distribution network is expected to help the Company to further scale up its operations over the near to medium term. As informed, in FY 2020, the Company expects a growth of ~15-20% in revenue. The growth is revenue will be restricted due to the current manufacturing capacity of the plant.

Although the Company has marked a substantial growth in its top-line, the working capital requirements have been efficiently managed. The same primarily emanated from its moderate collection period of 79 days (for FY 2019) with low inventory holding of around two months. With large customer base including agents, the collection is generally within 70 to 75 days. Further, the laminating adhesives are manufactured with an average batch time of around 1-5 days, resulting in low inventory holding. As the Company operates under stock and sale model, ~43% (for FY 2019) of the total inventory constituted of finished products. These working capital requirements are funded through credit availed from suppliers and working capital funds. Part of its sourcing is also against letter of credit of 90 days which helps to fund its working capital requirements.

Further, the Company?s cash flow from operations remained positive throughout the review period. With increasing scale of operations, it remains critical for the Company to prudently manage its working capital as any incremental requirements may impact its cash flow position.
Extensive experience of the promoters in the adhesive/ solvent manufacturing industry

Established in 2011, the Company commenced its operations in 2013. The Company is managed by Dr. Ravinder Talwar and his son, Mr. Gaurav Talwar who have experience of more than four and one decade, respectively, in the adhesives and packaging industries. Dr. Ravinder Talwar who is an IIT graduate and holds doctorate in philosophy, also is on the board of Foodquest Private Limited. The long-standing presence of the promoters in the industry has helped the Company to cater to reputed clientele and build healthy relationship with its customers, resulting in repeat business which is reflected in Company?s CAGR of ~58%. Further, being in the business for more than a decade helps the promoters to have an understanding of the industry dynamics which is further expected to improve and sustain the overall business profile of the Company over near to medium term.

Cadila is operating in the pharmaceutical industry for more than three decades. The Group is engaged in manufacturing of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs), veterinary products and human formulations. It is also engaged in research, development, production, marketing and distribution of pharmaceutical products. It manufactures both formulations and API drugs for more than 45 therapeutic segments.

The Group is primarily engaged in the business of manufacturing and marketing of pharmaceutical products, both active pharmaceutical ingredients and finished dosage formulations. Cadila is also engaged in basic new drug discovery research, several other newer technology products such as transdermal and biosimilars and generic product development activities.

The Group is present in the niche consumer wellness space through its subsidiary, Zydus Wellness Limited which has three established brands, ?Sugar Free?, a low calorie sugar substitute, ?EverYuth?, a range of skincare products and ?Nutralite?, a cholesterol free table spread. In animal healthcare segment the Group launched 8 new products in India and received 25 new marketing authorizations for the export business during the year. The Group is developing a pipeline of 20 biologics, comprising 14 biosimilars and 6 novel biological products. It launched a new product namely ExemptiaTM, world?s first biosimilar of Adalimumab.
Strong R&D focus resulting in continuous product launches and strong product pipeline

The Group?s Zydus Research Centre (ZRC) spearheads the Group?s New Chemical Entity (NCE) Research. It currently conducts basic new drug discovery research in cardio-metabolic, inflammation, pain and oncology therapeutic areas.

During FY 2017, the Group initiated Phase II clinical trials of Lipaglyn in the US and received approval from the USFDA for conducting Phase II clinical trials. In FY 2017, the Group signed a collaboration agreement with Medicines for Malaria Venture (MMV) to develop investigational anti-malarial compound.

In FY 2018, the Group received the marketing approval from the regulatory authority of Mexico, COFEPRIS to commercialize Lipaglyn in Mexico, for the treatment of Dyslipidemia in patients with diabetes mellitus type 2 and Hypertriglyceridemia in patients with diabetes mellitus type 2 not controlled by statins. It also Initiated Phase II clinical trials in India for investigating ZYAN1 as a treatment for anemia associated with chronic kidney disease (CKD).

During the FY 19, the Group completed Phase II clinical trials of Desidustat (ZYAN1) in non-dialysis dependent Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD-ND) patients with anemia. The Group also announced Phase-III clinical trials of Desidustat in CKD-ND indication, during the year. The Group?s lead program Lipaglyn is currently undergoing Phase II clinical trials in the US for 3 indications viz. Severe Hypertriglyceridemia, Non Alcoholic Steato Hepatitis (NASH) and Primary Biliary Cholangitis (PBC). The molecule is also undergoing Phase III clinical trials in India for 3 indications viz. Lipodystrophy, NASH and Type 2 Diabetes.
These factors will continue to provide revenue visibility to the Group.
Experienced and qualified management leading to robust business growth

The Group is operating in the manufacturing Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs), formulations and veterinary products for over a decade. The Group is currently being led by Mr. Pankaj Ramanbhai Patel, the Chairman and Director. He holds master?s degree in pharmacy and has a vast experience in this field of more than three decades. Being in the industry for more than two decades coupled with experience of promoter, the Group has been able to establish healthy relationship with its customers.

Mr. Patel is engaged with strengthening the Group?s research and development capabilities, supporting progressive people practices and building a holistic culture of operational excellence. He is supported by experienced and well qualified next level leadership team.
Significant revenue growth coupled with increased operational efficiency led to comfortable profitability indicators through increase in topline and prudent management of expenses

Although the Group witnessed an uneven trend in profitability, it remained comfortable throughout the review period. The profitability at gross level has been achieved owing to increase in revenue coupled with prudent management of direct expenses. The gross profit margin remained above 40% throughout the review period. At net level also, the Group has managed its profitability at 15.25% in FY 2018 and14.53% in FY 2019.

The Group has seen a stable revenue growth during the period under review. The revenue of the Group has increased by 26.33% in FY 2018 and 10.08% in FY 2019. The increase in revenue in FY 2019 was owing to higher sales in existing regions and expansion in geographic reach and product portfolio.

As per provisional numbers, revenue of the Group on a consolidated basis grew by 20% in H1 FY 2020 over same period last year but net margin declined from 15% for H1 FY 2019 to 9% in H1 FY 2020. On a standalone basis, revenue declined by 11% in H1 FY 2020 over same period last year, but net margin declined from 20% for H1 FY 2019 to 6% in H1 FY 2020.
Integrated testing service player offering a gamut of services and association with multiple partners

The Group is an integrated service player having capabilities across a wide spectrum of testing services. The services offered by the group include quality assurance, quality engineering, advisory and transformation, digital assurance. As informed, around 87% of the total revenue is derived from repeat business. The current order book of the group is USD 103 million to be executed over next 12 months.

During FY 2016, the Company entered into strategic partnership with Verbat Technologies Inc. in the space of digital technologies and quality assurance to tap UK and European markets. It also entered into partnership with SmartBear Software Inc. to provide software testing solutions, quality assured applications, and use of automated testing tools. DevOps tool developed by the Company complements emerging technologies like Cloud, big data, mobility, and IoT. In FY 2015, the Group wholly acquired Cigniti Technologies (UK) Limited, Cigniti Technologies (Australia) Pty Limited, Cigniti Technologies Inc. and Cigniti Technologies (Canada) Inc. In FY 2014, the Group wholly acquired Gallop Solutions Inc., Texas, USA and Gallop Solutions Private Limited, India. As informed by the management, the Group?s key strength lies in its 2,200+ professionals, IP-led innovation, and experience in working across industries along with a focus on next generation proprietary testing platform called BlueSwanTM. It consists of five elements: Verita, Velocita, Cesta, Praxia, and Prudentia which help to align, assure, and accelerate the digital transformation journey of customers.

Further, in FY 2017, the Group formed 10 partnerships which would enable it to cater to diverse needs of emerging areas such as Devops, continuous testing, digital assurance etc. These strategic partnerships/ acquisitions enabled the group to increase its revenues y-o-y and scale up its operations. In FY 2018 the Group used its Next Generation Testing Platform - BlueSwan, capable of serving clients across domains - to achieve growth through IP led software services. Its strategic focus includes over 30 of Cigniti?s large clients use its Next Generation Testing Platform - BlueSwan, capable of serving clients across domains - to achieve growth through IP led software services. Thus, the group large service portfolio along with association with multiple partners is expected to benefit its business profile over the medium term.
Diversified clientele base coupled with large repeat business

The Group has a base of 230 active clients which include 49 Fortune 500 companies and 24 million-dollar accounts with majority of the clients being added in the USA and UK region. The majority of customer are ISV (Independent Software Vendors) (16.9% of the total revenue in FY 2019), BFSI (Banking, Financial Services & Insurance) (16.1% to the total revenue), Travel & Hospitality (22.3% to the total revenue), Healthcare & Life Sciences (10.8% to the total revenue), Retail & E-commerce sectors (9.1% to the total revenue) amongst others. Thus, providing a diversified revenue profile across industry verticals. Further, the Company is overhauling its customer portfolio, the low and negative margin customers are removed and are replaced with high margins ones. It has been targeting the Fortune 500 or global 2000 companies where IT and quality assurance and testing budgets are high.

As informed, the group earns majority of its revenue from renewal of the contracts/product up-gradation, annual maintenance contracts etc., which provides more revenue visibility owing to recurring and sticky nature of services. Further, a few of the contracts are of multi-year and sticky nature of services being provided (where testing services are needed owing to change in business environment, new software releases, migration from old systems to new systems or cloud) leads to long association with the customers. Also, as informed, the Group has various multiyear contracts with various customers including Southwest Airlines Co., Subway IP Inc., Ryaniar DAC, Atom Bank Plc, LG&E&KU, Ricoh Limited, Freeman, BCBS, Europe?s largest airline, Synovus Financial Corporation.
The group has a wide clientele base with the top 5 clients contributing up to 18% of the total revenue in FY 2019 which insulates it from any customer concentration risk.
Extensive experience of the management driving the business

The group is led by Mr. Chakkilam Venkata Subramanyam, Chairman and Managing Director of the group. He holds a bachelor?s degree in Commerce & Law and Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management and has more than 15 years of experience in IT industry. The CEO (chief executive officer) Mr. Srikanth Chakkilam, who holds a MS from the University of Southern California, would also help the Group steer itself into the desired direction. Also, the Group has added on the board IT luminaries including Mr. Phannesh Murthy and Mr. Srinath Batni with decades of experience in the industry thus helping the Group to increase its scale of operations the management?s experience has helped the group in acquisition of new business, strengthen its capabilities and drive growth in the revenue. The group has been able to add new clients y-o-y on the back of strategic acquisition and partnerships.
Improvement in financial risk profile on the back of improvement in profitability

In FY 2017, Cigniti underwent a major overhaul in strategy thereby leading to fall in profitability on account of surge in employee cost and impairment of tool development cost. The employee cost increased by almost 32% from the previous years on the back of addition of new employees, revision of salaries, and employee cost incurred on tool development. The Group incurred substantial expenses on development of software testing products and tools over the past few years and had been assessing any potential impairment of such tools/products. Considering the overall market outlook for the software products in the testing space, the Group carried out an impairment analysis of such products and in the absence of estimates of future cash flows arising from the sale of product licenses for these tools, decided to fully impair such tool developments costs (book value INR 3,320,791 thousand). The losses led to an erosion of the group?s networth and it stood negative as on 31st March 2018 despite profitability at all levels in FY 2018.

With improvement in revenue and profitability in FY 2019, the tangible networth turned positive and the Group was able to repay its loans and have minimum utilization of working capital loans. Profitability improved on account of scalable customer base and better pricing. This led to improvement in the financial risk and liquidity profile of the Group as depicted in the table below:
Despite improvement seen during FY 2019, the sustenance of the same over the near to medium term remains critical.
Established market position in the artificial marble industry on the back of experience of promoters

Albeit the operations of the Company commenced in 2008, Mr. Amit Mafatlal Shah, the second generation entrepreneur was earlier operating two partnership firms which were engaged in trading of marbles. He has an experience of around a decade in the industry. Under his leadership, the Company has widened its portfolio from processing of natural marbles to manufacturing of artificial marbles, quartz, and other precision stones. Moreover, Mr. Madaswamy Karupawamy having a technical experience of more than three decades also supports its operations.

On the back of long standing presence of the promoters in the industry and their established relationship with customers and international suppliers, the Company has been able to establish its position in the fragmented unorganized market. As indicated by management, the Company has an established position in the artificial marble industry and is the largest importer of natural marble in India. This is reflected in Company?s revenue growth at a compounded annual growth rate of around 16% over the three year period. Furthermore, the Company has set up four depots/ stockyards and an exclusive showroom for exotic marbles and granite in Silvassa to help enhance its brand. Understanding of the industry dynamics and long presence is likely to benefit the Company to further improve and sustain its business profile over the medium term.

Weak industry sentiments during FY 2017 had impacted the Company?s revenue and profitability during FY 2017. However, on the back of increased volumes, higher realization for its products and expansion of its dealership network on pan India basis, led to improvement in the revenue and profit margins. The Company has registered a revenue growth of 12% during FY 2018.
