Further, it expanded its quartz manufacturing capacity in FY 2019 resulting in increase in revenue from this segment which accounted for around 27% (against 17% in FY 2018). Further increased demand for marbles also led to growth in topline during FY 2019.

With increase in scale of operations and higher revenue generated from quartz which fetch higher margins than natural and artificial marbles, led to improvement in the profitability of the Company. Its operating margins improved from 7.7% in FY 2017 to 16.5% in FY 2019. Further increase in export revenue also supported the margin growth. As indicated by management, in value terms, natural marbles account for around 55% of the revenue which have higher margins than artificial marbles.

On the back of improving profitability levels, the Company?s return indicators have remained moderate with RoCE of 20% and RoTN of around 23% during FY 2019. As informed by management, the Company has an order book of around INR 84 crore and has registered revenue of around INR 286 crore for H1 FY 2020. It expects to close the current fiscal (FY 2020) at around INR 560 crore. With expected moderation in the revenue because of slowdown in the end user industry, it remains critical for the Company to sustain its growth and profitability amidst competition and weak industry sentiments.
Wide range of product offerings catering to retailers, dealers and developers

The Company offers different varieties of marbles depending on the requirements of the customers. It processes natural marbles, quartz as well as artificial marbles, granites. Along with marbles, CMC also sells onyx, travertino, quartz and other precious stones. The Company has a portfolio of around 500 varieties in natural and artificial marbles and quartz.

These marbles, granites and quartz find application in the residential and commercial space. Retail segment contributes around 70% to CMC?s revenue, followed by distributors and builders. As indicated it has a network of more than 100 dealers across pan India basis to tap new customers. Few of the projects where the Company has supplied marbles include Hiranandani projects, Lodha group, Taj Hotels, Renaissance, Rustomjee and others. CMC presently has an order book of around INR 84 crore. Moreover, the clientele base is well spread across domestic and international market catering to countries such as UAE, UK, Jordon, and USA amongst others. As customer preference is more towards reputed brands and that the Company has established itself in the market, is likely to benefit it to scale up the operations through increased orders over the medium term.
Extensive management experience and presence in the US market through its wholly owned subsidiary helps in driving business

Incorporated in 2001, the Company started operating as a job work unit for 4-5 wholesale dealers based out of the USA. Later in 2005, it set up a manufacturing unit for diamond studded gold and silver jewellery. Mr. Adil Kotwal, a Chartered Accountant, is Managing Director of the Company since its inception and has almost two decades of experience in the jewellery manufacturing industry. To strengthen the presence in its key market i.e. USA, the Company set up a wholly owned subsidiary Cynergy Trading Corporation in May 2012 which acts as marketing arm and is also the largest direct customer. The Company caters to its e-commerce customers through this subsidiary. Further, to cater to the increasing demand from developed market, it set up another unit and presently the combined manufacturing capacity is around 2,200 pieces per day. It has a wide product portfolio which includes rings, bangles, bracelets, necklace and others.

Over the years, on the back of business networking capabilities and the management?s extensive understanding of the industry dynamics, the Company has been able to add reputed customers to its profile. Some of the customers of the Company include Macy?s Inc., J.C. Penny Company, Walmart Inc., Richline Group, Charms Jewellery Limited amongst others. Further, since the manufacturing facilities of the Company are located in SEZ, the Company enjoys tax benefits such as partial/full exemption from income tax, GST, custom duty etc. Thus, the long-standing presence in the industry coupled with access to developed markets is expected to help the Company to sustain its business profile over the medium term.
Low dependence on debt and adequate liquidity position

Despite large working capital requirements of the Company largely driven from high collection and inventory holding, its reliance on external debt has remained low throughout the review period. The working capital requirements were largely funded through owner?s funds. Further, entire of the profits were retained in the business resulting in increased accretions to reserves and thereby tangible networth. The Company?s networth stood at INR 129 crore as on 31st March 2019.

With absence of any debt funded capex undertaken over the years and management adopting risk averse strategy, dependence on borrowings has been limited. Its capital structure stood at 0.09 times as on FY 2018 and had nil debt outstanding as on 31st March 2019. As indicated, the utilization of working capital facilities is minimal. On the back of low borrowings and healthy networth levels, the Company?s liquidity also remained adequate marked by absence of any debt obligation, increase in cash accruals and positive cash flow from operations. Its current and quick ratios depicted an increasing trend and stood at 6.2 times and 4.1 times, respectively, as on 31st March 2019.
With no debt funded capex plans over the near to medium term and improving networth levels, the reliance on debt is expected to remain low thus supporting its financial profile.
Experienced and qualified management driving the revenue growth

The Group is presently managed by Mr. BVR Mohan Reddy, executive chairman and Mr. Krishna Bodanapu, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer. Mr. BVR Mohan Reddy holds a graduate degree in mechanical engineering from the College of Engineering, Kakinada, India, and postgraduate degrees from the Indian Institute of Technology in Kanpur and the University of Michigan. In 2007, he received an honorary doctorate degree from the Jawaharlal Nehru Technological Institute in India. As Executive Chairman, he has also been credited with pioneering the Computer-Aided Design/Computer Aided Manufacturing (CAD/CAM) culture in India, introducing computer systems for design and manufacturing applications in 1982. He has been a member of the NASSCOM Executive Council since 2003 and served as the Chairman of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), Southern Region. He received the HMA Lifetime Achievement Award, 2015. He has been conferred with the Prestigious Padma Shri Award, 2017 by the then President of India, ? Mr. Pranab Mukherjee. He was also elected as the Chairman of the National Association of Software and Services Companies (NASSCOM) for the year 2015-16. As Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Krishna Bodanapu is responsible for all the operations of the Group. He holds a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from Purdue University and a master's degree in business administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

Under their leadership, the Group has been felicitated with many awards and certifications till date for their performance.ÿThey have also been able to add new customers and have been instrumental in carrying out various mergers/acquisitions benefitting the Group in various capabilities including moving up the value chain. On the back of the management experience and networking abilities, the Group has been able to achieve y-o-y growth in revenue and addition of new clients.

The Group has its headquarters and development facilities at Hyderabad, India. In India it has branches in Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Kakinada, Noida and Vizag. It also has presence across 55 locations globally across 20 countries. As on 31st March 2019, it has offices set up in 17 locations including Taiwan, South Korea, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, New Zealand, United States of America, Israel, United Arab Emirates (UAE), and Australia to serve a global customer base through its subsidiaries in the United States of America (USA), United Kingdom (UK), Germany, Japan, Australia, Singapore, Netherland, Switzerland, Canada, Sweden, Czech Republic and India. Global presence of the Group would enable it to reach out to its prospective customers easily and garner a wide customer base. This can be seen from the fact that the Group was able to add new customers every year during the review period. Global presence would also provide revenue visibility to the Group.

The Group is engaged in providing global technology services and solutions specializing in geospatial, engineering design, design-led manufacturing, networks and operations, data transformation and analytics. The Group?s range of services include digitization of drawings and maps, photogrammetry, Computer Aided Design/Engineering (CAD/CAE), design and modeling, repair development engineering, reverse engineering application software development, software products development, consulting, implementation, data science & analytics, design-led manufacturing (product realization) & data analytics and electronics system designing to manufacturing & precision machining. These products and services are provided across diverse verticals like aerospace & defense, consumer & medical, heavy machinery, utilities & communications, energy & natural resources, semiconductor and transportation industry. Presence across diverse industries would help in mitigating the risk of downturn in any particular industry. Though, aerospace and defence sector contributed significantly to the total revenue, a positive industry outlook mitigates this risk to a large extent. Further, with acquisition of Ansem in FY 2018, the revenue from semiconductor vertical is expected to bolster. It also ventured into design-led manufacturing (product realization) in FY 2015 with the acquisition of Rangsons Electronics Private Limited. This acquisition has helped the Company move up the value chain by foraying into manufacturing of defense and medical equipment?s. As informed by the management, under S3 (services, systems and solutions) strategy formed by the Group, it positions itself as a Design-Build-Maintain partner in aerospace and defense industry. Strategy execution includes engineering & designing by Cyient, product realization which includes manufacturing by REPL and aftermarket services maintenance repairs overhaul (MRO) support by Pratt GSE-Asia. Global Presence with broad service portfolio provides revenue visibility.
Strong financial profile marked by adequate margins, comfortable capital structure, and healthy liquidity position

The Company?s profitability improved at all levels during the review on the back of a revenue growth of 17.98% in FY 2019. Cyient was able to manage its working capital requirements through internal accruals, and advances from customers, thus, resulting in minimal external loans to fund the working capital cycle. Low interest cost on the back of comfortable gearing led to strong interest coverage ratios during the review period. Moderate margins with good return indicators as highlighted below:

The liquidity position of the Company was adequate, marked by a current ratio of 2.61 times and quick ratio of 2.37 times as on 31st March 2019. Moreover, the Company?s liquidity position is supported by healthy cash accruals (INR 5,885,000 thousand) against maturing debt obligations (INR 431,000 thousand) and year end cash balance of INR 2,436,000 thousand. Furthermore, the fixed deposits stood at INR 6,415,000 thousand further corroborating with the healthy liquidity position elucidated by the Company. Cash flow from operations grew in FY 2019 and stood at INR 3,701,000 thousand.
Extensive experience of management with long-standing relationship with customers

The Company has been in the business of designing, engineering and manufacturing of pre-fabricated piping systems for more than three decades. It is led by Mr. Krishnan Lalit Bansal, who is the founder promoter and Chairman and Managing Director of the Company. He has experience of around three decades in the piping industry. Moreover, the second tier management also has experience of more than a decade in the industry which provides comfort in execution of orders. This long-standing presence in the industry has helped the Company to establish healthy relationship with its customers and suppliers which ensures repeat business and ease in sourcing of materials.

On the back of extensive experience, the Company has built relationship with reputed customers such as Dangote Oil Refining Company Limited, Mitsubishi Hitachi Power Systems Limited, General Electric and Thermax Limited among others. Presently, the Company has an order book of around INR 378 crore (0.74 times of the revenue registered during FY 2019) to be executed over a period of eight months. Apart from having reputed clientele base, it has penetrated into various geographies which include USA, Taiwan, Canada, Egypt and others. Thus, promoter?s experience about the industry dynamics given their long-standing presence is expected to benefit the Company?s business profile over medium to long term.
Integrated operations with in-house engineering coupled with accreditations from various authorities resulted in improving profitability

The Company in into designing, engineering and manufacturing of pre-fabricated piping systems and has a wide product basket in pipe fittings which includes induction pipe bends, tees, caps, clamps and stub ends and others. All the products manufactured by the Company are customized in nature wherein the designs are provided by the management. The services from engineering division which does the basic engineering for these pipe fittings is captively used for manufacturing of these products. Thus, having integrated operations from designing to manufacturing results in operational efficiencies. This is reflected in improving profitability levels, albeit the same remained moderate. The operating margins increased from 8% in FY 2017 to around 12% in FY 2019.

The facilities are based in Palwal and equipped with fabrication shop, induction pipe bending, critical piping, modular piping solutions, end to end piping system solutions from designing to delivery, pipe fittings and engineering services. The facilities are accredited with ISO 9001: 2008, ISP 3834-2. ISO 14001:2004, OHSAS 18001:2007, IBR, ASME code stamp (PP & S), PED certificate module H, CRN, CWB, etc. Further, it has received certification from National Board of Boiler & Pressure Vessel Inspectors Certificate of Authorization (NB). It is also a member of American Welding Society (AWS). It has also received ?ASME N Stamp? certification, a pre-requisite for nuclear contracts. The Company also has a NABL Accredited testing lab as per ISO/IEC 17025: 2005 accreditations. These certification and accreditation from various authorities enable the Company to cater to diversified and regulated markets and in turn contribute to the topline through increasing orders.

Despite the Company?s operations being working capital intensive, its dependence on debt to fund the same has remained low. This is primarily on account of extended credit received from suppliers along with customer advances. The Company?s networth levels remained comfortable and depicted an improvement backed by retention of entire profits in the business. Its tangible networth stood at INR 443 crore as on 31st March 2019. With increase in cash accruals, its dependence on debt remained low. The Company?s gearing stood at 0.54 times as on FY 2019. With low reliance on debt and increase in profits, the interest coverage remained adequate at 3.17 times during FY 2019.

Although the Company has capex plan of around INR 10 crore to INR 12 crore for its regular maintenance, the same is expected to be funded by internal accruals. Low dependence on debt provides financial flexibility to leverage further in case of any business exigencies or to fund its incremental working capital requirements.

Established as a partnership firm in 1985, DDPL has been in the business of cutting and polishing diamonds for more than 3 decades. The promoters of the Company, Mr. Laljibhai Patel and Mr. Tulsibhai Patel have been in the industry for an even longer time spanning more than four decades. The long standing presence of the promoters in the industry has helped the Company to establish its market position in the processing and wholesale trading in the diamond industry. The Company currently caters to more than 2000 customers across USA, Europe and Far Eastern countries deriving more than 80% of its revenue them. The sales in these markets are primarily through DDPL?S wholly owned subsidiaries based in Hong Kong, Belgium and USA. Over the years, the Company has built strong relations with the customers who regularly place orders with the Company. Its customers mainly comprised wholesalers. It also sells to retailers, which as informed, currently constitutes about 25% of the total revenue. The Company has designed various offerings and provides innovative cuts for its customers and has also implemented Blockchain to ensure traceability and credibility of the diamonds processed and traded by it.

Although the Company specializes in cut and polished diamond, it also has presence in trading of diamond jewellery for over 7 years (share has remained less than 1% over the past three years). It sells diamond and diamond jewellery to big retail chains such as Joyalukkas India Private Limited, Tribhovandas Bhimji Zaveri Limited, Tanishq (India) Limited and Kalyan Jewellers India Private Limited in the domestic market. Despite the slowdown in market, the Company?s revenue grew at a CAGR of ~4% over the past three years ended FY 2019. With established market presence and extensive experience of the promoters, the business profile is expected to get benefitted over near to medium term.
Sighthholder Status for De Beers and Alrosa ensures steady supply of quality rough diamonds

The Company is a sightholder for De Beers since 2008 and reflects in the DBGSS list of authorized bulk purchasers of roughÿdiamonds. This status enables the Company to receive supply of quality rough diamonds from De Beers, a world leader in diamond mining in terms of value. In 2016, DDPL received sightholder status for Alrosa. Further, as production and prices of rough diamonds are largely commanded by a few large diamond mine owners in the world, the Company enjoys the advantage of consistent supply of diamonds. Sightholders can buy rough diamonds from the De Beers group which host global sightholder sales 10 times a year wherein they can view the rough diamonds available for sale and purchase them.

As informed, the Company being a sightholder is assured of the quality of the diamonds purchased as during the auction it gets a chance to see these diamonds (hence the name sightholder). Moreover, along with the sightholder status, the ability to purchase diamonds directly from mines like Rio Tinto, Alrosa and its adherence to BPP (Best Practice Principles) and the 100% Kimberly process norms has helped the Company in enhancing its market share.
Established distribution network through subsidiaries and accessibility through e-commerce and mobile based application on a global scale

The Company markets its products on a global scale through its step-down subsidiaries in Hong Kong, USA and Belgium. Furthermore, the Company has its own online retail portal and has also developed a mobile-based instant messaging guide using WhatsApp which has been integrated with the Company?s (Android/iOS based) application. This application assists the Company?s customer to monitor diamond inventory. The application allows customers to place their customized orders from the ready inventory which is visible to them online. The available stock is graded based on DDPL?s own grading scale and price bands are provided enabling inspection without having to travel to the Company?s office. It has an online registered user base of more than 2,500 customers.

The capital structure of the Company has showcased an y-o-y improvement. However, it remained moderate at 1.00 times as on 31st March 2019. On exclusion of related party loans which are interest free, the gearing of the Company stands at 0.86 times as on 31st March 2019. Large working capital requirements given the high inventory holding and collection cycle has resulted in high dependence on working capital loans to fund the same. Short term loans accounted for ~92% of the total debt as on 31st March 2019. On the back of steady profitability coupled with reduced debt levels, the Company?s interest coverage ratio was adequate at around 3.96 times during FY 2019.

However, owing to large inventory holding, the quick ratio remained below unity despite current ratio remaining at 1.3 times as on 31st March 2019. Liquidity, however, remained moderate supported by increase in the cash flow from operations which stood at INR 2,135,058 thousand in FY 2019. Given that the Company does not have any significant capex plans over the medium term, the capital structure is expected to remain adequate in the near term.
Wide and expanding product portfolio catering to complete spectrum in the automobile industry

DTPL manufactures wiring harnesses for the complete spectrum of the automotive industry ? commercial vehicles, multi utility vehicles, farm material handling equipment, off roaders, two wheelers and three wheelers. The Company enjoys a notable market share in the 2/3 wheeler and commercial, off road vehicle OEM segment and is amongst the large players in providing wiring harness sets in the organized market.

It has a wide product portfolio which includes wiring harnesses, enamelled copper wires, power cords and, cables. Further, over the years, the Company has expanded its product portfolio to include actuators, controllers, sensors, stampings & mouldings and tooling as well.

DTPL?s non-automotive segment also includes wiring harnesses for boilers catered in the UK. Going forward, owing to shift in automotive industry towards electronic fuel injection system and Bharat Stage VI emission norms, the demand for these products is expected to remain robust. A wide evolving range of products helps in addressing the demand from this shift and contributes to more stable revenue.

Moreover, with the acquisition of the step down subsidiaries- UK based Parkinson Harness Technology and Bengaluru based San Electromec, the product basket of the Company is expected to expand further into the four wheeler?s segment mainly in the construction, agriculture and off-road vehicle segment and railways, defence, construction and speciality vehicle segment which will help it to strengthen its presence in automotive sector.
Consistent revenue growth owing to inorganic and organic growth strategy

The Company achieved a healthy growth in topline during the review period depicting a rising demand for its products. Revenue grew at CAGR of 16.66% during the review period. Though the Company witnessed marginal growth in FY 2017 following demonetization drive and sudden shift to BS IV emission norms, however, was able to improve its revenue considerably in FY 2018 by 30.23% and further in FY 2019 by 18.75% owing to rise in flow of orders from the existing customers and increase in sale of other value added products such as actuators, sensors and connectors etc.

Since 2017, DTPL has done three acquisitions/joint ventures. These acquisitions have brought with it synergies, which have helped the Company to grow across businesses, get access to new geographies, enhance technological capabilities and enhance product range. In March 2018, DTPL acquired UK based Parkinson Harness Technology to expand its product portfolio and widen its reach in the European markets. Further in FY 2019, the Company has completed the acquisition of San Electromec, Bengaluru based Company to expand its product portfolio in railways, defence, construction and speciality vehicle segment. This is expected to further fuel revenue growth.
Reputed clientele coupled with strong relationship with customers

The Company has a reputed clientele comprising of Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) in the two/three wheeler and Commercial Vehicles (CV) segments like Bajaj Auto Limited, Royal Enfield Private Limited, Piaggio Vehicles Private Limited, etc. The Company has developed strong relationship (~15 years) with Bajaj Auto Limited, one of the leading two-wheeler manufacturers in India, which contributed around 40% of the Company?s total revenues in FY 2019. During 2001-2009, Bajaj was DTPL?s sole customer, after which the Company started diversifying its customer base. Long standing relationships enable the Company to procure repeat orders and mitigate the risk of fluctuation in topline. Moreover, as informed, DTPL has added several reputed customers like HondaÿMotorÿCompany Limited, SuzukiÿMotor Corporation, Yamaha Motor Private Limited, etc. which would going forward is expected to increase its revenue base. DTPL has also added new customers such as Caterpillar Inc. and JCB Inc. etc. post the acquisition of PHT and further with the recent acquisition of San Electromec, new customers like Wirtgen, Volvo, Terex, Faiveley, BEML, Tata Motors Limited will get added.
To summarize, revenue increased on account of two pronged approach of supporting the existing customers with new products and also supplying the existing product range to the new customers.

The Company continues to benefit from the strategic location of its facilities at Aurangabad, Pune, Chennai and Manesar. These locations have manufacturing/assembling facilities of most of the automobile OEMs (Aurangabad ? Bajaj, Pune ? Piaggio & Force Motors, Haryana ? Honda, Maruti Suzuki, & Yamaha) and consequently, the auto ancillary sector has also developed in these regions. Thus, the Company can leverage its locational advantage to diversify its customer base by adding new customers. Significant focus being laid down by the OEMs on localization (have auto-ancillary units in the close vicinity of their plants) to ensure greater flexibility (to switch between different offerings and variants depending upon the fast changing demand dynamics) and save on the freight cost (to maintain/improve profitability) would further enable the Company to increase its volumes from existing customers.
Stable OPBDITA along with increasing returns during the last three-year period ending FY 2019

Though the net profit margins remained moderate between 3-4%, OPBDITA margin remained stable at about 10% in the last four-year period. Gross margin too depicted marginal fluctuations during the review period as shown below. Stable OPBITDA margins were supported by revenue growth, maintaining the operating efficiencies which also improved the returns. Returns have shown an increasing trend in the last three year review period. This is despite incurring a high capex of around INR 150 crore during the aforesaid period, indicating optimum utilization of funds.

Interest coverage ratio remained high and increased during the five year review period due to an increase in earnings before interest and tax. Increase in profit margins and returns reflect control on costs and efficient utilization of available funds. Adequate interest coverage shows ability to service interest burden of the Company.

Also, as a consequence of technical changes in BS VI norms post FY 2020; the Company expects the EBITDA to improve further owing to increase in the selling price of its products along with volume growth.

DTPL is managed and controlled by Mr. Rahul Dhoot - Managing Director of the Company. In addition to a Bachelor?s degree in Engineering (Electronics and Telecommunication), he has around two decades of experience in the electric and electronics industry indicating that the Company is led by a well-qualified technical team enabling the Company to deliver quality products in a timely manner. This extensive experience provides comfort about the networking and execution capabilities of the Company, which would drive the growth of business and provide the Company a leverage in a highly competitive scenario.
Integrated CRAMS player supported by its global multi-locational facilities and strong research capabilities

The Group is an integrated CRAMS player with portfolio of services from process research and development to late stage clinical and commercial manufacturing and supply of active pharmaceutical ingredients to pharmaceutical companies. It has 10 plants located across different geographies i.e. 4 in Switzerland, one each in United Kingdom, France, China and two in India along with a facility in Netherlands for manufacturing of vitamin D, cholesterol and related products.

Further, the Group has integrated its operations in CRAMS segment through ?One Company Two Brands? approach which would provide synergies, and a better operational management. Accordingly, it has Carbogen Amcis as a front-end interface for customer acquisition related to process R&D, supply of material for clinical trials, niche sale commercial manufacture and high potent API supply. Till Phase II, the products are developed at Carbogen?s manufacturing unit and then transferred to Indian facility for late stage and commercial development. Through Dishman India and China, it offers process development and optimization and large scale and commercial contract manufacturing services.

Moreover, the plants are strategically located with Carbogen Amcis located in Switzerland, France, the UK, and China for being close to its customers, which enable their involvement from the very early stages of research, and manufacturing trials. The Group?s large-scale commercial production facilities are located at China and India, which are low cost destinations, thus, providing competitive price advantage. Carbogen Amcis has a large pool of 450+ scientists. Globally, Group has 550 scientists (including Carbogen Amcis), has strong chemistry capabilities with 28 dedicated R&D labs and 1 dedicated HIPO facility at Bavla.

Group?s revenues grew at a modest CAGR at 5% between FY 2015-FY 2019. In FY 2019, it grew by about 16% due to successful commercialization of some of the developed molecules. The group currently has a pipeline of 450 molecules with about ~15-16 molecules in Late Phase III, the commercialization of same could result in higher revenues for the Group. Group foresees a 15% revenue growth in this year on commercialization of oncology drugs-Niraparib, Eprosartan and Proketal.
Thus, group is expected to continue to benefit from its comprehensive product offering, strong chemistry skills backed by global presence which will help its scale of operations going forward.
Low gearing, adequate liquidity and strong debt protection metrics

The Group?s net cash accruals increased during the five-year review period and stood at around INR 438 crore in FY 2019. High year on year accretion to reserves supported the low gearing of the Company. Gearing level decreased in the last five-year period and the same remained low, with a peak gearing of 0.95 times in FY 2015. Tangible net worth stood high at INR 1,788 crores as on 31st March 2019. As informed, Group incurs a high capex towards maintenance of facilities to meet the stringent regulatory compliances. Also, the operations are working capital intensive due to inherent nature of CRAMs which is partially funded by the customer advances (ranges between 30-60% of the order value). Growing cash accruals is expected to continue to support the high capex plans for the Group. Interest coverage of the Group too remained high at 7.48 times as on 31st March 2019. Further the group has generated sufficient cash accruals visa vis its current maturing term loan obligations of around INR 104 crores for FY 2019. Short term liquidity is further supported by unencumbered cash/bank balance of INR 76 crores and current investments of INR 19 crores.
Large and reputed customer base leading to good revenue visibility

The Group caters to leading pharmaceutical companies like Novartis International AG, Mylan Laboratories, Abbott Laboratories, GSK etc. amongst others. The Group has business relationship with these companies for more than a decade and derives around 75% of its revenue through repeat business. Successful execution of innovative molecules ensure long term supply contracts. As indicated, Group is a preferred supplier or a sole supplier to big pharma Companies. It has a large customer base of 250 customers comprising of innovators, of these 70-80 comprise of small and mid-size biotech Companies. As indicated, top 2 customers contribute to 10% of revenues and top 5 customers contribute to roughly about 25% of the total revenues. Group is developing over 450 molecules with 15 to 16 molecules in late phase III stage (about 50% is in oncology space). With focus on new medium sized customers, the Group plans to reduce the revenue concentration from a few customers going ahead. Further, in alignment to the above, the Group has also been increasing its product range to reduce product concentration risk. Reputed customer base reduces the realization risks for the Group and provides revenue visibility.
Extensive management experience driving the growth of business

The Group is managed and controlled by Mr. Janmejay Rajnikant Vyas (Chairman and Managing Director), who is a Bachelor of Science (Chemistry) and Bachelor of Pharma and Fine Chemical Technology, and has experience of around four decades in the pharmaceutical industry. Other directors on the Board are also qualified and have long experiences in pharmaceutical industry. Management experience has helped the Group to achieve y-o-y growth in revenue, optimum utilization of its capacities, and cost optimization leading to high margins. Further, experience in the pharmaceutical and specialty chemical industry and business networking abilities would facilitate in driving the business of the group.
Diversified product basket across various segments coupled with a wide geographical reach

The Company has been in the business of manufacturing intermediates and pharmaceuticals for around two decades. Over the years, it has been able to build new products through its research and development capabilities. The Company has a product portfolio of more than 70 API?s and intermediates catering of diverse therapeutic segments which include anti- glaucoma, anti-emetic, cardio tonic, anti-hypertensive, anti-spasmodic and others. The Company product portfolio is further supported by diverse offerings under broad category of speciality chemicals and intermediates that include sulfonyl chlorides and amides, sulfonic acids, salts and sulfones, esters etc. As informed by the management, DK Pharmachem has a dominant position in Trimethobenzamide, Probenecide, Dopamine and others with market share.

In addition to the diversified product profile, the Company?s business profile is also strengthened by geographical penetration across globe. Exports accounted for around 47% of its topline during FY 2019 with presence across Turkey, Japan, USA, Germany, China, Italy, Australia and others. During the current fiscal, it has also tapped markets of Russia and Mexico increasing its global footprint. Thus, wide product offerings across various therapeutic segments and across geographies is likely to support the business profile of the Company and mitigate the dependency on single product or market over the near to medium term.
Adequate financial profile marked lowering of debt on the back of efficient working capital management

The Company?s working capital requirements have been efficiently managed with good collection cycle and low inventory holding. Collection cycle of the Company has ranged between 70 to 97 days over the past five years. Further, with 80% of the sales being backed by orders, its inventory holding has remained low in the range of 17 to 40 days through FY 2019. These working capital requirements have been funded through payables, internal accruals and bank borrowings. Average utilization of bank limits was around 80% to 85%.

With efficient working capital management, its dependence on external borrowings has remained low. The increase in capital structure during FY 2018 was on account of purchase of flat for office which was funded through debt. The capital structure remained in the range of 0.48 times to 1.01 times over the past five years. Further, its debt protection metrics remained comfortable with net cash accruals to total debt (NCATD) of 0.59 times during FY 2019 backed by improvement in cash accruals and interest coverage of more than 8 times during the same period.

The Company has plans to double its intermediates capacities by 2020 and the expected capex is around INR 6 crore to INR 8 crore which would be funded through a mix of debt and equity. Despite availment of additional debt, the capital structure of the Company is expected to remain adequate over the near term.

Its financial profile was also backed by adequate liquidity with increase in cash accruals which stood at INR 12.7 crore during FY 2019 and moderate current ratio of 1.4 times as on 31st March 2019. Low dependence on debt provides cushion to the financial profile of the Company to avail additional debt in case of any business exigencies or to fund its incremental working capital requirements.

The customers of the Company comprise reputed names like Lonza Group, Sanofi Limited, Teva Pharmaceutical Limited, Sun Pharmaceuticals Industries Limited, Biocon Limited, Zentiva, etc. As informed, DK Pharmachem has been associated with most of these customers for around a decade. It enters into yearly quantity contracts for the supply with its key customers. As informed, performance of the Company improved on account of increased volumes from existing clients especially from Lonza Group through which the Company?s supplies increased from 33 tonnes in FY 2015 to 200 tonnes in FY 2017. As indicated, the Company has an order book of around INR 10 crore to INR 15 crore to be executed till March 2020. Strong business relationship with such reputed clients provides the Company benefits like stable revenue stream, global visibility, etc.
Extensive management experience with established market position driving the growth of business

Mr. Rakesh Kasturilal Bakshi, Chairman and Managing Director of the Company, has been with the Company for more than 35 years. Mr. Karan Bakshi, Director and a shareholder, has also been associated with the Company since FY 2008. The Company has a R&D facility which is registered with the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India. Backed by its research and development capabilities better regulatory compliance, the Company has been able to capture significant market share in Vitamin D3 segment and major market share in Trimethobenzamide, Probenecide, Lasamide, Fenofibric acid products, etc. This extensive experience and business networking abilities backed by R&D capabilities would facilitate in driving the business of the Company. The same has been reflected in the healthy growth trajectory (CAGR of 62%) of the Company over the past five years through FY 2019. Thus, the long standing presence of the management and understanding of the industry dynamics is expected to benefit the Company to further scale up its operations and improve its business profile over near to medium term.

DRL is operating in the pharmaceutical industry over the past three decades. The Group is a vertically integrated pharmaceutical formulation manufacturer. The Group provides a complete range of pharmaceutical products & services. It manufactures bulk drugs and formulations including verapamil, cephalexin etc. The Group also manufactures and exports molecules such as norfloxacin, ciprofloxacin, and a variety of semi-synthetic penicillin. Through its portfolio of products and services the Group operates in multiple therapeutic areas viz. gastrointestinal, oncology, cardiovascular, pain management, Central Nervous System (CNS), anti-infective, respiratory and dermatology.

Seven of Group?s brands are listed in ?Top-300 of the Indian Pharma Market? and many others hold leadership positions in their respective categories. The Group has top brands like Omez capsule, Nise, Stamlo, Clamp, Econorm, Razo, Senquel-F, Ketorol DT, Atocor, Mintop, Venusia, Glimy and Telsartan Active.

The Group controls its business operations from its head office located in Hyderabad, Telangana. It has a presence in many countries across the globe, the key geographies being the US, Europe, India, Russia, Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) countries, China and other emerging markets. It has a diversified manufacturing footprint spread across India, the US, the UK, China and Mexico, and R&D center located in Andhra Pradesh (India). The Group has manufacturing, sales and marketing operations span over 25 countries and also serve API customers globally. The Group has 18 manufacturing units, 4 R&D units, 2 technology development centers in India and has international manufacturing facilities in Tennessee, New York, Louisiana (USA), Mir?eld (UK), Mexico and two development centers in Cambridge (UK) and Leiden (The Netherlands).
The aforementioned factors have resulted in DRL a strong market presence across geographies and therapeutic segments.

The Group derives strength from its strong focus on R&D activities which enables it to launch generic version of drugs across ?niche? segments (i.e. drugs which are either difficult to manufacture, due to complex technical know-how, or have complex drug delivery systems resulting in low competitive intensity, especially in the initial stages).

Its robust research and development (R&D) capabilities has helped to develop technology-intensive products and deliver them at affordable prices to international markets. In FY 2018, it derived about 3% of consolidated revenues from proprietary products segment which mainly comprises of the differentiated formulations business, focused on dermatology and neurology. The R&D investments stood at 15% of the total revenues in FY 2018. The group has over 170 ANDAs, over 500 DMFs and 86 patents filed in the last five years.
Launched Doxorubicin Hydrochloride Liposome injection, a therapeutic equivalent generic version of DOXIL?, for intravenous use, in collaboration with the Group?s partner, Natco Pharma Ltd;

Launched Ezetimibe and Simvastatin tablets, a therapeutic equivalent generic version of VYTORIN? tablets, which is used to lower ?bad?ÿcholesterolÿand fats (such as LDL and triglycerides) and raise ?good?ÿcholesterolÿ(HDL) in the blood;

Launched Sevelamer Carbonate tablets, a therapeutically equivalent generic version of RENVELA? tablets, which is used to lower high blood phosphorus levels in patients who are on dialysis due toÿsevere kidney disease;
Filed 19 new ANDAs and one NDA during the year. These comprise some complex products and are across the different dosage forms.

DRL is operating in the pharmaceutical industry over the past three decades. The Group is currently being led by Mr. Venkateswara Prasad Gunupati - Co-Chairman, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer. He was listed in the prestigious ?Medicine Maker 2018 Power List? of most inspirational professionals shaping the future of drug development, and one of ?India?s Greatest 50 CEOs Ever? by Outlook. He holds a degree in Chemical Engineering from the Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago, USA and a Masters in Industrial Administration from Purdue University, USA.

He is engaged with strengthening the Group?s research and development capabilities, supporting progressive people practices and building a holistic culture of operational excellence. He is supported by experienced and well qualified next level leadership team.

The Group?s financial profile remains comfortable despite moderation in profitability as evident from large scale of operations, healthy cash accruals, low gearing and robust liquidity level. The profitability has been impacted by pricing pressure in the USA and incremental expenses towards front-end set-up of team for its specialty business. However, the overall financial risk profile remains comfortable which is supported by low reliance on external debt, strong interest coverage, and healthy liquid asset base. DRL?s liquid assets in cash & bank, fixed deposit, and current investments stands at a robust INR 20,912,000 thousand as on 31st March 2018, thus supporting liquidity. Its healthy accretion to reserves resulted in a strong tangible net worth of INR 78,742,000 thousand as on 31st March 2018 as against limited debt obligations (current portion of long term debt at INR 63,000 in FY 2018). Accordingly, DRL?s debt-equity ratio stood low at 0.64 times coupled with adequate interest coverage of 18 times in FY 2018. The financial flexibility provides cushion for servicing the debt and thus supports the Group?s endeavor towards continuous expenditure on R&D and explore inorganic growth opportunities or undertake other expansion projects.

he revenue of the Company has gone up by 8.77% in FY ending 2019 as compared to previous year. The profitability of the company has increased by more than two-folds. The expenses in the FY 2019 has remained mostly the same as FY 2018 but the revenue growth has contributed to the increase in the profitability of the Company.

The return on revenue in FY 2019 is 12.34% which has shown a significant increase over FY 2018 which was 6.42%. The Company has managed to revive its profitability in FY 2019 which was reducing y-o-y. The
Company has prudently managed its expenses to improve the profitability of the company.

The debt to equity ratio has further improved in FY 2019 to 0.37 times from 0.69 times due to reduction in the borrowings and increase of equity in the year. The liquidity of the Company has also improved on the account of increased short-term investments of the company and reduced short term borrowings. The borrowings have come down significantly in the FY 2019 but has not impacted the growth in revenue which is showing an upward trend.

On a standalone basis also the Company has shown a similar trend. Even though the expenses have slightly increased due to increase in purchase of raw material and opening stock of goods, the revenue has increased by 13% which has contributed to a more than 3 times increase in profitability.
Established track record with experienced management driving business growth

e-Zest has an established track record of over 17 years which indicates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Company has an experienced management team which is led by Mr. Devendra Baburao Deshmukh, who is the Founder, Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director. He has a sound technical background with over 19 years of experience in the ITes industry. As a member of the leadership team, Devendra is actively involved in key alliances, strategic business planning, capacity growth, process initiatives, and business development. He is supported by top tier management team which includes directors and executives with strong industry experience as also by the 2nd tier management team which manage the day-to-day operations of the Company. The relevant experience of the management coupled with their networking capabilities has helped the Company to scale up its operations as also reflected in compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of around 17.43% over the past three years.
Underleveraged capital structure coupled with adequate liquidity position provides financial flexibility

The Company?s financial profile remains adequate with underleveraged capital structure and adequate interest coverage. The total debt equity ratio of the Company stood below unity throughout the review period improving to 0.05 times as on 31st March 2019. The capital structure of the Company comprised of tangible net worth of INR 506,697 thousand and total debt outstanding of INR 23,389 thousand as on 31st March 2019. A lower debt component when compared with Company?s healthy tangible networth would provide the Company financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Further, low existing debt exposure makes the Company more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of the ability of the Company to service the loan. Further, with low incidence of interest expense coupled with sound profitability, the interest coverage ratio of the Company remained comfortable throughout the review period and increased to 41.88 times in FY 2019.

Low reliance on external funds coupled with adequate cash accruals has resulted in adequate liquidity position for the Company. The same is reflected in comfortable solvency ratios with current and quick ratio at 5.32 times and 5.18 times respectively as on 31st March 2019. Unencumbered cash and bank balance and investments of INR 69,631 thousand as on 31st March 2019 provides further cushion to its liquidity profile. Further, as informed, the Company?s consolidated cash and bank balance stood at INR 121,172 thousand against monthly salaries and wages expenses of INR 53,150 thousand. Also, the Company derives further flexibility in its liquidity through working capital limits of INR 120,000 thousand which are only ~40% utilized. Going forward, adequate liquidity will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and provide comfort towards servicing its near-term obligations.
Wide service basket catering to diversified industry base

e-Zest primarily started off as an OPD company which helps large global software product Companies (ISV?s) build software products. Over the years, e-Zest has diversified its service basket to be an integrated full-service player with wide spectrum of services including digital commerce, digital applications, big data analytics, artificial intelligence, managed cloud services and DevOps, business process management and platform & integration services. As informed, the Company?s business can be divided into three verticals, product engineering, enterprise business and IO which each contribute almost equally to the business. Wide spectrum of service offering and e-Zest?s key focus on delivering complex solutions has helped it add new customers in the enterprise space during the review period. Through its ISV business, it`s got insights into capabilities of various digital platforms and it used ISV client?s relationships and brand to gain entry into large enterprise customers. It subsequently expanded and added several new customers and secured increased orders from the existing clients during the review period resulting in healthy revenue growth. It also provides IT consulting services to 10 UN organizations like WHO, UNICEF, etc. Thus, the Company is expected to continue to benefit from being a full spectrum software service provider, changing client revenue mix which will continue to drive its scale of operations going forward. In addition, it caters to range of industries and business domains such as healthcare, manufacturing, banking, travel, education, Business Process Management (BPM), e-Learning amongst others. It derives major revenues from the healthcare sector contributing ~50% of the total revenues.
Sole distributor of reputed International suppliers in India

The Company is a sole agent for various renowned OEMs. These companies provide quality automotive components which have been approved by reputed OEMs in the international market. Tie-ups with these renowned players has allowed the Company to cater to established players in the automobile market despite it being a late entrant in the automotive industry. Established relationships formed with these customers offers the Company sufficient revenue visibility as it starts to increase its scope of operations and venture into manufacturing of automotive components.
Unleveraged capital structure coupled with comfortable interest coverage

Elconconnectors was debt free in FY 2017 and FY 2018. The Company?s financial risk profile is supported by low leverage and strong debt protection measures, marked by a gearing of 0.20 times as on 31st March 2019. A lower debt component when compared would provide the Company financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Further, low existing debt exposure makes the Company more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of the ability of the Company to service the loan. Furthermore, low reliance on external debt has led to low incidence of interest costs has resulted in comfortable interest coverage ratio of 25.88 times in FY 2019 thereby indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations. Thus, low debt-equity ratio will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.
Prudent management of working capital requirements coupled with comfortable liquidity position

The working capital cycle of the Company remained negative throughout the review period mainly on account of high payable days. The working capital requirement of the Company remained moderately intensive and continued to grow in intensity on account of y-o-y increasing collection and inventory holding period. However, the incremental requirement was managed prudently with stretched payable days. Adequate working capital management ensures operational efficiency resulting in smooth flow of business operations.

Efficient management of working capital is also reflected in adequate liquidity position of the Company as witnessed in adequate current and quick ratio of 1.21 times and 1.10 times as on 31st March 2019 respectively. Further, Company?s net cash accruals remained comfortable and exhibited an improving trend during the review period; which was further aided by its low debt exposure resulting in lower near term debt service obligations. Liquidity position was further supported healthy cash and bank balances (including deposits) of INR 43,226 thousand as on 31st March 2019. Adequate liquidity will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and provide comfort towards servicing its near term obligations.
Established track record with experienced management driving revenue growth

The Company has a long track record of 45 years which indicates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The management of the Company has a strong and vast industry experience. Mr. Samir Kalyanji Patel, Chairman and Managing Director, holds a Bachelor?s Degree in Science - Chemistry (USA) and Masters of Business Administration ? International Business & Entrepreneurship and has more than 10 years of experience in the pharmaceutical field. Mr. Vinit S Menon, CEO & Director, holds a Degree in Medical Biochemistry and Masters of Business Administration ? Marketing and has more than 20 years of experience in this pharmaceutical field. Other board members too are well qualified and have relevant industry experience. This extensive experience provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company. The long-standing experience of the management has helped the Company to build established relationships with customers and suppliers, thus ensuring repeat orders and ease in the sourcing of materials. This is reflected in the Company?s revenue growth at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 40.79% during the review period. The Company would continue to benefit from the extensive industry experience of promoters and its established relations with the customers which could help in scaling up the operations going forward.

Farmson has one affiliate company namely S.K. Patel Family Children Trust which holds 23.99% of the total shares in Farmson and it has one group company, JNP products. Farmson is backward integrated, sourcing the requirement of an intermediate (para amino phenol) through its group Company JNP. The entire output of JNP (para amino phenol) is sold to Farmson. The locational advantage of JNP to the manufacturing sites of the Company further aides in cost optimization. In FY 2019, the purchase from JNP accounted for 83% of the total purchases of Farmson. JNP has installed capacity of 19,800 MT per year which is sufficient to meet Farmson?s requirement of para amino phenol. Hence, the Company is likely to benefit from the group synergies resulting from the integrated operations of the group.

The Company?s financial risk profile is supported by low leverage and strong debt protection measures, marked by a gearing of 0.26 times as on 31st March 2019. Majority of its capital expenditure and working capital requirements are met through internal accruals which coupled with a healthy net worth base, resulted in low reliance on external borrowings. A lower debt component when compared with the Company?s healthy tangible networth would provide the Group financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Further, low existing debt exposure makes the Group more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of the ability of the Company to service the loan. Furthermore, low reliance on external debt has led to a low incidence of interest costs which coupled with moderate profitability has resulted in a comfortable interest coverage ratio of 23.09 times in FY 2019 thereby indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations. Although interest coverage ratio has fluctuated, it remained adequate throughout the review period. Thus, low debt-equity ratio will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.

The working capital cycle of the Company remained largely rangebound and negative throughout the review period on the back of negligible inventory holding coupled with a relatively high payable period. The Company managed its working capital through long credit enjoyed from the group entity, advances from customers, and working capital borrowings.

Further, cash flow from operating activities stood healthy throughout the review period and the Company had adequate cash and cash equivalents of INR 350,682 thousand as on 31st March 2019. Liquidity was further supported by adequate net cash accruals as against minimal short term obligations (CPLTD) during the review period.
High year on year revenue growth witnessed during the review period

Revenue of the Company rose significantly at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 40.79% during the review period driven by successful growth across domestic as well as overseas market. As infomed, its existing large customers approved the Company?s units for multi-location production which increased Farmson?s geographic reach. Also, it penetrated in South Asian countries and plans to enter into China market. Profitability at all levels (gross, operating, and net) depicted an improving trend during the review period. This was on account of increase in scale of operations, aiding in low general and administration expenses and declining selling and distribution expenses as percentage of revenue. However, an increase in scale and margin seen in FY 2019 was due to rise in prices of paracetomol due to macro factors. The management anticipate the price correction will likely happen in second half of FY 2020 and project a stagnant revenue growth and moderation in margins in FY 2020.
Thus sustenance of high margins along with the increasing scale remain important.
Experienced management coupled with business synergies with group entity

The Company is led by Promoter, Chairman and Managing Director, Mr. Ajay Brijlal Anand. Mr. Anand holds a Graduate Degree in Arts with more than three decades of experience in textile industry. Under his leadership, FTL has transformed its business model from a trading company to undertake manufacturing of textile products and has successfully expanded its business in overseas as well as domestic market. Further, the Company has tackled downturns and unforeseen circumstances to continue and normalize operations. At present, FTL has geographical presence across countries including USA, UK, Germany, Italy amongst others and has set up its own subsidiary Faze Three US LLC with an office in Gainesville, Florida. The promoter is also ably supported by other directors and a managerial team who are equally qualified and have extensive business experiences thereby providing comfort over the execution capabilities.

The Company also stands to benefit from the business synergies it derives by trading with its group entity ? Aunde Faze Three Autofab Limited. Aunde Faze Three Autofab Limited is a market leader in automobile fabrics and has a strong market share of 45%. The Company experienced robust increment (~98%) in domestic sales in FY 2019 driven by increased demand from its group Company. Although, overall revenue from domestic market stands relatively low at 12.37% in FY 2019, FTL is expected to gain increased revenue from group company Aunde Faze Three Autofab Limited as the company is expected to change its product mix offering more scope for procurement from FTL. This will help boost domestic sales of the Company.
Established relationships with reputed clients ensure revenue visibility

The long-standing presence of the Company of over three decades in the textile industry has helped FTL to establish strong relationship with its customers. FTL?s clientele includes several blue-chip companies such as ASDA Stores Limited, Williams?Sonoma Singapore Pte. Ltd, Marks & Spencers Plc., Wal-Marts Stores Inc., Target Stores, Sainsbury's, LIDL Hongkong Limited, Doller General and among others. Further, its business profile is strengthened by the fact that no single customer contributes for more than 15% in the Company?s topline, thereby ensuring no major concentration risk. Moreover, FTL has been associated with these customers for more than a decade which provides comfort over the recurring revenue streams of the Company. As informed, majority of the business is sourced from existing customers. Thus, FTL being a green channel supplier for established customers ensures stability to the revenue streams over the medium term.
Focused approach towards margin expansion resulted in rise in margins at gross and operating level

The profitability of the Company has improved y-o-y at gross and operating level. This is primarily attributed to management?s focused approach towards improving its margin. FTL was able to bring down the cost of raw material consumed y-o-y by adopting a policy to procure raw material on non-credit term thus ensuring faster delivery and reduced prices. This enabled it to reach out to a wider market for sourcing its raw material requirements as it no longer had to rely on specific suppliers to provide it with comfortable credit period. This has helped gain bargaining power for the Company. Further, gross margins were also strengthened by the improvement in operational efficiency achieved through reduction of wastage of raw materials.

Margins at operating level were favourably impacted by improvement in gross margin during FY 2019; however, in FY 2018, impact of increase in gross margin was largely offset by dip in other operating income resulting into largely flat margin. Net margin for FY 2017 is not exactly comparable to FY 2018 due to one of item (liabilities written back) and net deferred tax asset adjustment. Further, during FY 2019, the Company did not earn non-operating income in the form of profit on sale of investments and incurred loss on foreign exchange transaction as against the profit earned on foreign exchange transactions in FY 2018, this has resulted in lower net profit margin during the year.
Under leveraged capital structure marked with adequate interest coverage

The capital structure of the Company improved substantially on the back of settlement of liabilities (settlement of FCCBs and invoked corporate guarantee) in FY 2017 leading to a decline in external debt. Further, with equity infusion and accretions to reserves, the tangible networth also increased. These factors collectively resulted in significant improvement in the gearing. Accordingly, debt equity ratio stood at a comfortable level of 0.36 times in FY 2019. Lower debt levels entailed lower interest expenses which coupled with adequate profitability resulted in adequate interest coverage ratio of 4.57 times in FY 2019.

Further, the capex plans undertaken by the Company in FY 2019 and proposed to be carried out in FY 2020 have been/will be funded through internal accruals. Hence, the same is not likely to deteriorate capital structure in coming years. Further, as informed, in case the Company avails external debt for funding the capex, it will stand to benefit from capital subsidy under TUFS scheme promoted by the Ministry of Textiles which will entitle it to receive 10% subsidy from the Government on the purchase cost of machinery.
Established market position marked by a strong market share and reputed customer base

The Company commenced commercial operations in 1992; accordingly, has a long standing presence of 27 years in the RAC industry. From a single factory in Rajpura, Punjab, that commenced operations in 1994, AEIL has grown to 12 manufacturing facilities across seven locations in India. The manufacturing facilities have a high degree of backward integration and are strategically located in proximity to its customers. AEIL manufactures and assembles majorly RACs and key functional & reliable components such as heat exchangers (coils), multi flow condensers, sheet metal components, injection-moulding components, system tubing, inner case liners, washing machine tub assembly and other consumer durables. The Company has grown over the years in volume terms from manufacturing 516,000 units in FY 2014 to 1,910,000 units in FY 2018. AEIL achieved its target of 2.1 million units for FY 2019. Backed by a strong market share of 55.4% in RAC (OEM/ODM) and 19.1% in overall RAC market in India, the Company caters to 8 out of the top 10 RAC brands including Daikin, Hitachi, Godrej, Bluestar, LG, Panasonic, Voltas and Whirlpool. As apprised, these eight brands have over 75% of market share in India. As apprised, the Company expects a growth of around 15-20% in FY 2019.
Array of acquisitions resulting in business synergies through backward integration and a diversified product profile

The Company acquired PICL (manufactures motors used in white goods) in FY 2012. Further, it acquired 70% stake in IL JIN (manufactures printed circuit boards for consumer durables) in December 2017 and 19% stake of Ever (electronic printed circuit board manufacturers for consumer electronics) in March 2018. AEIL further plans to acquire a majority stake in Ever by 30th June 2019. The acquisitions over the years have resulted in backward integrations with in-house manufacturing of components enhancing operating efficiency through cost optimization. IL JIN contributed INR 100 crores to AEIL?s consolidated operating revenue during FY 2018. Moreover, AEIL has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire 80% equity in Sidwal Refrigeration Industries Private Limited which also includes business of Sidwal Technologies, a sole proprietorship firm of the promoters of Sidwal. Through this acquisition, the Company is likely to gain synergies in terms of foray into industries having high approval cycles along with increased customer base.

RAC segment contributed to approx. 71% of the total revenue in FY 2018, while AC components and non AC components contributed to around 13 and 14% respectively during the same period. Within RAC, the Company manufactures split, window and invertor AC with split accounting for approx. 72%. In the component segment, it manufactures heat exchangers, multi flow condenser, motors, injection moulding, printed circuit boards amongst others.

H1FY19 observed a growth in revenue of 12% and 19% in the Company?s AC components and non-AC components segment respectively, thus partially offsetting the de-growth in RAC segment for the same period. Although the topline is vulnerable to seasonality and largely dependent on the RAC business, however, going ahead, the revenue from AC and non-AC components is expected to have an uptick which would insulate the Company from seasonal nature of the RAC business.
Comfortable capital structure due to infusion of fresh equity through IPO resulting in substantial repayment of borrowings

AEIL completed its IPO on 19th January 2018 by raising INR 4,750 million via fresh issue of shares for prepayment or repayment of all or a portion of certain borrowings, IPO expenses and for general corporate purposes of the Company including acquisitions. Infusion of funds resulted in a total debt reduction from INR 351.9 crores in FY 2017 to INR 40.3 crores in FY 2018. De-leveraging of the balance sheet resulted in comfortable debt equity ratio of 0.05 times in FY 2018 and improvement in the interest coverage to 2.92 times in FY 2018 from 1.64 times in FY 2017. The liquidity position of the Company which remained moderate during the review period improved in FY 2018 with net cash accruals (NCA) of INR 105.1 crores. The year-end cash balance also stood high at INR 120 crores though the same would be partly utilized towards IPO expenses against which it has not received the bills or invoices from the respective agencies or consultants. NCA/total debt of the Company stood strong at 2.61 times in FY 2018 along with marginal improvement in cash flow from operations. Underleveraged capital structure provides cushion for additional funding during business exigencies or in case of expansion plans.

As informed, the Company undertook routine capex for the R&D facility in FY 2019 of about INR 50-55 crores. Total capex for FY 2019 was approx. INR 100 crores. This was majorly funded through internal accruals. Though the Company acquired Sidwal, majority of the funding for the same is through internal accruals resulting in limited additional term loans.

Mr. Jasbir Singh is the Chairman and the CEO of the Company. He has played an instrumental role in the growth of AEIL. He has successfully established over six factories in past ten years and established relationships with various large brands. Under his guidance, AEIL has initiated the concept of additive manufacturing solutions. The managing director, Mr. Daljit Singh holds a Bachelor?s degree in Electronic Engineering from Nagpur University and a Master?s degree in Information Technology from the Rochester Institute of Technology, New York. He has 12 years of experience in financial services domain and 10 years of experience in the RAC manufacturing sector. Under their leadership, the Company has undertaken numerous acquisitions, set up manufacturing facilities, and grown its revenue in the past five years from INR 830 crores in FY 2014 to INR 1,894 crores in FY 2018. The sound educational background and industry experience provides comfort on the business execution and networking abilities of the management.

The Company has long track record of over a decade that demonstrates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Company was founded by Mr. Bhawanji Karamsi Chheda and is presently being managed by Mr. Hardik Bhawanji Chheda. Under the management the Company has demonstrated scalability of revenues marked by continuous capacity enhancements and upgradation of facilities. It started its operations as a job shop in Mumbai for electroplating on plastics and over the years, the Company set up injection moulding plant and vacuum metalizing plant as a backward and forward integration strategy. In FY 2019, the Company took undertook significant upgradation of its manufacturing infrastructure by setting up a fully-automated plating plant in Zaroli, Gujarat with capabilities to undertake Chrome III plating. This will allow it to penetrate in the international markets as well which remains a near to medium term strategy for the Company.

Further, infusion of equity and funding through unsecured director loans has aided the Company to improve its scale of operations (FY 2015-18). The Company also receives support in the form for synergies from its sister concern Shree Hardik Plating Technology which provides vacuum metallizing and spray painting services on a job work basis. The long-standing experience of the management, coupled with their extensive knowledge of the industry dynamics has helped the Company to establish long lasting relationship with its customers and suppliers, thus providing the Company with the comfort of stable revenue streams and stable supply of raw materials. Customer base of the Company includes reputed Tier 1 suppliers namely Decon India Plastics Private Limited, Motherson Automotive Technologies and Engineering, Rinder India Private Limited, Varroc Polymers Private Limited etc. apart from OEMs such as Hyundai, Kia, Fiat, Ford, etc. Also, with upgradation of its product portfolio which includes Chrome III products, the Company has added new customers which have contributed to the revenue growth in H1 FY 2020.
Established track record in EPC business coupled with capabilities of catering to diversified business segments

GHV has been in the EPC business across various segments for around five decades and is an integrated EPC service provider having undertaken construction projects in the areas of roads, urban development, and airport runway construction and reconstruction, metro and railways and irrigation for the state and central government as well as private players. It employs more than 1000 people and is compliant with ISO 9001, ISO14001, and OHSAS18001 certifications.

GHV is primarily engaged in the execution of highways and road construction projects and undertakes design, widening, strengthening, operation and maintenance of highways, roads, carriageways, culverts, major bridges and road over bridges. GHV also undertakes widening and strengthening of existing carriageways, rehabilitation and upgrading of existing highways and roads, construction of bridges and bypasses. GHV has successfully completed numerous highway projects in various states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Delhi and Assam.

GHV also has expertise in building runways, resurfacing, construction of parking bays and taxi ways to enable smooth operations of air traffic. The Company has worked with airports in Mumbai, Pune, Vadodara, Udaipur, Patna, Guwahati, Belgaum, Diu and Cochin.

It also has undertaken projects for Indian Railway Construction Company Limited (IRCON) in connection with construction of Western Dedicated Freight Corridor Phase II Vaitarna in the state of Maharashtra and also in Karnataka.

GHV further ventured into field of irrigation technology in 1977 in partnership with the State Government of Gujarat. Post which the Company has executed numerous irrigation projects with various state governments. Under the water and irrigation vertical, it undertakes construction of Dam, canals, water supply projects and sewage drainage pipelines. The recent projects include construction of reservoirs at Saputara ( navagam) in Dang district under Narmada, and maintenance and repairing works of Vadodara Br. canal, Kundhel Br. canal, Jambusar Br. canal, distributaries & minors under Sardar sarovar narmada nigam limited.

The infrastructure and the construction sector face high competition from time to time due to paucity of viable projects and pricing pressure due competition. Diversified operations across different infrastructure verticals allows the Company to mitigate this risk and thus select viable projects for execution. Reputed clientele coupled with long standing relationship would enable the Company to receive recurring orders y-o-y and also garner a wide prospective customer base.
Growing scale of operations coupled with strong order book position

The Company?s revenue grew at a CAGR of ~20% during the review period although growth was muted in FY 2019 and reached INR 12,581,313 thousand in FY 2019 on the back of significant increase in orderbook and increased execution of orders in various fields of infrastructure segment. Further, the Company had an order book of INR 3,000 to be executed over next 2.5 to 3 years. GHV continues to target orders for roads, urban development, and airport runway / parking / construction / reconstruction. Strong diversified order book position coupled with proven execution capabilities provides revenue visibility to the Company.
Experience of management to support business profile of Company

The Company is promoted by the Vijapura family and is a part of GHV group which has presence in the construction sector for more than five decades. Being a part of the group, the Company benefits from its promoters? experience. Backed by this experience, the Vijapura family ventured into hospitality segment in 2015 by constructing four-star hotel in Pune in franchise agreement with Hyatt. This experience of management is expected to support its business operations.

The Radisson group has presence in almost 73 countries across the world and has around 1,000 properties. It operates under seven hotel brands, namely, Radisson, Radisson Blu, Radisson Collection, Radisson Collection, Radisson Red, Country Inn & Suites, Park Plaza and Park Inn. The hotel chain taps all kinds of customers from luxury travelers to economy segment resulting in targeting larger audience. With high brand recall and high end service quality, the hotel has been able to generate higher audience. The Company has a franchise agreement with Radisson for management of its hotel wherein it pays management fees which is around 5% of the topline generated by the hotel. This association is expected to benefit the Company to increase its business operations.

The Company owns and operates a hotel in Hinjewadi, Pune, Maharashtra which mainly caters to corporate clients. It commercialized operations in January 2015 and presently has around 75% occupancy levels. The Company being a part of GHV group which has been into infrastructure business for more than four decades, benefits from its experienced management along with financial support to manage its hotel. The Vijapura family has been in the infrastructure sector since 1965 and ventured into hospitality segment through GHV Hotel in 2015. Later, the Group commercialized operations of another hotel under its group company ? GHV Hospitality (India) Private Limited in July 2018. The hotel is based out of MIDC Andheri and operates under the Radisson Brand. It has a healthy occupancy rate of 95%.
The Company for its hotel projects has received support from GHV group companies in the form on unsecured loans from directors and related parties.
Association with Hyatt Hotel Corp. under the Hyatt Place brand

Headquartered in Chicago, Hyatt Hotels Corp. has over 700 properties in more than 50 countries across six continents as of March 2018.
