Its brands include Park Hyatt, Miraval, Grand Hyatt, Hyatt Regency, Hyatt, Andaz, Hyatt Centric, Unbound Collection by Hyatt, Hyatt Place, Hyatt House, Hyatt Ziva, Hyatt Zilara and Hyatt Residence Club. The two select service brands are Hyatt Place and Hyatt House. The Company owns and operates the Hyatt Place in Hinjewadi, Pune, Maharashtra. Typically located in urban, airport, and suburban areas, Hyatt Place hotels cater to business travelers, as well as leisure guests and families. Hyatt Place hotels are also well suited to serve small meetings and events. The Hyatt Place brand is rated the #1 Upscale Brand in the 2018 Business Traveler News Hotel Brand Survey. As per Hyatt, its Hyatt Place brand had grown by 75 per cent between 2014-18, with over 300 hotels in 200 cities.

In 2018, Hyatt decided to uptick its brand - Hyatt Place - to offer a more modern set of amenities and design. With the reimagined Hyatt Place brand, travelers could expect to find new furniture in rooms, as well as new features like a premium mattress, blackout shades and warm-colored lighting. In addition, travelers can expect to find redesigned bathrooms in guest rooms, featuring a larger vanity for storage, better lighting to reduce shadows, a walk-in shower with footrest and more.

Much like business traveler brands with other hotel programs, Hyatt is attempting to promote a more communal feel for guests, beginning in the lobby. Association with Hyatt, will continue to benefit the Company?s Hyatt Place hotel in Pune in terms of strong recall for business travelers.
Long standing presence in the industry and an experienced management enabling business growth

GPL has been operating in the pharmaceutical industry over the past three decades. The Company was founded by Mr. Amreshwar Sahai Bhargava, Chairman and Managing Director who has 40 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry. Also, Mr. Parag Bhargava, Director of the Company is a bachelor in pharmacy with an MBA degree. He has around 16 years of experience in the industry and manages the day to day operations. Other directors are also well qualified and experienced. Under their leadership, the Company has established a wide-spread reach in regulated markets such as Europe and Australia along with other regions such as Vietnam, Malaysia, Ethiopia, Philippines, Peru, and Chile. Wide reach in these international markets is backed up by respective international regulatory approvals from agencies such as Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) Australia, European Union Good Manufacturing Practices (EU-GMP), World Health Organisation (WHO GMP), India, Federal Agency for Medicines and Health Products, Belgium and other regulatory agencies in respective countries. A long-standing experience of the management along with wide presence and established relationship with customers has resulted in y-o-y topline growth during the review period and is expected to support the business profile over the medium term.
Wide product offerings allows in building established relationship with customers and ensures repeat orders

The Company has a wide product range catering to various therapeutic segments including anthelmintic, antimicrobial, antihistamine/respiratory disorder, anti-malarial, Antipyretic/Analgesic/Antispasmodic, cardiology, cephalosporin and beta lactum, Central Nervous System (CNS) and neurology, erectile dysfunction, gastro intestinal and vitamin / other mineral supplements, etc. As informed, the Company generates a larger portion of its revenue from antibiotics and Analgesic segment.

Moreover, the Company has two manufacturing units and a government approved R&D department which is involved in developing generic pharmaceuticals encompassing all oral solid and liquid dosage forms including tablets, capsules, syrups & external preparations including ointments & gels. It continuously strives to launch new products in different markets. Accordingly, the Company commercialized Paracetamol 665 MG in FY 2018 which accounted for approx. 44% of the total revenue during the same period. The commercialization of this product had positive acceptance as it led the 21.51% topline growth in FY 2018. Further, in FY 2019, the sales of Paracetamol 665 MG have almost tripled and the Company expects topline growth of approx. 34% to INR 134 crore in FY 2019 (PY: around INR 98 crore).

With recurring orders forming major portion of the revenue, the Company expects the growth momentum to continue in FY 2020 as well and is targeting INR 150-160 crore by the end of fiscal year. As informed, it has already recorded INR 35 crore in Q1 FY 2020.

The topline of the Company showed an increasing trend during the review period on account of increase in volumes of orders as well as addition of new products coupled with increase in its customer base. Although the rate of growth was relatively tepid at 1.33% in FY 2017, the Company demonstrated over 21% growth in FY 2018 and approx. 34% in FY 2019 (as indicated by the management on the basis of provisional financials) on the back of commercialization of Paracetemol 665 MG.

Further, the Company?s operating margins improved in tandem with the revenue growth. Operating profitability increased y-o-y from 11.47% in FY 2016 to 12.75% in FY 2018. This was on account of increased focus on high margin-low volume products and increase in capacity utilization owing to higher orders. Adequate profitability also resulted in healthy returns on funds invested. This is evident from the ratios given in below table:

Over the years, the Company has increased its expenditure on research and development to complement its focused approach of having higher weightage of high margin-low volume products in its product mix. Accordingly, it plans to launch new products for female sex hormones in UK, Europe, Australia and Canada. Nevertheless, ability of the Company to continue with the momentum of increasing topline and bottom line remains critical.
Underleveraged capital structure due to minimal reliance of debt

The Company has minimal reliance on external debt. It manages its working capital through internal accruals along with credit available from suppliers. Moreover, it only has vehicle loans as long-term debt on its books. Further, the Company has largely relied on its internal accruals for successful completion of its capex. As a result, the debt-equity ratio of the Company stood strong at 0.01-0.02 times as on the balance sheet throughout the review period. Accordingly, the interest coverage stood over 100 times throughout the review period indicating adequate earnings to service its interest obligations. An underleveraged capital structure provides financial flexibility to the Company and would enable it to procure additional funds for its expansion plans and/or for funding its incremental working capital requirements.

The Company also has capital expenditure plans to the tune of INR 10-15 crore to be executed over the medium term. As indicated, the plan is to be funded through internal accruals and hence is not likely to impact the current capital structure. Also, the Company targets to manage its incremental working capital requirement through its internal accruals and will continue to abstain from availing any additional debt.
Extensive experience of the management enabling established relationships with clients driving top-line growth

The Company is managed by Paritosh Kumar Garg (Chairman cum Managing Director) who has over 40 years of experience in the forging industry and has been associated with the company from 1979 i.e. since inception. Moreover, being in the industry for more than four decades, the Company has been able to establish healthy relationship with its customers. The major customer of the company includes Ashok Leyland Limited, Graziano Transmission I P Limited, VE Commercial Vehicle Limited, Sonalika International, Mahindra, Aam India Mfg. Corp. Limited, Bharat Gears Limited, Escorts Limited, JCB India Limited, Swaraj Engines Limited, Indian Railways and International Tractors Limited etc. The Company has a strong business relationship averaging 15 years with these customers. The Company is a preferred supplier for OEM's like Ashok Leyland and JCB India Limited. These long term and strong relations with OEMs provide revenue visibility. This is depicted in consistent revenue growth at a CAGR of 16% during the review period.

Further, strong performance of the Company in the recent years has led to infusion of funds by private equity player. This will help the Company in its future plans thereby increasing the revenue on the back of capex undertaken with the funds made available by PE.
Comfortable financial profile resulting in increased profitability and strong return indicators

The Company observed a consistent growth in revenue and profitability during the review period due to expansion in business from existing customers. The Company has increased its installed capacity in the FY 2018 which has helped it to achieve higher revenue growth. The Company is already in the process of expansion of its manufacturing activities and further increase in installed capacity which will aid the company in achieving even higher revenue growth in the future.

Lowering cost of materials, move to higher margin machined products, declining interest outgo, and better absorption of costs with improving scale of operations led to year on year improvement in margins during the review period. Improving margins led to improvement in return ratios. Higher revenue growth in FY 2018 has resulted in higher growth in profits of the Company. The PAT has increased at a CAGR of 101.68 % in the last five years.

Further, improvement in the financial risk profile of HFL is expected following the infusion of Rs. 200 crores by a private equity player in the FY 2019. The funds infused, coupled with an expectation of strong operating performance and consequent cash accruals is likely to help in limiting its dependence on external debt. Infused funds will be used towards capex project of INR 450 crores to be completed in 2-2.5 years? time frame. The capex will help grow forging capacity from 60 thousand MT to 100 thousand MT and machining capacity from 30 thousand MT to 50 thousand MT. Revenue in this time frame is expected to grow to about INR 1200 crores. As informed, In FY 19 HFL clocked a revenue of INR 750 crores with a PAT of INR 95 crores and an EBITDA of INR 205 crores.
Revenue spread across end user industries and product segments

Over the last decade the Company has diversified from tractor forging Company to a diversified forged and machine product company with revenue spread across numerous end use sectors like commercial vehicle, earthmovers, heavy capital equipment and railways. On the basis of products, revenue is spread across forgings (30%), machined components (36%), crankshaft (35%), and railways (4%) in FY 2018. The share of pure foraging business has dropped to one-third of the top-line as they have shifted their concentration from pure forging towards value added machine products. This reduces the risk on revenue from slowdown in a particular segment or end user industry.
Experienced management and an established track record leading to business growth

The Company is engaged in manufacturing special purpose machines related to manufacturing and repairing of railway wheel lathing machine and has long standing relation with the Indian Railways for over 40 years. It started undertaking turnkey projects since 2001 and has around 10 projects ongoing. HYT is led by Mr. Bhojraj Teli (managing director) who is a Bachelor of Engineering (Mechanical) and is a technocrat having more than three decades of experience in the industry. He along with Ms. Rajshri Teli (director) have been instrumental in the growth of the Company during the review period.

This experience and networking ability of the Directors has enabled the Company to build established relationship with its key customers (COFMOW and other railway bodies for their workshop shade erection EPC work apart from supply of special purpose machines) and become an approved vendor for the Indian Railways. Also, the management has been able to establish technical know-how and marketing tie up of the Company with BBM (in September 2018), Bemo Rail for Cost Effective Battery Operated Rail cum Road shunting vehicle, Balliu Machine Tool Corporation for robotic laser cutting and welding machine amongst others. This has resulted in the Company to demonstrate strong growth in topline throughout the review period at a CAGR of 30.84%.
Increasing profitability marked by adequate operating profit margins and strong returns

The Company provides solutions that are customized in nature and require deployment of high technical and project execution skills. Its revenue mix involves manufacturing as well as EPC & maintenance contracts which have contributed to the healthy operating profits. Increasing margins have driven the return indicators as well which stood strong throughout the review period. Moreover, with increasing scope of work for turnkey solutions, the Company has been able to significantly increase its topline and now derives around 50-60% of its total revenue from EPC projects which includes shade erections for railways. The Company?s service profile includes incremental technical solutions such re-conditioning & repair and AMCs for its products. As informed, the Company has been meeting the needs of 90% wheel turning arising of Indian Railways. Such a service profile has been on the back of continuous innovations and technology development through collaborations with multiple foreign companies which are then customized to cater to the requirements of Indian railways. Hence, the operating profitability of the Company stands strong at 18.74% in FY 2019 marked by y-o-y increase throughout the review period.
Moreover, the revenue growth in FY 2020 is expected to be around 80% and the Company has already recorded around INR 212 thousand in H1 FY 2020.
Accordingly, it remains critical for the Company to maintain the growth of its operating profitability as it increases its scale of operations across both its business segments.
Integrated full service player and one of the leading company in the Indian IT sector

The Company is an integrated full service player having capabilities across a wide spectrum of services. The services offered by the Company include business IT service (consisting of application development, application maintenance, infrastructure management services, testing services, product engineering services, business process management and others), consulting, packaging implementation and others, and products.

As the Company has presence across the entire IT value chain i.e. right from consulting & designs to products & solutions and from implementation to support, it can act as a complete business solution provider resulting in an extended lock in with the clients. Infosys is one of the leading companies by revenues operating in the domestic IT sector. Revenues of the Company increased at a CAGR of almost 11.5% (on a standalone basis) during the review period. Owing to operations at a larger scale, the Company is able to exploit the benefits of scale so as to bid aggressively for the projects.

The Company provides IT services along with consulting and business process services across various industries which includes banking, automotive, manufacturing, consumer goods, health care, pharmaceutical and life sciences, insurance and others.

On a standalone basis, Banking and Financial Services sector contributed around 32% of the topline of the Company (Increased in FY 2019 as compared to 26% of total in FY 2018), followed by the revenues derived from offering services to Energy & Utilities, Communications and Services sector. Going forward, manufacturing and BFSI will continue to remain the two largest revenue contributors mainly due to their industry size.

The Company (including subsidiaries) has a large clientele base with total number of active clients reaching to 1,279 in FY 2019 having added 345 clients in FY 2019. Majority of which falls in 1 and 10 million $ client bracket. It has around 85 clients in the large revenue bucket list i.e. 50 million $ and 100 million $. The group has been able to increase its clientele base y-o-y throughout the review period. The group has a well-diversified clientele as depicted in the below table:

The proportion of revenue contributed by top client and 10 clients has reduced over the review period. Well-diversified clientele base reduces the dependency on a particular client thus mitigating the risk of customer concentration risk. The group derived on an average 97.3% of its revenue from repeat business during the review period. Its y-o-y revenue growth is propelled by increased revenues from existing clients along with new client additions.

The Company pioneered the concept of offshore IT services and has emerged as an integrated full service provider with a global footprint through its Global Delivery Model (GDM). Under this model, the Company has delivery centers across the world (in India, Europe, North America, Asia-Pacific) that work round-the-clock collaborating with each other effectively to deliver real business results to the customers.

Customers have the flexibility to choose from onsite, near-shore and offshore options that best suit their business needs. GDMTM enables the delivery centers to collaborate on projects, leverage its assets and also work on follow-the sun-model, if necessary. An extensive network (around the world) of delivery centers enables the Company to quickly take the work offshore, thus resulting in high gross margin, owing to the low cost advantage of performing the work offshore. The Company plans to embrace artificial intelligence based automation techniques and software automation platforms to boost the productivity of its projects. GDM provides scale, quality, expertise, cost, and time to market advantages to its clients.
Strong financial profile marked by comfortable capital structure

The Company has a strong financial profile characterized by y-o-y revenue growth, high profitability at all levels, strong liquidity position, unleveraged capital structure and adequate return on funds invested. Revenues of the Company increased at a CAGR of around 11.5%. The operating profitability has been on a declining trend during the review period but still remained high. This is mainly owing to an increase in sub contract / job work charges on account of an increased engagement of technical subcontractors to meet certain skill requirements in complex projects and increase in professional and legal fees.
High profitability also resulted in efficient return indicators for the Company with return on average capital employed at 32% in FY 2019 and return on tangible networth at about 24% in FY 2019.
According to provisional financial statements for the 6 months ending 30th Sept 2019, revenue of the Company increased by about 12% Vis-a-Vis the corresponding period of the previous year.

The net cash accruals of the Company increased during the review period and the same stood high at about INR 163,010 million against no debt obligation in FY 2019. Strong liquidity (current ratio of 3 times ) will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and will also provide a cushion during adverse economic environment. The Company?s adequate cash accruals and comfortable capital structure provides cushion to further leverage in case of any business exigencies, or to fund any incremental working capital requirements.

Incorporated in 1985, the Group started with domestic operations and entered into the regulated market in 1993 from its Matoda facility wherein it got its first certification from TGA, Australia. Subsequently, in 2006, it entered into the USA and European markets. Being into operations for more than three decades, the Group has its presence in 40 countries across globe including USA, Europe, Canada, Brazil, Mexico, Australia and others which are catered through its 15 manufacturing units based in India, Mexico and United Kingdom.

The Group gradually expanded its presence across major therapeutic segments such as anti-infective, CNS, cardiology, critical care, dermatology, diabetology gastroenterology, gynecology, infertility, nephrology, ophthalmology, orthopedics, pain management, respiratory system and urology with a focus on chronic therapy areas relating to CNS, cardiology, oncology, urology, orthopedics and diabetology.

Further, the Group has established a strong presence in the injectable market in the USA and is amongst the third largest generic injectable player. In Europe, it has around 300 out-licensing arrangements with long term supply agreements. On the back of long standing presence coupled with wide product basket across various therapeutic segments, the Group is ranked 10th in the Indian Pharmaceutical segment with a market share of 3.04% (Source IMS Health India, Secondary Stockist Audit (SSA), March 2019, MAT). This has further helped the Group to register a y-o-y growth in its scale and is expected to further support its operations over the medium to long term.
Strong in-house research and development and continuous product launches supports the growth in operations

The formulation portfolio of the Group is more inclined towards the treatment of chronic diseases which require substantial time to recover creating repeat demand for its products. The Group has a strong research and development team of more than 550 scientists and researchers and also has a testing laboratory in UK which is approved by MHRA. On the back of strong research and development, the Group has been able to launch new products across various therapeutic segments such as CNS, cardiology, urology, oncology and others. Further, the Group has an extensive pipeline of improved generics in both domestic and international markets using NDDS technology.

The Group has a formidable biosimilar product portfolio consisting of 12 commercialized products with 5 products under development. The biosimilars are registered in more than 20 countries and under registration in over 30 countries through strategic marketing alliances. In FY 2018, the Group had launched 11 new products and in FY 2019, there were 14 new product launches. As of FY 2019, the Group received 13 ANDA approvals and has filed 20 ANDA's. As informed, the average annual research and development expenditure of the Group is around 4% to 5% of the revenue. The new product launches in Europe contributed to approx. 7% of the total turnover and the Group continues to be a major player within the generic hospital segment and the largest provider of generic oncology. The strong research and development unit with continued product launches has helped the Group to sustain its growth and profitability which remained healthy during the review period. Also a strong product pipeline provides revenue visibility for the medium to long term.
Increasing scale of operations with healthy profitability levels on the back of integrated operations

The Group?s business has been sustained and depicted an improvement marked by its increasing scale of operations and healthy profit margins. The Group registered a CAGR of around 26% over the five year period through FY 2019. This was on account of backward integration of its manufacturing facilities which are approved by various regulatory authorities. The Group has around fourteen manufacturing facilities spread across globe of which 10 are based in India, three in UK and one in Mexico. It has bioequivalence studies, biosimilar and API units (backward integration) which has helped the Group to launch new products y-o-y and also make its products cost-competitive due to savings in the cost of raw material. All these units are approved by various regulatory authorities from multiple global agencies like US FDA, UK MHRA, GCC, TGA, MOH (Iran) and others which provides it a competitive edge to supply products in regulated as well as semi-regulated markets.

Furthermore, backward integration and strong research and development has helped the Group to sustain its profit margins over the review period. The gross margins remained healthy in the range of 45% to 49% over the five year period. Operating margins have also remained stable in the range of 14% to 18% during the same period. The marginal decline in operating profitability during FY 2019 has been on account of increase in research and development expenses given the bioequivalence study undertaken by third parties as well as launch of new products.

Increasing scale of operations and healthy profitability has led to increase in cash accruals generated by the Group y-o-y basis. During FY 2019, the Group generated cash accruals of around INR 1,800 crore adequate to meet its maturing debt obligations. Furthermore, the liquidity also remains supported by its cash balance of around INR 192 crore during the same period. As informed by management, the Group has registered revenue of INR 6,700 crore for H1 FY 2020 with profit before tax of around INR 700 crore. Wide product basket along with new launches in various therapeutic segments is expected to provide cushion to its business profile over the medium term.

The Group is founded by Mr. Hasmukh Kesrichand Chudgar, Chairman of the Group, holding a bachelor?s degree in pharmacy (B. Pharm) and is braced with more than four decades of experience in the pharmaceutical industry. He is ably supported by his sons, Mr. Binish Chudgar, Mr. Nimish Chudgar and Mr. Urmish Chudgar who are Managing Directors in the Company. As informed, Mr. Binish Chudgar oversees the international marketing strategies for Intas while his brother Nimish leads the operations and Urmish, is an oncologist and though does not have a direct involvement in the organization, generally helps identify and guide the Group to fill the need gaps for the patients.

Mr. Nimish Hasmukh Chudgar is the Managing Director and CEO of the Group and holds a bachelor of sciences degree in chemistry and has more than three decades of experience in the pharmaceutical industry. Mr. Binish Hasmukh Chudgar is the Vice Chairman and Managing Director of the Group and holds a graduate degree in commerce and master?s in business administration with over three decades of experience in the pharmaceutical industry. Other directors of the Group also have professional qualifications and relevant experience. This extensive experience of management and their track record in driving the Group?s growth to date provides comfort about their ability in driving business growth.
Established presence of the Integreon Group in the LPO industry

Integreon Group has been in the business of LPO for more than 20 years and provides services across legal, documentation, business and research segments. The gamut of services provided by the Group include document review, legal research and drafting, consulting, contract management, workflow coordination and others. The Group operates through 12 delivery centers based in the USA, UK, India, China, Philippines and South Africa through its subsidiaries.

With a large service basket, the Group mainly caters to the law firms, corporations, investment banks and other businesses. As indicated by the management, around 60% of the group topline is derived from providing outsourced services in the legal segment. A strong network of delivery centers enables the Group to quickly transfer and execute the business processes of the client offshore, thus reaping the benefits of the low cost bases such as India and Philippines. The Group is expected to benefit from its established presence and wide spread delivery centers.

Being a part of the Integreon Group, the Company derives strength from effective leadership of the global management with diverse backgrounds including extensive experience in outsourcing business. The Company?s operations are managed by Mr. Anshu Gupta (Managing director) who has experience in strategy consulting, Mr. Rahul Malhotra (CFO since February 2019) with experience of over two decades in the outsourcing industry, Tushar Gandhi (Vice President-Finance) who has an experience of around 10 years in the information technology and business processing outsourcing industry. The experience of the global management along with the Indian business heads has led the Group to achieve turnover of approximately USD 124 million in CY 2017 marked by consistent revenue growth in the past three years.
Healthy capital structure given negligible debt and accretion of profits in the business

The Company?s capital structure remained healthy on the back of negligible borrowings availed by the Company during the review period ended 31st March 2018. The gearing stood low at 0.03 times as on 31st March 2018 and the borrowings pertained to finance lease obligations on the Company. Moreover, despite stretched receivables, the incremental working capital requirements of the Company were met through internal accruals. The tangible networth of the Company improved y-o-y on the back of accretions of entire profits into the reserves. With absence of debt and minimal interest expenditure, the interest coverage ratio of the Company remained strong.
With no plans to availing debt, the Company?s financial profile and liquidity is expected to remain adequate over the near to medium term.
Established and reputed clientele coupled with a strong order book position

Being in the industry for almost three decades, the Group has a presence in countries such as Mauritania, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Central African Republic, and Afghanistan amongst others. In the project export space (EPC), the Group receives funding from international agencies such as African Development bank, World Bank, Afriexim Bank, Arab Fund etc. Dynamic Drilling & Services Private Limited, subsidiary of the Company, has over 30 years of experience in operating jackup rigs in India. The Company, through its subsidiary, has operated 6 jackup rigs of 300 ft. and a 1,000 ft. floater. Presently, it operates 2 jackup rigs of 300 ft. for ONGC. In the solar power segment, the Group is setting up a 12 MW power project in Afghanistan is association with USAID and has a PPA for 15 years with DABS (power utility of Afghanistan). The group is developing a bauxite mine in the Republic of Guinea and the project is expected to commence by Q4 2020.
The order book position of the Group (post receipt of documents)
Underleveraged capital structure providing financial flexibility coupled with adequate liquidity

Despite large working capital cycle, the capital structure of the Group stood comfortable with debt equity ratio of 0.02 times in FY 2018. The working capital requirements of the Company were mainly managed through mobilization advances and credit from suppliers resulting in lower dependence on working capital loans. The collection period of the Company on excluding retention money stood at less than 140 days in FY 2018. At consolidated level, the collection period stood low at 56 days in FY 2018 since ONGC was the only customer for the oil drilling and exploration business. As informed, the cash credit peak utilization was 75% and the Group expects the debt equity ratio to remain low due to absence of any debt funded capex plans. Low gearing provides financial flexibility for additional funding during business exigencies or during capacity expansion plans.

The liquidity profile of the Group stood adequate with current and quick ratio of 2.11 and 2.06 times respectively in FY 2018. The current investments stood at INR 1,114,043 thousand in FY 2018 and cash/bank balance stood at INR 706,231 thousand during the same period.

Incorporated in 1991, the Group is engaged in turnkey engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) projects as well as supply projects in the field of power, infrastructure, renewable energy etc. Further, it is also engaged in offshore oil drilling and exploration with over 85% of the total revenue of consolidated financials for FY 2018 being contributed by this segment. Mr. Deepak Mathur, CEO, is a mechanical engineer and an MBA from FMS, Delhi University with global AMP from Kellogg School of Management. He has been pivotal in implementation and development of various projects. Mr. Manas Agarwal, President, has also been actively involved in the business strategy since his completion of Masters from Nottingham University, UK. This relevant experience and education provides comfort about the execution and networking skills of the management.
Comprehensive product portfolio as well as a diversified customer base

JEL is engaged in the manufacturing of equipment for waste/ wastewater management. The Company has built a wide product base through various technical collaborations; prominent ones being with Schuette Group - Germany, Hollung AS - Norway, Rehart ? Germany, Mahr Maschinenbau GmbH ? Austria, FSM Frankenberger GmbH ? Germany, Rodney Hunt ? USA. It recently entered into a technical collaboration to set-up disc filters business in India

Accordingly, the product portfolio is diversified and consists of water control gates, flap valves, knife gate valves, energy dissipating valves, water hammer control valves, fine and coarse screens, screening conveying equipment, screening washing and compaction equipment, industrial valves for bulk solids handling, hydro power screw generator, screw pump and process equipment for water and waste water treatment like detritors, clarifiers, clariflocculators, thickeners, decanters, aerators, trickling filters, DAF units, rotary drum slakers, rake classifiers, pressure sand filters etc. These products find application in water intake systems, water and waste water pumping stations and treatment plants, storm water pumping stations, water transmission lines and across industries including power, steel, cement, paper & pulp, petrochemicals, chemical, fertilizers and other process plants.

A comprehensive product base coupled with multiple end user industries provides the Company a stable revenue stream and also mitigates the risk of the top-line and bottom-line of the Company being impacted on account of a slowdown in a particular industry.

Moreover, JEL has an established and diversified customer base catering to customers such as, Gecplenviro, Enviro Control Associates India Private Limited, Naser M. Al Baddah & Partner General Trading & Contracting Company W.L.L. These customers contribute to not more than 15% to the total revenue of the Company. Also, the Company continuously engages with new customers which include EPC players who bid for tenders floated by local municipal corporations. Over the recent years, it has executed projects for Larsen & Toubro Limited (L&T). L&T accounted for as much as 15% of the total revenue in FY 2019. A diversified customer base protects topline and bottom line against decline in demand from a particular customer.

The Company was established in 1948 by Mr. Jashbhai Patel and later was run by family?s second generation Mr. Navinchandra Patel. After having formed a private limited company in the year 1973, it is currently being managed by Mr. Pratik Patel, Managing Director cum Chief Executive Officer of the Company who is a Bachelor of Engineering (Production) and has also done Masters in Business Administration (Finance). Further, he has an experience of more than two decades in the field of manufacturing water control gates, screening and process equipments for waste and wastewater industry. Mr. Laxmi Nandan Amin, Executive Director of the Company is a Bachelor of Engineering (Mechanical) and has an experience of more than four decades in the industry. This relevant experience has helped the Company to diversify the product portfolio along with technical collaboration with different partners for expanding the product base. This collaboration and diversification has helped the Company to grow its revenue by 17.24% CAGR for three-year period ended FY 2019. Thus the long standing presence of the promoters and established clientele base are expected to support its business profile over the medium term.
Adequate financial profile marked healthy networth and low debt levels

The total debt equity ratio remained well below unity throughout the review period and stood at 0.44 times as on 31st March 2019 indicating low reliance being placed on external funds. Further, healthy networth levels backed by accretion to reserves supports financial profile of the Company.

An underleveraged capital structure provides an opportunity to the Company to fund the incremental working capital requirements using external borrowings. Majority of the Company?s total debt comprised of short-term loans which accounted for 84.98% of the total debt in FY 2019.
Also, the interest coverage ratio of the Company stood at 4.96 times in FY 2019 indicating adequate safety of margin to service its financial obligations.
Established track record coupled with experienced management driving business growth

The Company has an established operating track record of over 14 years during which it has grown its scale of operations to more than INR 7,500,000 thousand (in FY 2019) while catering to more than 150 customers which indicates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Company has experienced management which is led by Mr. Ramprakash Narayan Prasad Malpani, Managing Director, who has a rich experience of over 20 years in the steel industry. He is ably supported by an experienced management team which helps the Company?s day to day operations while also allowing for growth through management strategies and decisions. Accordingly, the Company now caters to more than 80 countries across the world while obtaining more than 35% of its revenue from exports. The long-standing experience of the management, coupled with their extensive knowledge of the industry dynamics has also helped the Company to establish long-lasting relationships with its customers thus ensuring repeat orders. Under the current management, the Company has been able to grow at a CAGR of 30.33% over the three years from FY 2017 to FY 2019.
Diversified spectrum of product offerings coupled with integrated operations

The Company is engaged in manufacturing of stainless steel and allied products including billets, ingots, hot rolled products, bright round, hexagonal, square and threaded bars, flat and angle bars, wire rods & flanges of stainless steel, alloy steel, carbon steel & duplex steel. The Company?s operations are integrated encompassing in house melting, rolling, casting, annealing & heat treatment facilities. Furthermore, the products manufactured by the Company find usability in various industries such as chemical, refineries, fertilizers, textile, machinery manufacturers, oil & gas, white goods, machine components, medical, power transmission, wind mill, defense and cutlery with utilization across the engineering sector. This diversification in revenue from different streams reduces the concentration risk of a particular sector or product. Further a wider product bouquet also enables JJL to serve a larger client base (~150 customers in FY 2019); a higher client base and end industry usability insulates the Company from slack in business from a particular customer and against downturn in any specific industry thereby providing revenue visibility. Further, the Company has increased its manufacturing capacity from 48,000 MTPA to ~84,000 MTPA in FY 2019. This will provide further scope for increasing the Company?s scale of operations.

The Company has been incorporated by three brothers, namely, Mr. Mohammed Mehedi Hasan, Mr. Mohammed Humayun Kabir and Mr. Mohammed Jahangir Alam who individually have minimum entrepreneurial experience of more than a decade each. The promoters are actively functional in day-to-day operations of the business and directly look after marketing and client acquisition for the Company. Further, the Company is a part of the JHM group which recorded a combined turnover of more than INR 6,000,000 thousand (FY 2018). The group has diversified business interests including civil construction, trading of agro commodities, coal, stone chips and boulders and raw material for civil construction. The extensive experience of promoters has helped the Company to build strong relationship with customers in both India as well as Bangladesh.
Prudent working capital management resulting in absence of external borrowings leading to comfortable capital structure

The Company?s working capital requirements are prudently managed as both inventory and receivables are primarily funded through credit extended by suppliers. The Company maintains minimum trading inventory as majority of the procurement is backed by orders. Moreover, other inventory necessary to support other businesses is not a significant percentage of the total purchases. Further, collection period for the Company remained modest at 21 days as on 31st March 2019.
*Ratios have been calculated considering 6 months of operations in FY 2017

Prudent working capital management through timely realization of payments from customers and low inventory holding days has allowed the Company to leverage on its available liquidity to fund its capital expenditure without any reliance on external debt. This is in line with the management?s conservative policy as per which the Company is expected to remain risk averse by avoiding any dependence on borrowings.

As informed, the Company will continue to remain debt free in the near future. Absence of debt would provide financial flexibility to avail additional funds for further expansion through leveraging of existing tangible networth. Further, zero debt exposure makes the Company more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of its ability to service the loan. Further, no interest cost and absence of cash outflow towards repayment of fixed obligations would support the financial health of the Company over the near to medium term.

The liquidity position of the Company remained adequate on the back of efficient management of its working capital requirements which have been primarily through credit from suppliers and internal accruals. The lack external debt has led to reduced pressure on liquidity due to absence of external financial liabilities. Moreover, as on 31st March 2019, the Company had cash and cash equivalents of INR 89,543 thousand along with current and quick ratios at 2.48 and 1.93 times respectively. Further, cash generated from operating activities stood at INR 139,913 thousand in FY 2019.
Adequate liquidity will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and will also provide a cushion during adverse economic environment.

JKT is led by a qualified and experienced board of directors and management team. The group?s co-founder and Director is Mr. Abhishek Singhania having an experience of more than two decades in the IT field. Additionally, other members of the Board include Mr. Satish Chandra Gupta (Executive Director) having an experience of over five decades. Further, the core management team is led by Dr. Sanku Bose (CEO) having an experience of over 26 years. Dr. Bose took over the operations as the CEO of the group in May 2016. The Group has since then seen incremental investment in hiring top talent in its management team. Accordingly, its impact has been seen in topline growth and improvement in profitability.

Under the aforementioned leadership, JKT recorded over 12% CAGR in the past three years ended FY 2018 on the back of increased average deal size from established customers and addition of new customers in international markets. Further, as informed, the group recorded INR 203 crore topline in FY 2019 (approx. 26% growth from FY 2018) and expects to record INR 300 crore by the end of FY 2020.
Gamut of service offerings across industries and established relationship with key customers

The group has a well-diversified revenue profile across different services including application development, application maintenance, data analytics & decision making, enterprise services, customer centric dedicated ODC (offshore development centre), application migration & re-engineering, and enterprise mobility. The services and solutions are provided across various industries such as financial services, healthcare, automotive, manufacturing, retail, CPG etc. As informed by the management, the Group caters to over 100 customers, with more than 20-30 customers being added every year in the past three years. Also, the group partners with reputed brands such as Oracle, Microsoft, Pega systems, Sales force, and Amazon Web Services amongst others for acquiring technical knowhow and expertise. Moreover, integrated and diversified service offering enable the group to be a complete business solution provider resulting in extended lock in with the clients.
Adequate financial risk profile with moderate working capital requirements

The financial profile of the group was characterized by comfortable capital structure and adequate liquidity on the back of its moderate working capital requirements and increasing cash accruals. The group has been repaying its long-term debt obligations resulting in decline in long-term debt from INR 25,834 thousand in FY 2016 to INR 9,915 thousand in FY 2018. Its majority of the debt is in the form of working capital debt. Though high collection cycle leads to incremental working capital requirements, absence of capital expenditure coupled with increasing cash accruals in the past three years ended FY 2018 assured the debt equity to remain comfortable throughout the review period. Accordingly, the gearing stood low at 0.28 times as on 31st March 2018 coupled with strong interest coverage ratio at 7.13 times in FY 2018. Moreover, the current ratio stood at 2.11 in FY 2018 further corroborating adequate liquidity profile of the Group.
With healthy increase in topline recorded in FY 2019 and projected in FY 2020, the group?s liquidity position is expected to remain comfortable in the near-term.
Experienced management and strong track record visible in robust growth in revenue through reputed customer base

Incorporated in 1991, Jyoti has a strong track record of more than 28 years of operations where the operations of the Company have scaled up to IN 7,914,258 thousand in FY 2019. The Company is headed and managed by founder, Mr. Parakramsinh Ghanshyamsinh Jadeja along with co-founder Sahadevsing Lalubha Jadeja, has an experience of nearly 3 decades in the machine tool industry. They are supported by qualified and experienced management team. The management has established track record of regularly infusing funds in the Company.

The Company over the years have acquired a number of clients in the domestic (Ashok Leyland Limited, Brakes India Limited, Bhavani Industries Limited, Jain Irrigation Systems Limited, LGB Forge Limited, etc.) as well as international (reputed groups and institutions like Boeing, Airbus, NASA, Rolls Royce, BMW, Audi, Ferrari, Volkswagen, Daimler, Fiat, Toyota, Volvo, Bombardier, Swarovski, Safran, Siemens, Alstom etc.)

The strong operational track record, experienced management and reputed customer base has allowed the Company to scale up operations with CAGR of ~25% during the review period and have poised the Company for future growth as apparent in the order book of INR 5,470,000 thousand as on 30th September 2019.
Technological prowess visible in wide range of offerings in the CNC machine domain offering entry level to high-end machinery to customers in numerous industries

Over the years, the Company has diversified its product portfolio through R&D taking the organic route as well as through acquisition (inorganic growth) to offer wide range of CNC metal cutting products for both Turning and Milling operations, from the entry level to high-end machines. The Company acquired a 150-year-old French machine tool manufacturer, Huron, which specializes in manufacture of 3 and especially in 5 axis CNC machines providing the Company with a technological edge which helped catering to the relatively high margin high-end machines viz; CNC Turning Centre, CNC Vertical Machining Centre (3-4-5 Axes), CNC Horizontal Machining Centre, Vertical Line CNC Machines and Multitasking Machines. The Company is an integrated CNC machine manufacturer which designs, develops and manufactures most of the critical components in-house. The Company has a captive foundry, machining, sheet metal unit, paint shop and assembly unit. The Company caters to a large customer base spread across Automobile, Aerospace, Agriculture, Bearings, Consumer Durables, Die and Mould, Diamond Jewellery, Defence, General Engineering, Medical Equipment, Plastic Processing, Pumps and Valves, Railways, Tooling and Textile Machinery. The Company currently operates at 85% capacity utilization through five manufacturing facilities; of which, three are located in Rajkot, Gujarat and two are located in Strasbourg, Germany (under Huron).

The modern infrastructure and R&D capabilities and the wide range of product offerings allow the Company to act as a one stop solution to its customers cutting needs while also providing spare parts and maintenance services to the customer. Thereby allowing for continued long term relationship and good market credibility.

Incorporated in France in 1857, Huron Graffenstaden SAS is a 158 years old French Machine Tool Giant located at Strasbourg, France. It is traditionally focused on critical design and assembly operations and is reputed across Europe for its 3 axis and, especially, 5 axis Machining Centres. Further, it has subsidiaries at Gerlingen, Germany and Quebec, Canada. Huron pre-dominantly caters Aerospace, Automotive, Die-mould, General Engineering segments across the globe and has already made more thanÿ1,00,000ÿmachine installations globally. Huron has 2 manufacturing facilities at Strasbourg; plant 1 is located in Illkirch & plant 2 is located in Eschau. This new plant was established mainly in order to double the manufacturing capacity for large sized 5 axis machines. In addition, Huron has R&D department with a team of 25 members working on innovative milling strategies and development of complex components. Its clientele comprises of renowned groups like Boeing, Airbus, NASA, Rolls Royce, BMW, Audi, Ferrari ,Volkswagen, Daimler, Fiat, Toyota, Volvo, Bombardier, Swarovski, Safran, MBDA, Siemens, Alstom etc. Huron has a wide sales and service network across the globe such as Algeria, Argentina, Australia, Belarus, Brazil, Canada, China, Czech Republic, Germany, Great Britain, Hungary, Italy, Mexico, Morocco, Netherland, Portugal, Russia, Slovakia, South Africa, Spain, Switzerland, Tunisia, Turkey, Ukraine & USA.

The Company acquired Huron through its subsidiary in France, Jyoti, SAS in FY 2007. Since then, despite the financial support required by Huron from the Company, Jyoti has been deriving synergies from the strong technological strength, wide-spread reach and reputed sales network of Huron. Over the years, the acquisition has helped Jyoti to widen its product portfolio and geographical reach allowing it to offer one stop CNC machining solutions to its customers. Going forward, the management believes that the Company will be able to further solidify the operations of Huron and reduce its financial dependence on the Company while contributing to improving the financial and operational profile of the Group.
Strong relations with the key customers aiding revenue growth

Kay Jay started as a manufacturer of cycle parts. It diversified into producing forged auto components in 1983 and since then, the Company has been associated with two of its major customers- TVS and Hero group catering to two wheeler segment. Kay Jay is both a Tier I and Tier II supplier to the OEM?s. It directly supplies to TVS group while for Hero group, it is both a Tier I and Tier II supplier. Over the years, TVS group has increased its supplies from Kay Jay with the Company becoming a single source supplier to TVS group for its crankshaft assembly line. The Company built up a dedicated assembly unit at Hosur in FY 2011 (earlier TVS group undertook the activity in-house) and in FY 2018 had set up a second unit of machining lines. As informed by the management, the order book from TVS group increased by nearly 50% in the last three year., Strong customer relations and repeat orders aids revenue growth along with providing revenue visibility. As informed the Company is estimated to have clocked revenue of INR 517 crore for FY 2019 (about 35% increase over previous year).
Extensive management experience and long standing presence of Company in the forging industry

Company is promoted by the first generation entrepreneur- Mr. Gopal Krishan Kothari who has close to 4 decades of experience in the forging industry. Kay Jay is actively managed by Mr. Gopal Krishnan Kothari together with his son Mr. Amit Kothari who has around 17 years experience in the industry. The promoter?s extensive experience and long standing presence has helped Company build a repute clientele base and expand in the forging product lines. Major products manufactured are engine components comprising of crank shafts, connecting rods and precision metal components. It undertakes both forging and machining activities. Company?s long standing presence and management?s extensive experience would continue to help Kay Jay in scaling its operations.

The Company has moderate working capital requirements due to need to maintain a stock of 55-60 days (held in WIP form) and collection cycle of 45-60 days. However, the working capital cycle was efficiently managed through a credit from suppliers (between 77-101 days) and net cash accruals leading to low reliance on outside short term debt. As informed, the Company?s average cash credit utilization is around 80-85% of the sanctioned limits. In FY 2019, the Company?s cash credit lines has been enhanced by INR 15 crores because of incremental revenue growth.
Global ER&D service provider with strong engineering expertise

LTTS is a leading global pure-play ER&D service provider company and has been recognized as a ?Leader? in the Zinnov Zones 2018 across 10 business verticals for the third year in a row as on 31st March 2019. In addition,ÿLTTS has advanced its competencies inÿ5ÿnew expertise areas for its engineering services. Theÿ5 new expertise areasÿare design & simulation, artificial intelligence & machine learning, user experience, platform engineering and quality assurance engineering.

The Company offers a comprehensive range of services to address varied and increasing requirements of its customers and acts as a ?one-stop shop? for them. It offers services right from conceptualization to implementation within the product and engineering life cycles including consulting, design, development, testing, maintenance, go-to-market as well as after sales services. In order to cater to the rising needs of customers, it has been continuously investing in innovation labs and presently has 49 state of the art R&D labs across India. End to end service offerings of the Company and its integrated global delivery model (operates 17 global delivery centers and 28 global sales offices) allows it to service customer requirements from its onsite and offshore delivery centres. This has helped the Company to build healthy relationship with its customers and also acts as an advantage over the other general services companies that also offer ER&D services having presence in limited domains.
Diversified player with multi-vertical industry expertise and healthy customer relationships

LTTS caters to various industry verticals and offer wide spectrum of services in diversified segments such as transportation, industrial products, process industries, telecom, medical devices and others. The Company?s customer engagement in various segments has enhanced its recognition in the global ER&D market. LTTS also cross - leverages its experience across segments, to deliver ER&D services and solutions as well as actively pursues cross-selling opportunities across verticals to derive value from its existing and prospective customers. This not only helps in solving complex customer problems that require multi-domain expertise but also helps the Company in penetrating customers? different business verticals. Further, this approach helps to mitigate risks due to adverse market conditions in specific verticals. None of the segment contributed more than 35% to its topline, thereby depicting diversification in revenue across verticals.

/Additionally, the Company has long-standing relationships with its customers, which, include more than 69 Fortune 500 companies and 51 of the world?s top engineering research and development (ER&D) companies. The Company has a wide clientele base comprising of 251 global clients and is associated with them for around 7 to 10 years. The established relationship with the customer is reflected in 90% of its business being the repeat ones. Revenue contribution from top 20 and 10 clients stood at 54% and 38% respectively during FY 2019 basis the strategy adopted by the Company to focus on its top 30 customers. Client mining also accelerated in FY 2019 with USD 1 million+ and USD 5 million+ client increased by 8 & 2 respectively.

In the era of new-age technologies like 5G, Artificial Intelligence, IOT, machine learning, the life span of the product offering has shortened and thus the Company continuously need to innovate and keep abreast with new technology changes to ensure client wins and order pipeline. LTTS?s strong relations with customers, focus on innovation and its engineering expertise is expected to benefit the Company and increase its scale going forward.
Strong financial profile marked by negligible debt and adequate liquidity

LTTS?s financial profile remained strong characterized by its comfortable profit margins and returns, increasing networth levels, negligible borrowings and adequate liquidity position. Its scale of operations depicted a y-o-y increase with compounded annual growth rate of 23% over the past three years through FY 2019. Although the profit margins depicted a decline during FY 2018, primarily on account of appreciation of rupee, increase in revenue from transportation and telecom segments (having marginally lower profit margins than other segments) and decline in IP revenues, remained adequate at 14% at operating level. The margin improved in FY 2019 with strong growth witnessed across markets and segments driven by high growth in new technology spends (58% year on year growth in revenues from digital and leading-edge technologies, formed 33% of the total revenues). Further, year on year improving employee utilization rate (stood at 80% in FY 2019 over 78% in FY 2018) coupled with the growing offshore to onshore ratio (53% in FY 2019 over 50% in FY 2018) supported the margin.
High margins, strong revenue growth led to high and increased returns in FY 2019. The three year margin and returns are tabulated below:

Increasing scale of operations coupled with adequate profit margins resulted in y-o-y improvement in the cash accruals of the Company. Further, its collection cycle (driver of working capital requirement) stood moderate at 79 days as on FY 2019 resulting in negligible reliance on borrowings to fund the same. Improving cash accruals resulted in increase in accretions of reserves leading to rise in networth levels. The same stood healthy at INR 20,106 million as on 31st March 2019.

LTTS?s financial profile remained further supported by low debt obligations, and large cash/ bank balance and liquid investments. The Company had liquid assets to the tune of INR 7,593 million as on FY 2019. Its current ratio remained strong at 2.90 times for the same period. Healthy networth levels, increasing cash accruals and large liquid investments provides financial flexibility to the Company to leverage additional funds in case of any business exigencies or to fund its organic or inorganic expansions.
Support from parent and experienced management will help to sustain its business profile

LTTS is a part of L&T group of companies. The group has diversified business interest which includes technology, engineering, construction, manufacturing and financial services. The Company was established as a part of group restructuring exercise and leverages on the strength derived from its parent, L&T Limited. LTTS?s association with the L&T brand, provides it with a competitive advantage in attracting talent, benefiting from promoter?s global network, exploring potential business opportunities, corporate governance practices and acquiring direct access to senior decision makers in potential end customers.

Along with the support derived from L&T Limited, the Company is managed and led by Dr. Keshab Panda (MD & CEO) obtained post graduate degree in aerospace engineering coupled with PhD from IIT (Bombay). He has global industry experience of more than three decades in research and engineering service business. Other management also has extensive experience in various fields, which support the operations of the Company. Long-standing presence of the management and their rich experience coupled with strong group backing provides comfort about execution and networking capabilities of the Company, which would help in driving the growth of business.
Established presence in the ash handling industry backed by extensive experience of the management

Formed through a business transfer agreement between BSBK Engineers Private Limited and erstwhile Macawber Beekay Private Limited (incorporated in 1984), the Company is engaged in manufacturing and designing of capital equipment?s for cement, power, steel, chemicals amongst other industries. Though incorporated under the name BSBK Enviro Systems Private Limited, it again underwent name change to the present name to continue to derive benefits from the established Macawber brand in the market. This has aided MBPL in achieving brand image apart from inheriting prequalification?s and established clientele.

The operations of the Company are managed by Mr. Ajay Kumar Gupta (Chairman and Managing Director), who holds a bachelor?s degree in arts and has over four decades of experience in the field of EPC, specially ash and coal handling system for the power industry. Further, the second tier management is also qualified and has experience of more than a decade in the industry.

Macawber brand has its presence in Indian markets for more than three decades and as informed by management, the Company holds around 30% -35% market share in the ash handling industry. On the back of capabilities in execution and timely delivery of projects, the Company claims to have no history of penalties due on account of time overrun. The Company?s ability to offer extensive range of ash and other system like coal handling system, bottom ash handling system, fly ash handling system, ash slurry system, coal mill reject system, material handling system, pneumatic conveying system, red mud handling system and services like operations & maintenance and customer support services strengthen its market position.
Long term relationships with reputed customers with healthy order book position

MBPL has been in the industry for more than three decades and over the years has been able to establish good relationship with its customers. It has been able to bag orders from these customers y-o-y basis. It has established itself as one of the top players in the ash handling industry. It has a reputed clientele base which includes customers such as National Thermal Power Corporation Limited, Bharat Heavy Electrics Limited, Adani Power Limited, Adani Infrastructure Limited, Reliance Industries Limited and others. Till date, the Company has executed more than 500 large and small EPC contracts for ash-handling systems in India.

The Company as on August 2019 has an order book of around INR 1,400 crore to be executed over two to three years. The current unexecuted order book is around 2.6 times of the revenue registered during FY 2019. This healthy order book renders revenue visibility to the Company over the medium term.
Wide range of product offering and established clientele

The Company is predominantly an export-oriented unit and is engaged in manufacturing of various sizes & types of cables such as Low Tension Polyvinyl chloride (PVC) & Cross linked Polyethylene (XLPE) Cables, Control Cables and Aerial Bunched Cables. It also manufactures special type of cables like Fire Resistant Low Smoke (FRLS) Sheathing, HR Insulated and Sheathing & Halogen Free Wire and Cables. It also provides the cables to Electricity Boards, Reputed Contractors and Government & Private Departments.

Mr. Rajesh Jindal, the Founder of Marino Cables, started business 25 years back and has established relationships with the clients in export market and state electricity boards. Wide basket of product offering, and established clientele could drive further revenue growth.

The Company observed an uneven growth in revenue during the review period due to expansion in business in the domestic market. There was a decline of 11% in the revenue of the Company in FY 2017 which recovered in FY 2018 with a significant increase of 113%. Almost 60% of the total revenue is from exports and the remaining is in the domestic market. As informed, the reason for increase in revenue in FY 2018 is on account of increase in supplies to electricity boards. FY 2019 revenue and margins remain inline with FY 2018 numbers.
Healthy deal wins along with long term agreement with HP provides revenue visibility

On the back of healthy deal wins, the group has been able to sustain its business profile with scaling up of operations. The group has won deals with total contract value (TCV) of USD 616 million during FY 2019 against the previous of USD 551 million (having a growth of around 12% over the preceding year). During the year the group has made 67 new client additions. The rise in the deal win is backed by increased focus on the direct channel. Majority of the deals won by the group are the in focus areas of digital, governance risk and compliance and NextGen services. This has helped the group deliver robust growth in both direct and DXC/HP channels. Further, in quarter 1, the group has won new deals to the tune of USD 151 million in the direct international business of which 80% of these deals are in NextGen services.

Apart from the healthy deal wins, HP and Blackstone have agreed on the terms of a Master Service Agreement (MSA) under which HP has committed a minimum revenue amount escalating year over year and totaling USD990 million over five years from effective date. The duration of the MSA is five years with three automatic renewals of two years each. This lends visibility to revenues from the HP Channel for the group until year 2027. Secondly, Blackstone cited the synergy of exposing its portfolio as potential clientele for the group, implying some leads for the Direct channel business as well.
With increased focus on direct core business and HP/DXC business because of the long term agreements, the group is expected to leverage on the same to further improve its business profile.
Comfortable financial profile on the back of low debt and strong liquidity position

The financial profile of the group remained comfortable during the review period marked by low dependence of debt. Its capital structure stood at less than 0.20 times throughout the review period. Sound financial performance of the group was further supported by its healthy tangible networth of INR 31,989,380 thousand (albeit the same declined on account of share buyback) as on 31st March 2019. The low reliance on debt has been on account of its prudent collection cycle coupled with healthy cash accruals generated. The group has recently acquired Stelligent Systems LLC (a technology service company specializing in DevOps automation on Amazon Web Series) in November 2018. However, the entire acquisition was through the cash deal of USD 25 million.

Further, the group?s liquidity remained strong on the back of its increasing cash accruals which stood at INR 2,466,370 thousand during FY 2019. The group?s current ratio was adequate at 2.06 times as on 31st March 2019 which declined against preceding year because of increase in accounts payables, other payables and short term debt (secured and unsecured loan availed from Citibank). Its liquidity further was supported by large cash and bank balance and liquid investments. Both combined together stood at INR 17,095,700 thousand as on 31st March 2019.

Strong liquidity position enhances the group?s short term financial flexibility which will enable it to fund its acquisitions organically and will also provide a cushion during adverse economic environment.

The group provides information technology services along with business and knowledge process outsourcing solutions. The services extended by the group include application maintenance and application development, knowledge process, infrastructure management services, transaction process services, technical help desk and others. Majority of the revenue of the group was derived from providing application maintenance and development services which accounted for around 62, followed by infrastructure management services of around 14% during FY 2019.

This gamut of services are offered across diversified industries which include banking and capital markets, insurance, information technology, communication and entertainment (ITCE) and emerging industries (which include transportation, logistics and healthcare).

Although, the revenue from banking remained flattish and that from Insurance declined because of the global headwinds given the fall in origination volumes, the ITCE business depicted an improvement. With continued focus on direct core business, the group has been able to win large deals and the TCV wins during FY 2019 were almost 12% higher than the preceding year with majority deal wins in the areas of digital and NextGen services.

The group is currently led by Mr. Nitin Rakesh who has an experience of more than 15 years in the IT sector. Mr. Rakesh joined the group?s board in January 2017. He holds a bachelor?s degree in Engineering (Computer Science) from Delhi University and has done his Master?s in Management from Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies, Mumbai. He is also an alumni of Harvard Business School?s CEO Workshop. Mr. Rakesh has deep domain expertise in Banking, Financial Services and Insurance verticals.

Prior to joining Mphasis, he served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Syntel (a NASDAQ listed IT Services company). He also served as CEO and managing director of Motilal Oswal Asset Management Company. He has also worked with the TCG Group, a transnational private equity and investments firm as the Head of Banking & Financial Services Sales at TCG Software Services. Earlier in his career, Mr. Rakesh worked for Unit Trust of India, setting up offshore mutual funds and secondary Market Research Cell, Product Development and Risk Management divisions.

Recently, Mr. Rakesh won the ?2019 American Business Awards ? Gold Stevie? under the ?Tech Innovator of the Year ? Services? category. The other directors on board are also well qualified and competent. This relevant experience and business networking facilitate in driving the business of the group efficiently as evident from CAGR of 12.80% during the review period.
Large scale trading operations at group level leading to established market presence pan-India

MTC group is more than four decades old with national and international business operations, having diversified business interests in Iron and Steel materials, Ferro Alloys, Automobiles, etc. Through its various group companies, it caters to pan India. The Group has built up a strong presence in western, southern and northern India with offices/yards across in all major cities in India. MTC Group is one of the largest trading houses in India for Iron and Steel Scrap, procuring steel scrap generated from major OEM?s like Hyundai Motors, Crompton Greaves Limited, Toyota Kirloskar Motors, Automotive Stamping and Assemblies Limited, Mahindra and Mahindra Limited and TATA Motors Limited, Volkswagen Group, JBM group etc. Steel scrap is supplied in loose as well as bundled form. MTC Group is handling around 3.00 million metric tons of metals annually, having achieved a sales turnover of more than INR 8,000 crore in FY 2019.
Wide product portfolio coupled with large and established customer base

The Group is engaged in trading of various ferrous and non-ferrous scrap, alloys, coke, coal, steel products and others. Its product basket includes more than 25 products such as metallurgical coke, HR and CR coils, aluminum scrap, copper and zinc scrap, HR plates and other steels products. MTC also undertakes manufacturing of structural steel products such channels, angles, beams and others; which account for around 10% of its topline. Majority of its products are sold in the domestic market and the Group has a clientele base of more than 600 customers. Some of its customers include, Jindal Stainless Limited, M.M. Ceramic and Ferro Alloys (group Group), Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited, Mideast Integrated Steels Limited, Vijaya Steel, Shakti Auto Works and others. It caters across various sectors such as foundries, steel manufacturing and automobile sector. Long standing relationship with customers provides revenue visibility to the whereas a wide customer base mitigates the risk of customer concentration. Thus a wide product basket along with large and established clientele base renders revenue visibility and is expected to sustain the Group?s business profile over the near to medium term.
Efficient procurement/distribution system ensuring ease in sourcing and supply of products

The MTC Group has warehouses/yards located across different states where the major automobile OEM?s, foundries and steel producers have presence. It has around eight warehouses based in the major cities of northern and western parts of the country, which include Maharashtra, Bengaluru, Chennai, Ahmedabad and others. Further, it also has presence near major foundries or steel rolling mills. This enables procuring materials directly from suppliers and providing it to customers within short span of time. As informed, the lead-time from sourcing to supply of material is about 45-50 days. It follows a just-in-time approach to enable timely delivery to the customers. Further, these yards are well-equipped with all required machinery like Hydraulic Baling Press Machines, Shearing Machines, Spectrometer, Heavy duty trucks and large warehousing areas for handling the scrap as per customer?s specific requirements. These companies collect scrap generated from major OEM?s and steel plants regularly and bring them to their godowns and bundle & supplies them as per customer?s requirements. The scrap is generally bundled to different sizes such 8? x 8?, 10? x 10? and 12? x 12? using Baling Press Machines and also as per specific requirements of customers. Lab tests are conducted to analyze and ensure specific composition of material using Spectrometer and reports are provided to the customers in regard to chemical composition of material for low Sulphur, low Manganese etc. as per specific requirements of foundries.
Long standing experience of the promoters in the trading industry

MTC started its operations in 2000 and since then has been engaged in the business of trading of ferrous and non-ferrous scrap, ferro alloys and others. It is a part of the four decades old MTC group which is engaged in trading of metals, ferro alloys and automobiles. Mr. Narendra Maganlal Mehta, a second-generation entrepreneur has been managing the operations of the Group and has more than two decades of experience in this field. Over the years, the Group under his leadership has widened its product portfolio by venturing into trading of iron ore, coke, coal and other products such as billets, structural steel and others. During FY 2014, the Group also commenced manufacturing of steel products and its contribution to revenue was about 10% during FY 2019.The long-standing experience of the promoters in the industry and the knowledge of industry dynamics has helped the Group to establish good relationship with its customers and this is expected to improve and sustain its business profile over the medium term.

The Company under the able guidance of Mr. Kalpesh Bhaskar Mehta ? Managing Director, the third-generation entrepreneur and Mr. Bhaskar Mohanlal Mehta ? Chairman and Whole time Director has transferred the traditional manufacturing to value-added business, paving the way for high growth for the Company. The Board is also supported by well-structured second-tier functional heads.

Through strong managerial strategy and continuous efforts, the Company has developed portfolio of products which caters to diverse end-user industries including automobile components, pharmaceutical, cosmetics, silent motor (largely for white goods industry), and aeronautical industries. The expertise of the management has led to successful affiliations with key customers for more than 27 years including Autoliv India Private Limited, SKF India Limited, Schaeffler India Limited, Thomson Precision Steel Ball Co., Spherotech Inc., National Engineering Industries Limited, Autoliv India Private Limited and TRW Automotive amongst others. Reputed clientele enables the Company to ensure stable revenue stream, mitigate debtor?s realization risk, and helps in scouting prospective customers along with enhancing the brand image and building credibility.
Company?s established presence and over seven-decade long market experience has helped it gain market share in some applications like seat belt and aerosol products.
Thus, the Company is expected to continue to benefit from the experienced management which will help it to scale its operations going forward.
Increase in operating margin on back of improved production methods

To cater to increasing demands, the management has augmented its capacities in the past. It successfully collaborated with the Italian and French Company namely ICT and IPE to upgrade its operational methods at par with global standards. The management has also onboarded a Lean manufacturing expert, who is continuously improving manufacturing process in line with the developed countries consequently leading to productivity improvement. Lean TPM philosophy, channel concept and IOT helped Company improve production methods. It has rationalized the employee force from 620 people to around 290 people in the last 8 years. ERP implementation too helped in better inventory management and savings on material cost. The Company has witnessed an increase in output per manhour and reduction in material cost due to SAP implementation. This enabled the Company to attain higher operating efficiency which improved the margins from 9.35% in FY 2017 to 13.52% in FY 2019.

The Company expects the productivity to further increase to 65 tons per day from current 35 tons per day which will improve margins. The Company is currently under expansion stage and has completed the acquisition of a South Korean company?s assets in FY 2019.
