It is further expanding its Bilimora unit and adding 5 production lines to enhance capacity levels. Capacity additions and continuous productivity improvement is expected to enhance scale as well as margins.
Established track record coupled with extensive experience of promoters driving business growth

The Company has an established track record of over two decades that demonstrates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Company is currently led by Mr. Jayesh Shah, Chairman who has more than 4 decades of experience in the pharmaceutical industry. Strong domain knowledge of the promoter and qualified second tier management provides the Company with a significant competitive advantage to grow in the existing markets and enter new geographies. The long-standing experience of the management, coupled with their extensive knowledge of the industry dynamics has helped the Company to establish long lasting relationship with its customers and suppliers, thus providing the Company with the comfort of stable revenue streams and stable supply of raw materials. As informed, the Company has established relationship of upto 15 years with its key customers. Extensive experience of the management coupled with established relations with key customers will aid in sustaining the business profile of the Company over the medium term.
Asset light model of the Company resulting in an unleveraged capital structure

The Company follows an asset light model where in the manufacturing activities are outsourced. The business model begins with the understanding of customer requirements, seeking product details to lab scale development/validation & optimization, identification of relevant manufacturing facility for the outsourcing, sending sample for approval to the customer, pilot plant trials (if required), and ending with commercial trials. Also the Company trades in various levels of pharmaceutical preparations from API?s, Bulk drugs and formulations. In absence of the manufacturing activity, the asset base requirement of the Company stood low owing to which gearing of the Company stood low throughout the review period. Total debt equity of the Company stood below unity throughout the review period and stood comfortable at 0.35 times in FY 2019. Furthermore, as on 31st March 2019, ~84% of the total debt comprised unsecured loans from related parties. Low debt equity ratio provides scope for the expansion of business as well as to funding of incremental working capital requirement using external borrowings. Furthermore, the interest coverage ratio stood comfortable at 8.84 times in FY 2019 indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations.
Comfortable liquidity profile supported with efficient management of working capital operations

On the back of asset light business model of the Company and trading nature of operations, inventory requirements stood negligible thereby shortening the working capital cycle. The working capital days hovered in the range of 18 to 54 days and stood negative in FY 2015 due to high payable days. Working capital requirements of the Company are primarily driven by the management of receivable and payable days. Collection velocity of the Company witnessed steady improvement in FY 2018 and FY 2019 which has led to decline in utilization of working capital limits. Prudent management of working capital requirements have enabled the Company to maintain an adequate liquidity profile. Solvency ratios of the Company were adequate during the review period as witnessed in current ratio and quick ratio of 5.50 and 5.29 times respectively in FY 2019. Adequate liquidity profile is also witnessed in net cash accruals of the Company which stood at INR 97,725 which were adequate against the minimal near-term debt obligations of INR 919 thousand during FY 2019. Furthermore, unencumbered cash balances and current investments of INR 307,491 thousand as on 31st March 2019 provides further cushion to its liquidity profile.
Adequate liquidity will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and provide comfort towards servicing its near term obligations
Extensive experience of management and established relations with the customers would drive the growth of the business

OCSPL is managed and controlled by Mr. Manish Mangilal Shah (Managing Director), having an experience of over two decades in the speciality chemical business. Further, Mr. Vikas M. Shah, Director of the Company, also has an experience of over two decades in the field of manufacturing and trading of chemicals. This relevant experience coupled with business networking in the industry helps in driving the business of the Company.

As informed, extensive trading experience has also helped the Company to anticipate movement in prices of raw materials which helps it in right stocking of raw materials. Leveraging on promoter?s vast trading experience, the Company successfully forayed into manufacturing. It provides research-based services, custom manufacturing of chemical intermediates catering to global innovators. Currently the manufacturing to trading sale is in the proportion of 34:66. The proportion has increased in the last three year period and Company foresees to further increase its manufacturing sale going forward. Further, it has established strong relations with reputed clients such as Insecticides India Limited, Saltigo GmbH, Bayer Crop Science Limited amongst others. It has a wide customer base comprising of over 100 customers and none of them accounts for more than 20% of the total revenue.

Technical expertise and experience of directors coupled with professional team provide strong foundation base. Strong business relationship with leading clients provides the Company a stable revenue stream amongst other benefits like global visibility, mitigation of debtor?s realization risk etc. The Company has registered a healthy CAGR of about 27% aided by increased volumes on back of strong demand from chemical industry and on addition of new distributorships.
High returns owing to efficient utilization of funds

The Company?s operating profitability remained moderate at about 8% in FY 2019. Operating profitability has increased in the last three year review period from 4.8% in FY 2017 to 7.96% in FY 2019 due to expanding manufacturing sale. Despite, moderate profitability, the Company?s returns remained high owing to better working capital management. Moreover, as informed, the Company earns a high margin on manufacturing sale as it produces customized products catering to innovator companies. Further, it commands a higher margin on speciality product range. Specialty products are priced on an average INR 300 per kilogram (kg) as compared to inorganic chemicals which have an average price of around INR 12 per kg. In addition, y-o-y capex requirement was majorly met through internal accruals thus limiting its borrowings. High returns indicate efficient utilization of funds. In FY 2018 and FY 2019, the returns improved with revenue growth and increased margins.
Improving gearing y-o-y and high interest coverage provides financial flexibility

The Company?s gearing level improved from 0.94 times as on 31st March 2017 to about 0.77 times as on 31st March 2019. The improved gearing was on account of high accretion to reserves supported by both increasing scale and profits. The net cash accruals increased from INR 11.20 crores in FY 2017 to INR 28.26 crores in FY 2019. Additional capital expenditure during the review period along with a high capital expenditure of about INR 22 crores in FY 2019 was majorly funded internally. Also, the promoters advanced loans to the Company to fund its incremental working capital requirement. The gearing would further improve on exclusion of unsecured loans from the promoters/related parties.

Low gearing level provides financial flexibility to Company to raise funds as and when required. OCSPL?s short term working capital loans increased significantly in FY 2018 and FY 2019 due to incremental working capital requirement, however, the overall gearing remained low. Interest coverage ratio increased y-o-y and remained high at 7.25 times for FY 2019.
Extensive experience of the management leading to established relationship with customers and suppliers

The Company having established in the year1998 was initially engaged in job work for Tata Steel Limited. Later, in 2012, it entered into VSM (Vendor Service model) agreement with customers for processing various auto-grade steel to shape blanks. It has three manufacturing facilities with total production capacities of 36,000 MT for CR coils and 84,000 MT for HR coils. It also undertakes job work activities in Pune and Taloja plant for which it has 54,000 MT capacity.

Since incorporation, the business is led by the promoter family and currently headed by Mr. Asheer Ashok Kapoor, Managing Director, who holds a degree of Electrical and Electronics Engineer, having experience of around two decades along with Ms. Pinki Ashok Kapoor, Director, with experience of more than two decades in the manufacturing shape blanks of steel for auto sector. The long experience has helped Company enter into a VSM model with TSL (TSL, effective 3 years from 1st April 2018 to 31st March 2021), where Poshs Metal will provide services to TSL?s OEM customers like Bajaj Auto Limited, Piaggio Group & Tata Motors Limited and their vendors at the price negotiated between TSL and OEM. Also, it does the job work for TSL (classified as steel processing division) which is about 1% of the total revenue. Also, nearly 95% of the purchase is from Tata Steel Limited and has established relation with it since inception.

Through the VSM model, the Company has established long term relationship with aforesaid OEM?s and their vendors like Neel Auto Private Limited, Yeshshree Press Comps Private Limited, Rucha Engineers Private Limited, Klassic Wheels Private Limited and Nahar?s Engineering India Private Limited. The Company has been able to maintain average relationship of more than 5 years with these customers. This ensures repeat orders from them. Also, in FY 2019, Poshs Metal added a new customer - Bentler.

Poshs? Metal registered a high revenue CAGR during the last three-year period ending FY 2018 due to increase in business from Bajaj Auto Limited. For FY 2019, as indicated, the Company grew by 10% over previous year and revenues stood at INR 500 crores with PAT of INR 4.78 crore.
Wide spectrum of services offered to diversified industry base

PureSoftware is aÿsoftware productÿand services company that focuses on driving aÿdifferentiatedÿcustomer experience, accelerating cycle time and improving business outcomes through the integration ofÿdigital solutions,ÿrobotic automation, and non-linear commercial models. PureSoftware provides value-driven services and solutions to its customers by leveraging its offerings in Digital,ÿProduct Engineering, andÿApplication Developmentÿand Management.ÿ As informed, about 15-20% of the revenue is derived from digital applications and application services and the product engineering services contribute equally to the total revenues. Wide spectrum of service offering and Puresoftware?s key focus on customer delight while catering to its client?s requirement has not only helped it to increase repeat orders but also increased customer base year on year. As indicated, the Company has added 10-12 client every year and currently has a customer base of 40 customers. Repeat to new order mix is around 75:25. It has secured increased orders from the existing clients during the review period resulting in healthy revenue growth. Thus, the Company benefits from being a full spectrum software service provider, which will continue to drive its scale of operations going forward. Its revenues grew at a healthy CAGR of 37% in the last three year period ending FY 2019 and expects revenue of 130-150 crore by the end of FY 2020 at the consolidated level. As indicated Company has already achieved 65% of the FY 2019 revenues for the six-month ending September 2019.

In addition, it caters to range of industries and business domains such as Telecom,ÿFinancial Services,ÿLife Sciences,ÿHi-Tech,ÿGaming,ÿetc. It derives major revenues from the BFSI and life science sector contributing around 30-35% of the total revenues. This enables the Company to diversify its risk against downturn in any specific industry.
Low dependence on debt and strong debt protection metrics

Being a low capital-intensive business, the Company?s long-term borrowings have remained low. Also, Company is been able to manage its receivable cycle (which depicted an increasing trend) through cash accruals with zero short term borrowings. As a result, despite moderate net worth of around INR 24 crore, its capital structure remained underleveraged. Low gearing resulted in adequate interest coverage ratio. Comfortable capital structure provides financial flexibility to the Company to leverage further in case of any business exigencies.
Strong and experienced management helps in driving business

The Company is headed by Mr. Anil Baid, who is the Director, President and Chief Strategy Officer of Puresoftware. He has a sound technical background with around 15 years of experience in IT industry. The Company started as testing service provider and subsequently widened its service base to include product development, implementation amongst others in the ITes industry. He is supported by Mr Sameer Jain (Chief Business Officer) and Mr. Manish Sharma (Chief Exrcutive officer) along with other members on the Board and key executives, who are well qualified and highly experienced in their domain areas. This relevant experience and business networking helps in driving the business of the Company, as indicated in the y-o-y revenue growth and high customer contract renewals during the review period.
Established track record and experienced management driving business growth

The Company has a long track record of over a decade that demonstrates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Company is engaged in providing software and hardware products, services and solutions and is a vertically integrated communication systems and transformative technology solution provider. The company has built its products around in-house designed highly configurable ASICs which provide the edge over its competition. The Company is currently led by Mr. Parag Naik, Chief Executive Officer, who has more than two decades experience. He is ably supported by experienced management team undertaking operations of the Company. This extensive experience provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company. Under the current management the Company has been able to grow at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of around 177.48% over the years through FY 2019. As informed, for H1 FY 2020, revenue stood at USD 8.18 Mn, while PBT and PAT stood at USD 1.37 Mn and USD 1.07 Mn respectively.
Debt free capital structure and comfortable liquidity position provides financial flexibility

Capital structure of the Company stood adequate throughout the review period with debt-free operations during FY 2018 and FY 2019 thereby indicating no dependence on external borrowings for working capital and manufacturing activities. An unleveraged capital structure would provide financial flexibility to the Company and would make it easy to raise funds for any of its expansion plans, especially for the inorganic opportunities. Further, unleveraged capital structure also supports the overall liquidity position in terms of no cash flow burn towards servicing the near-term debt maturities. Thus, the Company can utilize entire of its net cash accruals in funding the working capital requirements or for meeting the capital expenditure requirements. Moreover, overall liquidity position of the Company stands adequate as reflected in current ratio and quick ratio of 7.83 times and 7.32 times respectively as on 31st March 2019. Liquidity is further supported in positive cash flow from operating activities throughout the review period and unencumbered cash and bank balance and fixed deposit of INR 363,339 thousand as on 31st March 2019.
Comfortable liquidity position will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans which would result in increased scale of operations.
Diversified product portfolio offered coupled with wide geographical presence

SLPL is engaged in providing software and hardware services and solutions and is a vertically integrated communication systems and transformative technology solution provider. The Company has over 27 international technology patents. It provides a wide range of communication products for terrestrial satellite and broadcast applications. The key product segments include SDR chipsets, uner the satellite communication products, it offers S Band products, L Band products and IOT application products. Under its broadcast segment, its solutions provide a paradigm for NextGen DTT by creating uniformly high strength to support direct to mobile indoor reception. The products manufactured find usability in diverse applications including digital televisions, set top boxes, home theaters, satellite modulators, boradband modems, survelliance, remote monitoring and control, emergency warnings for disaster management, asset tracking, smart agriculture, military communication systems. This eliminates dependence on a single industry and helps the Company to diversify its risk as well as provides scope for diversified revenue streams. Moreover the Company has diversified geographical reach with exports contributing to almost 73% in the total revenues of the Company during FY 2019. Geographical diversification helps the Company to survive regulatory uncertainties related to a single geographical region.

The Company is led by Promoter, Chairman and Whole Time Director, Mr. Kantilal Devchandbhai Patel. Mr. Patel holds a Masters? in Science (chemistry) with more than four decades of experience of which more than 3 decades have been in related field. He has been instrumental in the Company?s diversification into GLR in FY 2011. He is ably supported by his sons, Mr. Sachin K. Patel and Mr. Kaumil K. Patel, who are Managing Directors in the Company. Mr. Sachin K. Patel is a Chemical Engineer while Mr. Kaumil K. Patel has a Bachelors? in Commerce and has completed an additional course in plastic engineering. They have more than two decades of experience in related industry.

This extensive experience of management and their track record in driving the Company?s growth till date provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company which would help in driving the growth of business. This experience has helped the Company secure/execute orders from 3,000 clients and achieve revenue growth with CAGR of 31.48%. The Company, as informed, expects to achieve a turnover of INR 130 crore in FY 2020 of which INR 40 crore is already achieved and pending orders worth INR 60 crore are to be delivered by December 2019.
A good track record of growing revenues y-o-y with no instance of revenue declines reflects strength of the business model and management capabilities.
Strong and reputed clientele base with long standing relationships

The Company is engaged in manufacturing filter press equipment & parts since 1982 and glass lined reactors since 2011. These products cater to varied industries. Over the years, the Company has developed a strong client base having executed orders for more than 3,000 customers. The Company has maintained strong relationships with most of these customers. Further, the Company has maintained long term business relationship of more than a decade with certain strong and reputed customers which has helped it gain y-o-y repeat orders.

Major customers of the Company include Meghmani Organics Limited (18 years), Gharda Chemical Limited (13 years), Hemani Industries Limited (5 years), Hikal Limited (5 years), Madhu silica Private Limited (4 years), Transpek Industry Limited, Aurobindo Limited, Jubilant Life Science Limited, Adani Wilmar Limited, Gravita India Limited, Kiri Industries Limited, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Limited, Bekaert Industries Private Limited, UPL Limited, Aether Industries Limited, ITC group, Saraca Laboratories Limited, Suven Lifesciences Limited, Shreya industries Ltd, GE Water, Bodal Chemical Limited amongst others. Large number of credible customers providing repeat orders to the Company ensures steady revenue visibility for the future.
Wide end-user industry application provides safety from cyclical downtrend suffered in an Industry

The Company?s products find wide application in various industries such as pharmaceutical, chemical, pesticides, food processing, insecticides, minerals & mines, petrochemicals, defence, oil & refinery, paper, edible oil and common & individual effluent treatment plants (ETP). As informed, at present the Company obtains majority of its revenue from Petrochemicals, Pharmaceuticals and common & individual effluent treatment plant (ETP). However, the Company has plans to capitalize of other industries as well. Hence, comfort can be taken from the fact that its revenues are not largely impacted by the cyclical down trend suffered in any one end-use industry.
Improving profit margins driven by improvement in scale of operations

Although the profitability of the Company has fluctuated during the review period; the same has improved at all levels in FY 2019 as against FY 2018. The increased orders from the GLR segment especially for reactors with higher capacity has helped SIL to achieve improved margins. The improvement in profitability has also helped in achieving improved and healthy returns as can be witnessed in the table below. Further, the strategic technology tie-up with JL Laboratories Inc. enables SIL a competitive edge against other players and provides further boost to revenue (expected to net a revenue of INR 130 crore in FY 2020) and margins.

Further, the increased revenue has also helped in absorption of fixed and semi-variable cost over a larger revenue base leading to economies of scale and thereby improving profitability. The improvement in profitability has also led to improved return indicators indicating efficient fund management. However, sustenance of profitability and return indicators while scaling up operations will remain crucial.
Inorganic growth leading to well-diversified geographical presence and extensive product portfolio

The Group was engaged in three business verticals, human API, specialty chemical and animal health. Management reviewed its business strategy with success in building its animal health business- Alivira. Thus, it decided to hive-off its other business verticals thereby concentrating on building animal health business which has limited competition and is entirely driven by branded generics. The growth strategy adopted by the Group involves aggressive acquisition of new technologies, businesses, products and services to create strategic partnerships and also to expand animal healthcare product portfolio. It aims to be a top 10 global animal health company by FY 2022.

The Group in the last four years has completed nine strategic acquisitions across Europe, Turkey and LATAM to create a strong global management team and enhance its presence in key markets. It acquired Provet Veterinary Products, TopkimIlac Premiks San, Lyka Exports Limited, Fendigo SA and BV, N-Vet AB, Karizoo Group, Bremer Pharma etc. to augment its revenues through geographical diversification.

These acquisitions created a footprint for Alivira in the European Union market as well as the key markets of Mexico, Europe, Emerging markets and Brazil. This strategy has helped the Group establish a strong formulations business with presence in key markets of Europe, Latin America, India, Turkey and parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It has global marketing presence in more than 100 countries and direct operations in 11 nations.

Further, this acquisition led to strengthening its production capabilities and necessary approvals from regulatory authorities. With seven manufacturing facilities based in India, Spain, Germany, Brazil and Turkey, some of them being approved by global regulatory bodies, including the USFDA and EUGMP, among others.

The Group enjoys a comprehensive portfolio covering animal feed, nutritional and therapeutic classes and addresses multitude of species across therapy classes in key markets globally like Europe, LATAM, Turkey, India, Africa, SE Asia, France, US & Ukraine. Product wise Sequent possess a wide range of dosage forms including injectables, powders, granules, solutions, suspensions and topicals with over 500+ Finished Dosage Formulations (FDFs) across 12 dosage forms & key therapies. Sequent is a dominant player in nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) Antibiotics Anthelmintics, Vitamins Prostaglandins Hormonal Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) predominantly in Anthelmintics and emerging NSAID portfolio. Also, recently in April 2018, it acquired Bremer Pharma (injectable manufacturing), a Company based in Germany. It has 400 registrations across vitamins, antibiotics and hormones thus further extending its product portfolio.

This acquisitions thus, enhanced its market position in both formulations and API (around 50% of sales came from global Top 10 animal health companies in FY 2019), diversified its geographical base (with presence in more than 100 countries) and helped in expansion of its product portfolio (26 commercial API?s and more than 500 fixed dosages across 12 dosage forms). As indicated, the pipeline in the formulations segment looks robust with over 35 products at various stages of development. In FY 2019, the Europe business which accounts for over 50% of the total revenue grew at 7% with addition of 18 new products in the market. As apprised, the Group manufactures world?s largest injectable product at Bremer facility which has been a positive development for FY 2019. Thus, on the back of extensive product profile along with acquisitions, the topline of the Company has observed substantial growth over the past few years.
Comfortable capital structure due to y-o-y capital infusion through Qualified Institutional Placements (QIP), private placements and conversion of warrants to equity

The capital structure of the Group stood underleveraged with DE of 0.69 times as on 31st March 2019 majorly skewed towards term loans on the back of sizeable networth of INR 4,704,170 thousand in FY 2019. Intangible assets comprised majorly of goodwill on acquisition. During FY 2017, share capital and share premium of the Group increased due to conversion of 5,500,000 warrants issued on preferential basis at a conversion price of INR 95 per equity share resulting in accretion in the tangible networth. The tangible networth grew in FY 2019 owing to retention of entire profits in the business along with infusion of equity. In FY 2016 the Group had infused equity capital through QIP amounting to around INR 4,000,000 thousand and private placements of around INR 525,000 thousand. Long term loans of the Group comprised of term loans from banks & financial institutions, unsecured loans and loans from directors/ promoters whereas short term loans comprised of cash credit loans and loans from directors/ promoters. As informed, interest rates for these borrowings were between 10-12%.

A lower debt component would provide financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. As informed by the management, this infusion of capital was primarily to fund the acquisitions undertaken by the Group. These acquisitions done by the Group is a part of its marketing strategy to increase its global footprint in animal health business. Further, as informed, recent acquisition of Bremer, a German Company, was made through QIP which was raised in FY 2016. This indicates judicious use of funds by the management. As informed, API business of the Group is well capitalized. The expected capex for FY 2020 is around 20 and 25 Crores INR which will include both maintenance capex, and growth capex on a per year basis for the API business. In the formulation space, the Group is expecting facility expansion in Bremer of around 2 million US$ over the next two years.

The Group is managed by Mr. Manish Gupta, Managing Director, who holds a degree in engineering and management, and has over 22 years of experience in pharmaceutical sector. He is supported by Mr. Sharat Naraspur, Joint Managing Director, holding a degree in chemical engineering, with an experience over 28 years in the pharmaceutical, agrochemical and chemical industry. Further, Chairman and Independent Director, Mr. Gautam Kumar Das, holds a Doctorate in synthetic organic chemistry and has 40 years of experience in pharmaceutical and chemical industry. As apprised, Mr. Sirjiwan Singh joined the Group in FY 2019 as Head of Technical Operations and will provide strategic insights into the injectable business of the Group. The Group also plans to induct leadership in the US market as that would be the revenue driver going ahead. This experienced and qualified management provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Group which would help in driving the growth of business as envisaged in y-o-y growth in revenues and acquisitions undertaken in the past 4 years. Revenue saw a compounded annual growth of over 22% during the review period at Group level.
Improvement in working capital management and liquidity profile

The working capital cycle of the Group depicted substantial improvement during the review period and stood at 59 days in FY 2019 marked by a drop in collection and inventory period along with extended credit availed from suppliers. The short term debt equity ratio of the Group stood low at 0.26 times as on 31st March 2019 implying that working capital was being managed majorly through customer advances (INR 69,670 thousand in FY 2019) and extended payables. The liquidity profile of the Group showcased an improvement during the review period with current and quick ratio of 1.38 times and 0.91 times as on 31st March 2019. Net cash accruals of the Group also improved from INR 456,930 thousand in FY 2018 to INR 987,970 thousand in FY 2019 along with improvement in cash flow from operations during the same period. Year-end bank balance of FY 2019 stood at INR 677,890 thousand further cushioning the liquidity.

The Company is led by Mr. Dinesh Patidar, Chairman and Managing Director, who has an experience of more than three decades in the relevant industry. He is supported by a strong second hierarchy of management. Together, the management has increased the scale of business of the Company to more than INR 5,000 million in FY 2019. Further, the management has been constantly innovating and integrating in its field to produce support structures, pipes, electronic and control components, etc. to support its current operations by increasing efficiency and effectiveness as well as relevance in the industry. The continuous R&D undertaken has also helped the Company to introduce new products with better technology and remain price relevant in the highly competitive pumps market. Going forward, with increasing competition and new products in the pipeline, the management?s relevant experience and business networking capabilities could help in driving the business of the Company.
Diversified product portfolio coupled with widespread distribution network resulting into well spread geographical reach

The product profile of the Company comprises wide range of submersible pumps and motors, solar pumps, end suction pumps, vertical multistage centrifugal pumps, open well pumps, pressure booster pumps, self-priming pumps, immersible pumps, etc. that have diverse applications across several industries including agricultural, building services, general water supply, mining, oil & gas, sewage & waste water applications among others. As informed, the Company is one of the leading manufacturers of agricultural pumps sets (which contribute to more than 70% to the total revenue) and has established position in the market. Further, the Company over the years have also started manufacturing other components which has allowed it to operate as an integrated manufacturing solutions provider for agricultural pumps. The Company now provides starters, VFDs, pumps, motors, rotors, etc. and has group companies/subsidiaries manufacturing other relevant components like pipes, structures for installation, etc. thereby offering a one stop solution to its suppliers. Further, the Company is set to launch its hybrid inverters which would be grid connected and can derive electricity both from solar applications and the grid ensuring continuous supply.

The strong product portfolio is supported by multiple distribution channels and a large network of dealers across various geographies and offices set up in the overseas locations. As informed, the Company is one of the few companies in India which offers stainless steel pumps. The Company has branches across 19 states in India and a network of more than 350 dealers across the country. Globally, the Company?s products are sold in more than 125 countries. Robust network of dealers for distributing Company?s products helps create brand visibility in remote areas. Also, the Company has set up subsidiaries in USA, UAE, Bangladesh and Australia in order to gain local presence, marketing and to improve product availability. Diversified product portfolio coupled with widespread distribution network and geographical presence is expected to mitigated product and geographical risk ensuring smooth operations in the future.
Comfortable capital structure leading to adequate interest coverage ratio

Despite y-o-y improvement in scale of operations, the Company?s capital structure has remained comfortable. The debt equity ratio of the Company remained comfortable at 0.61 times as on 31st March 2019 with majority of debt comprising short term working capital loans. The Company kept its long-term borrowings minimum throughout the review period which limited its exposure to external debt. The gearing of the Company during the review period is given in the table below.

As seen in the above table, majority of the Company?s assets have been funded through the Company?s internal accruals and equity funds as total liabilities to tangible networth remains less than 100%. Dependence on external debt is limited to short term borrowings which are dependent on the drawing power of the Company.

Low dependence on external borrowings has also led to comfortable interest coverage ratio which stood at 4.40 times as on 31st March 2019. As informed, the Company, at present, does not have any plans in near future to invest in capital expenditure. Comfortable capital structure allows borrowing of external funds in case of any business exigencies or for incremental working capital requirements and capex plans permitting financial flexibility to the Company.
Uneven yet adequate profitability margins during the review period

Though the Company?s profitability has shown an uneven trend during the review period, other than in FY 2016, the profitability has remained comfortable as shown in the table below. The Company is one of the few companies in India which offers stainless steel pumps. Stainless steel pumps are priced higher than cast iron pumps owing to features like higher energy efficiency, long life and lower maintenance cost. The Company has been able to maintain comfortable margins during the review period.

However, as informed, the margins are currently facing some pressure due to the highly competitive market which has resulted in some erosion of margins in FY 2019. The Company has been constantly integrating its operations to deal with this and has also brought in several new products under its gamut to position itself as a fully integrated manufacturer for pump set installations. Going ahead, the Company expects to hold on to these margins with better efficiency and integration in operations as also with increase in retail sales which are expected to contribute to 5-10% of the total revenue in the next 1-3 years.

On the other hand, despite adequate profitability, the return indicators of the Company remain constrained due to the high working capital requirement of the Company which has been funded through both internal accruals as well as external short term working capital borrowings.
Management experience, technical collaborations, and focus on R&D leading to established market position

Established in 1986, the Company has been engaged in manufacturing exhaust systems and other automobile components for over three decades. Mr. Ajay Relan (Founder and Managing Director), is an alumni of the Harvard Business School (Owner/President management programme) and has an extensive experience of over 36 years in automobile component industry. The Company has entered into technical collaboration with companies worldwide like Sejong Industrial Company Limited and Bosal NV for acquiring latest technical know-how and to establish the quality requirements of the customers in automobile and white goods industry. The JV agreement with Toyo Seat Co. Ltd., Japan for the design, development, evaluation, manufacture, and supply of four wheeler seat components has, as informed, helped the Company widen its product profile and improve its market position.

In August 2019, it entered into another JV with Germany-based Eberspaecher Exhaust Technology International for business development of BS VI norms in commercial vehicle segment in India. In future, in order to comply with the highest emission standard Bharat Stage VI, the new joint venture will develop, produce and sell exhaust after-treatment systems for Indian commercial vehicle manufacturers.As informed, the Company has a market share of around 30% in the exhaust system business and accounts for approximately 90% of the requirement of M&M, and Hyundai Motor India Limited.

Further, Sharda Motors has been investing substantially in the research and development infrastructure to improve production process, increase operating efficiency, and launch new products adhering to the strict emission norms of Bharat Stage ? VI. R&D expense stood at INR 232,855 thousand in FY 2019 (INR 162,217 thousand in FY 2018) or 2.06% of the total revenue signifying the impetus on process automation and research given by the Company.

This experience and networking ability of the directors, backed by continued focus on R&D has enabled the Company to develop healthy business relationships with OEM?s such as Mahindra and Mahindra Limited (M&M) and Hyundai Motor India Limited for over two decades. Sharda Motor, as informed, also enjoys exclusive supplier agreement with M&M for the front suspension system.
Wide range of product offerings coupled with established business relationships with OEMs provides revenue visibility

The Company offers a diversified product portfolio including exhaust systems, catalytic converters, suspension systems, sheet metal components, fuel tank, canopies and plastic parts for the automotive and white goods industry. These products are applied to various segments in the automotive sector including passenger cars, Sport Utility Vehicles (SUVs), two wheelers, three wheelers, trucks, etc. wherein the Company is either a preferred or an exclusive supplier of components for some of the leading domestic OEMs including Mahindra and Mahindra Limited, Hyundai Motor India Limited, Tata Motors Limited, Cummins, Ashok Leyland, SML Isuzu Limited, Force Motors Limited etc. Sharda Motor also shares a long- standing relationship with its major customers for more than 10 - 15 years. Being an exclusive supplier to M&M for the front suspension systems, provides the Company with a competitive edge. Further, the Company would consolidate its advent into the commercial vehicle segment with incremental orders from Ashok Leyland Limited and it expects revenue from this segment to increase to around 15-20% in FY 2021. Also, it has started supplying components to the tractor segment and three wheeler segment in order to further de-risk itself from downturn in any car segment. This is evident from addition of customers including Eicher Motors Limited, Greaves Cotton Limited, TAFE in FY 2019. It has received approx. INR 35 crore orders from Cummins Inc. for the current fiscal.

The Company operates through its 14 manufacturing facilities (including R&D) spread across major automotive OEM hubs in India. OEMs are spread across India in clusters with majority regions being Chennai (Tamil Nadu), North Capital Region, Pune (Maharashtra), Nasik (Maharashtra), Haridwar (Uttarakhand) and Sanand (Gujarat). Thus, its propinquity to OEM?s reduces logistic and freight expenses giving Sharda Motor a cost advantage over its competitors.

Strong business relationship with these leading OEMs provides the Company with a stable revenue stream amongst other benefits like global visibility, better bargaining power as compared to small players, reduced risk of bad debts, etc.
Prudent working capital management resulting in comfortable capital structure and improvement in liquidity

The Company over the years, has been able to prudently manage its working capital requirements partly through internal accruals, customer advances, and favourable credit terms with customers & suppliers with flexibility of extended credit from supplier, thereby reducing dependence on external borrowings. This has resulted in almost nil utilization of its working capital facilities.

Further, absence of any major capex plans coupled with repayment of entire term loans by FY 2018, and increasing accretions to reserves; the Company has a healthy tangible networth of INR 4,365,344 thousand coupled with no debt on its balance sheet. Lower working capital utilization, high liquid investments, and cash balance also led to an improvement in current and quick ratio of the Company which stood at 1.98 and 1.54 times respectively as on 31st March 2019.
Conscious efforts towards cost optimization measures and core products resulting in improvement in profitability and return indicators

The Company derived around 70% of its revenue from vehicle engine components while 27% from seat covers/componentsand remaining 3% from trading in FY 2018. Its revenues depicted a stable increase between FY 2014-18, however, due to its increased focus on vehicle components and proposed demerger of seating business, its revenue share from the seating business (also a relatively low margin business) has been declining. Revenue from seats declined by around 30% from approx. INR 310 crorein FY 2018 to INR 215 crorein FY 2019. This downturn resulted in overall decline in revenue in FY 2019. However, this decline was compensated by increasing business from vehicle components as evident from a net overall revenue decline of only 1.44% in FY 2019. As informed, the revenue share from seats further declined to 9% of the total revenue recorded in Q1 FY 2020 (19% in FY 2019) and the management plans to transfer the entire seats business to a wholly owned subsidiary.
The overall impact of the strategic shift to relatively higher margin vehicle component business, resulted in sharp increase in margins as it increased at all levels in FY 2019.

Moreover, the Company?s efforts towards improving operational efficiency (through in-house R&D resulting in considerable cost savings) resulted in improvement in operating margins. Further, on the back of full repayment of term loans and lower working capital utilization, the interest expenditure declined further aiding the net margins and return indicators.
The management has given a guidance that with increasing share of vehicle components and likely orders for exports, the margins of the Company are projected to continue to improve.
Extensive management experience coupled with discerning customer base

Established in 1998 as a partnership concern, the Company is engaged in manufacturing multi-track, collar type and lined carton packing machines. The product profile of the Company comprises free flowing products, non-free flowing products, liquids & pastes and lined cartons. Mr. Virendra Sharma, Managing Director, is at the helm of affairs since the Company?s inception and has decades of experience in manufacturing of packaging machineries. This relevant experience has provided networking capabilities to the management driving the business.

The Company has association with reputed players such as Procter and Gamble (P&G), Unilever, Anand Milk Union Limited (Amul), Coca-Cola Company, Mother Dairy Fruit & Vegetable Private Limited (Mother Dairy), Heinz Company, ITC Limited, Nestle Limited amongst other for (POST MD- Duration).

The total debt equity ratio of the Company stood comfortable at 0.55 times in FY 2017 and FY 2018, mainly skewed towards term loans. Further, on exclusion of unsecured loans, the gearing declined to 0.27 times in FY 2018. (post MD- REASONS FOR THE TERM LOANS ETC) Underleveraged capital structure provides financial flexibility in case of business exigencies or procure additional funds for capex plans. Interest coverage indicator remained strong at 4.11 times in FY 2018.

The Company is managed and controlled by Dr. Gautam Vinod Daftary, Chairman and Director of the Company who has an experience of three decades in the healthcare industry. Further, he has done Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery. Further, promoter is supported by experienced and qualified professional team. Company. Company had appointed Dr. Vatsal Shah as Chief Operating Officer during FY 2015-16 and recently in 2019, he has been designated as the Global Chief Operating Officer leading the US operations. He is a physician and has rich experience of 20 years of varied experience encompassing all phases of clinical research and all document types for medical writing ? from academia as well as all industry perspectives (pharma, CRO, business process outsourcing). Also, as a part of succession plan, Company has been joined by Mr. Akshay Daftary and Mr. Karan Daftary, Sons of Mr. Gautam Daftary. Mr. Akshay Daftary has bachelor?s degree in Arts and undergraduate degree from Emory University in Economics & Mathematics and has an experience of 4 years. While, Mr. Karan Daftary has bachelor?s degree in Business Administration and a Concentration in Finance and has an experience of around 1 year.
This relevant qualification, experience and business networking facilitates in driving the business of the Company.
Established relationship with reputed customers & tie-ups with various hospitals

The Company has an established presence in the domestic market as well as international market and has strong relationship with customers. Company has a long and established track record in the clinical research industry and has been associated with more than 200 clients in last 20 year. Major customers of the Company include reputed pharmaceutical companies such as Janssen Research & Development LLC (USA), Baxalta Innovations GmbH (Austria), Novartis Healthcare Private Limited (India), Cipla Limited (India), Mylan Laboratories Limited (India), Medimmune LLC (USA) and Merz Pharmaceuticals GmbH (Germany), amongst others. Top 5 customers contributed around 58% of the revenue in FY 2019. A healthy relationship with customers helps in securing new orders, ensuring repeated business and mitigating debtor?s realization risk. Repeat business accounts for around 70% of the total revenue of the Company.

Further, the Company has tie-ups with around 1300 hospitals and more than thousand investigators (doctors who actually conduct and monitor the trials). All these investigators are certified as GCP compliant doctors. Established relationship with hospitals gives competitive edge to the Company over the other players.

The Company?s capital structure remained below 1 time with improving trend throughout the review period. Overall gearing of the Company improved from 0.91 times as on 31st March 2017 to 0.03 times as on 31st March 2019 mainly due to repayment of both long term and short term loan during the review period. As on 31st March 2019, Company only had vehicle loan and financial lease obligation amounting to INR 9,017 thousand in form of debt. Low debt provides a financial flexibility for procuring additional funds for any working capital requirement or for further expansion plans, and unforeseen exigencies.

Also, interest coverage ratio of the Company depicted an improving trend during the review period and stood strong at 11.09 times in FY 2019. It improved during the review period mainly on account of reduction in interest expenses due to decline in total debt of the Company.
Experienced and qualified management coupled with reputed clientele driving the revenue growth

It has experienced management team that is currently led by Mr. Srikar Palem Reddy, the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer, who has an extensive experience of more than three decades in the IT industry. Also, the Group is guided by a Board consisting of various luminaries including Mr. Pradip Shah, who is the non-executive independent director and Chairman of Sonata. He was one of the founding members of various organizations including HDFC Limited and the founder Managing Director of the Credit Rating Information Services of India Limited. (CRISIL).The long-standing experience of the management has helped the Group to build established relationship with customers, thus ensuring repeat orders. This is reflected in the Group?s significant revenue growth at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 15.19% during the review period.

The Group has a reputed clientele base, which includes TUI Group, Microsoft Corporation, Johnson & Johnson Services Incorporation, PennyMac Loan Services, LLC, Aquent Impex India Private Limited etc. Reputed clientele provides comfort about the ability of the Group to minimize realization risks and aids in providing revenue visibility. It also has various strategic and technological alliances with global IT companies like Microsoft Corporation, SAP, IBM, Oracle Corporation and Hewlett Packard. During FY 2019, Group formed two key partnerships ? one with AutonomIQ for autonomous testing solutions and another with Retail10X (an AI software-as-a-service platform Company) to further strengthen focus in retail. These partnerships help the group to derive newer customers due to its recognized partner / vendor status for various services and solutions offered along with the products of the US technology companies. As informed by the management, the renewal rate of customers for new orders is 99%, thus improving the visibility of revenue to the group. The Group added 31 new customers in FY 2019 thus increasing revenue visibility.

The Group would continue to benefit from the extensive industry experience of promoters, reputed clientele, which could help on scaling up the operations as well as garner wider customer base going forward.

The Group?s financial risk profile is supported by low leverage and strong debt protection measures, marked by a gearing of 0.04 times as on 31st March 2019. Majority of its capital expenditure and working capital requirements are met through internal accruals which coupled with healthy net worth base, resulted in low reliance on external borrowings. A lower debt component when compared with Group?s healthy tangible networth would provide the Group financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Further, low existing debt exposure makes the Group more attractive to lenders as there is less risk in terms of the ability of the Group to service the loan. Low debt resulted in minimal interest expenditure thereby reducing the fixed obligations. Thus, almost debt-free capital structure will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.
Improving profitability at all levels from FY 2017

Revenue of the Group rose at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 15.19% during the review period. Steady growth of the Group during the review period is largely attributed to additions to its product/service offering that has enabled the Group to increase its revenue from the existing clients, new client additions, and grow inorganically via acquisitions. It increased in FY 2019 on account of addition of 31 new customers coupled with acquisition of Scalable Data Systems Pty Ltd, and Sopris Systems LLC.

Improvement in gross margin over the review period (except for a marginal dip in FY 2016) is primarily on account of better margins earned on incremental revenue coupled with dip in employee cost benefit during FY 2019. Operating profit margins improved in FY 2018 and FY 2019 on account of increase in gross profit margin coupled with decline general and administration expenditure as percentage of revenue (in FY 2018). Net profit margin moved in line with the operating profit margin (except for FY 2016). Improvement in net margins in FY 2018 and FY 2019 was contributed by decline in interest expenditure as percentage of revenue.

In FY 2019, international IT services contributed 38% of total revenues and 81% of PAT while domestic products and services contributed to 62% of the total revenues and 19% of profit after tax. Owing to limited value addition (except for pre and post implementation services) in this segment, its margins remained low at a Group level as compared to other IT companies which are pure play IT service providers. Despite the major revenue contributor being a low margin business, the Group?s return indicators on a consolidated level remain strong as follows:
Wide spectrum of services offered in diversified verticals

The Group is a fully integrated service player having a wide spectrum of services including Application Development & Maintenance (ADM), Packaged Application & Implementation, Product Support, Managed Testing, Product Engineering, Infrastructure Management, Product Quality Assurance Services, Business Intelligenceÿand Professional Services. Additionally, during FY 2019, Group acquired Australia headquartered Microsoft Dynamics 365 partner, Scalable Data Systems Pty Ltd and Sopris Systems LLC, providing Sonata Group with Additional IP and geographical reach. Experienced management coupled with strong relationship with customers provides revenue visibility

The Company is engaged in the processing and trading of organic and non -GMO agricultural products. Managing Director, Mr. Dilip Kumar Soni (promoter founder), has been associated with the Company since inception has more than two decades of experience in the food trading and processing industry. He is ably supported by qualified and experienced management team. The long-standing experience of the management, coupled with their extensive knowledge of the industry dynamics has helped the Company to establish long lasting relationship with its customers. The relevant experience of the management and networking helps the Company to sustain and improve its scale of operations as also reflected in the Company reporting healthy CAGR of 60.78% in revenue during the review period.

The customers of the Company include Bushman Organic Farms Inc., Perdue Agribusiness, etc. The Company enters into contracts with all the customers where in the contract duration ranges between 3 months to 1 year thus sustaining revenue visibility along with mitigating the debtors? realization risk. It further helps the Company to improve its bargaining power while dealing with new customers. As informed by the management the Company has contracts with all its customers ranging from 3 months to 1 year. These contracts ensure revenue visibility for the Company and also help to manage its own raw material procurement.
Approved facilities and overseas marketing arm for global exports

The agro-commodity business of the Company is subject to extensive regulations and stringent registration guidelines. SSPL is required to obtain specific registration from the authorities locally as well as in the country of export. Most of these regulations are very strict in nature and penalties for non-compliance of these regulations can vary from revocation or suspension of the registration to imposition of fines or confiscation of the goods in such jurisdictions. The Company?s products are certified by ISO 22000: 2005 and UK Certification & Training Limited for food safety management system. It is registered with US FDA and the processing facility and products are certified by various regulatory authorities including NPOP-India, NOP-USA and INDOCERT Organic Standard for Non-EU Country Operators. Due to these certified facilities and products, the Company is able to enlist itself as a supplier to various international players, which enhances product acceptance by overseas buyers and keeps the Company technologically abreast of international best practices.
Further the Company has set up a marketing arm in California, USA. This marketing arm would aid the Company to explore the market further and provide ease of business in the overseas market.
Experienced management leading to established relationship with reputed customers

The Company has experienced management team that is currently led by Mr. Bhudarbhai Ganeshbhai Varmora, (chairman and director) who has more than 2 decades of experience in the tiles industry. This extensive experience provides comfort in terms of execution and networking capabilities of the Entity. The long-standing experience of the management has helped the Entity to build established relationship with customers and suppliers, thus ensuring repeat orders and ease in sourcing of traded goods.

The Company mainly sells its products to distributors and retailers. However, even on institutional front, it?s major customers comprise of reputed players like Godrej Properties Limited, Mahindra Lifespace Developers Limited, Shapoorji Pallonji Company Private Limited, Cybercity Builders and Developers Private Limited among others. Reputed clientele provides the Company benefits like global visibility, good revenue streams, etc. The Company would continue to benefit from the extensive industry experience of promoters and its established relations with the customers which could help on scaling up the operations as well as garner wider customer base going forward.

The Company is engaged in manufacturing of ceramic and porcelain tile variants including wall, floor, parking, printed and sugar finish tiles. Porcelain tiles are the major product offering of the Company. The Company markets its products under the brand name Sunhearrt Ceramik. Company derived ~37% of the total revenue from international market in FY 2019. The Company has a global presence in over 60 countries including Saudi Arabia, Dubai, Italy, Mexico, Israel, Thailand, Albania, Poland, Brazil, Oman, etc. It has six manufacturing facilities located in Morbi, Gujarat and has regional offices in Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, Noida and Cochin which act as its direct sales showroom.

The current product portfolio of the Company offers a one stop solution for all types of tile requirements to its customers. However, in FY 2019, the Company has shut its old plant which mainly manufactured conventional tiles. The same has resulted in a decline in revenue in FY 2019. As informed, the old facility mainly manufactured low margin products which can be easily traded if required by customers (manufacture of mid-range products from old facility has been shifted to a new facility). Instead the Company will focus on its premium tiles segment which is a high margin product. The segment currently contributes close to INR 500,000 thousand in revenue which was approximately 11% of the Company?s total revenue in FY 2019. The Company also envisions to enter into the sanity-ware trading market for FY 2020. The Company banks on its strong dealership network for better geographical reach and is initiating better dealer incentive programs.

The Company is led by Mr. Sachin Rajkishor Biyani, Managing Director, he holds s Bachelor?s degree in civil engineering and is braced with over 3 decades of experience in executing industrial, petrochemical and infrastructural projects. Company has executed several industrial projects across sectors like Food, Pharma, Automobile, Defense, Warehouses, FMCG, Industrial, Infrastructure, White Goods, Petrochemical, Beverages, Heavy Engineering etc., Industrial restoration & infrastructure works etc. Also, it has presence across 8 states including Gujarat, Goa, Karnataka, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. This wide exposure mitigates the sectoral concentration risk to an extent.

It was predominantly in industrial projects, and in FY 2018 it had set up a separate infrastructure and EPC division to undertake complete EPC projects (as per the customer requirement). As informed, Company has executed INR 200 crores of orders in the last two years ending FY 2018. It expects the EPC and civil order mix to be in equal proportion by FY 2020.

The extensive experience of the management coupled with their exhaustive knowledge about the industry dynamics and the proven track record of the Company is expected to continue to scale up its operations. It has reported a high CAGR of 20% in the last three year review period.
Established relationship with reputed clientele coupled with a good order book position ensures revenue visibility

SBPL has established a strong relationship with its customers on back of its extensive track record of 110+ projects. The Company has a client base which includes companies like Alstom India Limited, Siemens Limited, PepsiCo, Asian Paints Limited, Midea India, Berger Paints India Limited, Embassy Industrial Parks Private Limited, Farrukhnagar Logistics Parks, PPG Asian Paints Private Limited, MRF Limited amongst others. Currently, it executes orders only for the private clients. Repeat to new order mix is around 50:50. Also, high revenue is derived from greenfield projects with 60-70% orders comprising of new orders and balance 30% in the brownfield project.

As on date, SBPL?s order book position stands at approx. INR. 700 crores which is to be executed in 18 months. This provides good revenue visibility in the near term. As informed, the estimated sales for FY 2020 is around INR 650 crores.
Strong capital structure provides greater financial flexibility and has resulted in a healthy financial risk profile

SBPL?s financial risk profile is strengthened by underleveraged capital structure and strong debt protection measures throughout the review period. Further, moderate profitability combined with improving cash flows has resulted into a good liquidity position. Although, the leverage of the Company has increased during the review period the same has stood comfortable at 0.44 times as on FY 2019. Further, eventhough the operations of the Company being working capital intensive the same as been prudently managed with extended credit from suppliers coupled with advances from customers which has enabled considerably lower dependence on short term borrowings to fund the working capital requirements and thereby reducing the outside debt exposure. The increased gearing seen in FY 2019 was due to a debt funded capital expenditure as Company expanded capacities to meet the increased order book. As indicated, it will continue to invest INR 5-10 crore every year on machineries and has no large debt funded capex plan in near to medium term.

Liquidity is supported by the need based support from the promoters. Directors have bought in INr 6 crores (which are subordinate to debt) and also infuse funds as per the requirement of the Company. The rise in interest cost seen in FY 2019 is pertaining to unsecured loans which shows movement of promoter?s funds in a year.

Low reliance on external debt led to low incidence of interest costs, which coupled with improved profitability resulted in a strong interest coverage ratio thereby indicating sufficient safety margin to service its financial obligations. Thus, low debt-equity ratio will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.

Company?s returns have remained high with ROTNW (Return on Tangible Net Worth) and ROCE (Return on Capital Employed) at about 33% and 38% respectively in FY 2019. Low capital intensity (resulting in a high return on fixed asset at about 76% in FY 2019) and prudently managed working capital cycle coupled with increasing revenues and margins has supported high returns during the review period.

It was predominantly in industrial projects, and in FY 2018 it had set up a separate infrastructure and EPC division to undertake complete EPC projects. Company?s gearing level remain low at below 1 time throughout the review period. The same has also shown an improving trend in the last three year review period. Long track record and experienced management coupled with reputed clientele base

Underleveraged capital structure coupled with comfortable interest coverage

The Company?s financial risk profile is healthy supported by underleveraged capital structure and comfortable debt protection indicators. During the review period, total debt equity ratio improved from 0.52 times as on 31st March 2017 to 0.37 times as on 31st March 2019 due to part repayment of long term debt and increase in tangible networth. Low debt incidence is due to majority funding of capital expenditure and working capital requirements met through internal accruals, thus having low reliance on external borrowings. A lower debt component, when compared with Company?s healthy tangible networth, would provide the Company financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Furthermore, low reliance on external debt has led to low incidence of interest costs resulting in comfortable interest coverage ratio of 4.96 times in FY 2019 thereby indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations. Thus, low debt-equity ratio will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.

Liquidity of the Company remained moderate during the review period with the current ratio largely range-bound during the review period and adequate at 1.45 times as on 31st March 2019. Additionally, liquidity is further strengthened by healthy cash flow from operating activities which stood positive throughout the review period. Liquidity was further supported by sufficient net cash accruals to pay off its short-term obligations (CPTLD) and adequate cash and bank balances (includes fixed deposit and margin deposit) and current investment of INR 83,180 thousand and INR 335,210 thousand respectively as on 31st March 2019.
Strong R&D coupled with globally accredited manufacturing facilities and global presence

As informed, SPPL has collaboration with four US based CROs for R&D activities. The Company has been collaborating with CRO?s for its requirement of new technology to stay ahead of competition in terms of the cost curve. In FY 2017, the Company implemented new technology of Progesterone through bio ? conversion route leveraging the biotech platform that the Company has built over the last few years. As informed, after Pfizer, the Company is the largest player in supplying of Progesterone in the domestic market. The Company leverages on its good portfolio of DMF filing that would help it to further expand scale in export market.

Apart from above, the manufacturing facilities have also been inspected, appreciated and approved by large Pharmaceutical Houses such as Glaxo-Smith Kline (GSK), Merck, Pfizer, Teva, Mylan, Sun pharma and many more, and exporting to over 38 countries around the globe including USA, Europe, Latin America and many key Asian Countries. This has enabled the Company to expand its presence in the export market. The Company currently has a healthy export to domestic mix, the contribution is nearly equal to the total revenues. Going forward, with its DMF filings, it expects to increase exports from regulated markets, which is a high margin market.
Significant increase in scale of operations due to addition to product profile

Incorporated in the year 1973, the Company is an integrated manufacturer with an ability to manufacture stainless steel billets, flats, wire rods and heavy casting products. In FY 2015 and FY 2016, volatility in steel prices led to de-growth in revenue. However, in FY 2017 the Company diversified its product base with addition of wire rods. This addition led the Company to increase its focus on long products viz. wire rods which have higher sales realizations. SSL, as on date, majorly operates in three segments namely, long & flat products division, steel casting division and wire rods division. On account of this addition its scale has increased significantly as depicted from CAGR of 80% in past four years (FY 2016-19) marked by 14.53% in FY 2019. The Company further plans to add downstream products such as bright bars & drawn wires from FY 2020.
Catering to diversified end user industry and a wide customer base

Products manufactured by SSL caters to construction, automobiles, engineering, stainless steel utensils and pipes industry. Catering to diversified industry to an extent cushions the Company from any adverse economic condition in a particular industry. The customers of the Company include manufactures and traders. SSL has a long term business relationship with its top customers. As informed, the top 5 customers of the Company do not account for over 20% of the total revenue, which helps to mitigate any customer concentration risk. As informed by management, the Company?s ability to meet quality required by its customers and negotiate favourable pricing parameters has led to increase its revenue coupled with reduction in working capital debt in the past four years (FY 2016-19).
Improving financial risk profile marked by its moderate capital structure

The Company?s financial risk profile remained above average with a gearing of 0.95 times as on 31st March 2019. Its capital structure was supported by increase in profitability and infusion of funds by shareholders.

SSL?s borrowings increased y-o-y throughout the review period as significant additions to long term loans were made from the year FY 2016 to back its expansion plans. The Company added a steel melting plant and erected a new manufacturing plant for wire rods. Also, with increasing revenue its working capital requirements increased which were also funded through working capital debt apart from internal accruals. This is evident from sharp increase in short-term borrowings with utilization levels at around 80%. However, the Company?s working capital cycle reduced due to favorable negotiation of credit terms and increase in accruals. This resulted in a declining gearing which stood at a moderate 1.00 times as on 31st March 2019. The Company does not plan to avail any debt to fund planned capex as it is likely to be executed through internal accruals in a phased manner.

Further, healthy cash accruals have led to comfortable debt protection metrics marked by sufficient interest coverage ratio at 3.00 times for FY 2019. A healthy tangible networth, improving gearing level and more than enough cash accruals helped the Company to maintain a steady financial risk profile.

SSL is led by chairman and managing director, Mr. Subhash Chander Kathuria, a bachelor in commerce, with more than three decades of experience in the field of manufacturing of stainless steel. He is supported by Mr. Anubhav Kathuria, who holds a master?s degree in Business Administration and director of SSL having experience of over 13 years. Other directors also have a sound educational background and extensive experience. The vast experience of management provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company which would help in driving the growth of business. Accordingly, the Company has been able to swiftly grow its wire rod business and continuously add downstream products to diversify its product base & customer base. The management team has set-up a strong vertically integrated facility over the years and continuously strives to add value added products in its portfolio. Also, under the aforementioned management team the Company has penetrated in the European market and has ongoing orders to be executed which would result in increasing share of exports in total revenue.

The Company being a manufacturer of steel products has working capital intensive operations. However, SSL has managed its working capital requirements efficiently through increased focus on reducing business on credit, as depicted from its working capital cycle which improved from 76 days to 51 days during the review period. Prompt collections have led the Company to pay its debt and trade payables on time. Also, the Company receives advances from customers which aid working capital management. Further, there has been infusion of funds by shareholders coupled with support of working capital debt which resulted in smooth working capital management.
However, ability of the management to continue to maintain the working capital cycle while reducing its dependency on external working capital debt remains critical.

The group has an extensive network infrastructure called the Tata Global Network (TGN), encompassing one of the most advanced and largest wholly owned submarine cable networks. It comprises of a global ring of more than 210,000 kilometers of terrestrial and 500,000 kilometers of subsea network. Its Tier 1 Internet Protocol (IP) network is ranked in the top five by routes across five continents and provides backbone connectivity in over 30 countries reaching around 400 global point of presence (PoP). Tata Communication holds a large portion of the cable independently; most other Indian and global telecom companies hold a small share in a large 20-member consortium.

In an otherwise commoditized market, TGN gives Tata Communication strong pricing and cost benefits. The group is also the largest global carrier of international wholesale voice carrying 27.5 billion minutes of wholesale voice traffic in FY 2019. It also holds the Indefeasible Right of Use (IRU) capacity on the privately held SEACOM cable system which has landing sites in South Africa, Mozambique, Tanzania and Kenya in Africa; in Mumbai, India; and in Marseille, France. The group?s network carriers nearly 30% of the world?s internet routes and is the only global Tier 1 provider that is in the top five positions across five continents. IT has been positioned as a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Global Network Services for the 6th consecutive year.

The Company adopted the inorganic route (like acquisition of Tyco Global Network, Teleglobe, Sentient, Teleena and others) and also entered into various partnerships/consortiums to expand the reach of its network infrastructure so as to offer more value-added services to its customers. Such extensive network coverage provides the group with a competitive edge in providing telecom companies, content providers and large enterprises, transmission backbone services across the Atlantic, the Pacific, Europe, Africa, Middle East, and into or out of India. In the past few years, the group has made continued investments in its global network (TGN) primarily to upgrade the existing network and extend the network from developed markets to the fast-growing emerging economies. It launched a subsea cable system connecting several countries in the Middle East to Mumbai, India. That was followed by the completion of the world?s first round-the-world fibre optic cable network, with the official launch of the TGN cable in Eurasia. The complete cable ring now connects Europe to India, through Egypt, bringing increased capacity, resilience and enhanced communications links to not only the Middle East, but onward to the rest of the world via the TGN. This extensive network infrastructure and continued investment in it, will give strong competitive advantage to the group.
Strong brand name of Tata Group coupled with experienced management

TCL is a part of the USD 100.7 billion Tata Group of companies which holds 48.9% stake in the Company. Tata Group is one India?s largest business conglomerates having diversified business interests which encompasses sectors such as communication and information technology, steel, engineering, automobile, energy, consumer products, chemicals and others. The Tata group is one of the oldest industrial houses operating in India, which presently operates over 100 companies and employs around seven lakh employees. The group has operations in more than 80 countries. With increasing international footprint of Tata Group, the Tata brand is also gaining international recognition. . This gives advantage to TCL in terms of strong brand recognition and visibility along with other benefits like shared vision and access to funds and (Tata Sons has voluntarily approved to take over any obligations of TCL arising out of DoCoMo?s holding of any rights shares issued by TTSL in 2011 and legal costs arising out of arbitration award owing to dispute between Tata Sons and DoCoMo. The obligation has been repaid by Tata Sons). The group will be led by Mr. Amur S. Lakshminarayanan who is the president and CEO of Tata Consultancy Services. He has experience of more than three decades in the telecom industry. Other directors on the board are also qualified and competent to make informed decisions. Experienced management provides bandwidth to execute its strategic goals of capitalizing on strong brand value and cross border capabilities as well as international diversification.

The group provides an array of services in the data segment. It is not just a data network or a data center provider, but acts as a complete connectivity provider with multi-point lease switching (MPLS), virtual private network (VPN), ethernet, audio-web conferencing, unified communication services and a bouquet of 20 services that improve connectivity and enhance data experience. TCL gets 15+ terabits of international bandwidth capacity and around 7,600 petabytes of internet traffic travels over its internet backbone each month. With most of the players present in one or two segments, being a complete service provider gives TCL a competitive edge over others leading to stickiness in the business.

The group has around 7,000 customers globally with 2,000 service providers and around 5,000 enterprise customers with 66% of those being Fortune 500 companies. It offers services across various sectors which includes manufacturing, E-commerce, IT/ ITES, technology, banking and finance, media and entertainment, health/ pharmaceuticals and others. Because of array of services offered by the group over the years, it has been able to establish healthy relationship with few of its key customers which include Pfizer, Mphasis Limited, Hindustan Unilever Limited, Microsoft and others.
