The group has been focusing on the newer opportunities in the cross-border mobility in the internet of things (IOT), managed security, cloud and artificial intelligence domain. The growth services continued to witness strong momentum with a year on year growth.
Leading player in the Indian IT sector offering a gamut of services while associating with multiple partners and undertaking a number of acquisitions

Tech Mahindra, being the fifth largest IT service player in the domestic IT sector, in terms of revenue offers a wide range of services to its client?s comprising of custom application services, (CAS), enterprise application services (EAS), engineering and research & development services (ERS), enterprise transformation services (ETS), infrastructure services division (ISD), business process outsourcing (BPO), etc. The Group has forged multiple partnerships including strategic investment in multiple players across multiple geographies.

Tech Mahindra's acquisitions have been aimed at bolstering its capabilities in different areas, including in telecom and consolidating its position as one of the biggest players in the domestic IT industry. The most significant acquisition it has made was in FY 2014, that of USA-based Lightbridge Communications Corporation (LCC), a company with presence in over 50 countries, and which had built 350 networks and designed more than 350,000 cell sites for more than 400 customers worldwide. Other key acquisitions were of Swiss IT firm Sofgen Holdings Limited, FixStream Networks Inc., BASF Business Services Consult GmbH amongst others. Because of these acquisitions, Tech Mahindra now offers solutions across engineering, healthcare, aviation, automotive, banking & finance, among others. It acquired Pininfarina SPA in FY 2016, an Italian design company that complement the existing engineering capability of the Company with high end styling and engineering services. Further, in FY 2017, it purchased Bio Agency, a digital company in the UK and Target Group, also from the UK, to boost automation in the lending, investment and insurance segments. Tech Mahindra acquired CJS Solutions Group, LLC (HCI) in FY 2018. The HCI Group works with some of the world?s most prestigious Tier-I healthcare service providers, primarily in the USA and UK, focusing on providing end-to-end implementation of Electronic Health Record (EHR) and Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software, training and support services. This will help scale up healthcare revenue, as provider sub vertical is a key element of Healthcare and Life Sciences (HLS) strategy. Further, the Group acquired several other players like Altiostar Inc which is the mobile broadband industry?s first provider of vRAN solution for LTE technology; Inter-Informatics spol. s.r.o, a Czech entity providing design and engineering services to clients in the aerospace, rail and machinery industries to boost presence in Europe; Dynacommerce Holding B.V, a Dutch entity engaged in providing platforms and services to telecom end clients and K-Vision Co., Ltd, a Japanese corporation engaged in providing network services to telecom clients in Japan to ensure presence in Japan to capitalize on the expected 5G boom.
With these acquisitions, the Group?s client base increased globally y-o-y during the review period. The total number of active clients of the Group stood at 941 at the end of Q1 FY 2020.

The Group?s profitability improved at all levels during the review period. At operating levels, the margin improvement was driven by cost optimization strategies and automation. Tech Mahindra was able to manage its working capital requirements through internal accruals and advances from customers, thus, resulting in minimal external loans to fund the working capital cycle. Low interest cost on the back of comfortable gearing led to strong interest coverage indicator which stood at 43.11 in FY 2019. Healthy margins resulted in good return indicators as highlighted below ?

Debt-equity ratio of the Group remained low throughout the review period and stood at 0.13 times as on 31st March 2019 and low interest expenditure relative to the EBIT resulted in a high interest coverage ratio throughout the review period. Net cash flow from operating activities of the Group remained positive and comfortable throughout the review period. Further, the liquidity of the Group was adequate and remained supported by healthy cash accruals, liquid investments, and cash balance (along with unencumbered fixed deposits). The current ratio stood at 1.87 times in FY 2019.

TML is currently headed by Mr. C.P. Gurnani, Managing Director & Chief Executive Officer. Mr. Gurnani was the Chief Operating Officer and co-founder of Perot Systems (India) Limited, initially set up as HCL Perot Systems, where he orchestrated the joint venture between HCL Corporation and Perot Systems from its inception to make it one of India?s top IT services companies. In a career spanning more than three decades, he has held several leading positions with Hewlett Packard Limited, Perot Systems (India) Limited and HCL Corporation Ltd. He also played a pivotal role in the three-year transformational journey of Mahindra Satyam and spearheaded the merger of the two companies. At TML, he is assisted by a team of directors who are professionally qualified and have rich experience in the industry. This extensive experience and deep understanding of the industry dynamics has led to y-o-y client addition, repeat business and growth in revenue.
Large repeat business and a strong order book position

The Group has been able to increase its clientele y-o-y and added 41 new clients in FY 2019 when compared to the previous year with majority of the clients being added in the USA and EMEA region. The Group added 3 more active clients in Q1FY 2020 to make the total tally of clients at 941. The client addition also remained robust with the Group adding 5 new clients in USD 50 million+ bracket in Q1FY 2020 over Q1 FY 2019, 2 new clients in USD 20 million+ bracket and 33 new clients in USD 5 million+ bracket during the same period. Moreover, the Group received approx. 95% of the total orders as a repeat business in FY 2019 and 98% in Q1FY 2020. Healthy repeat business rate and as informed, a strong deal pipeline provides strong medium-term revenue visibility for the Group.

The Group has a wide clientele base with the top 10 customers accounting for ~32% of the total revenue in FY 2019 which insulates it from any customer concentration risk. Moreover, top 20 clients did not account for more than 45% of the total revenue in FY 2019.

Tech Mahindra is a part of the Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) Group which is a global industrial conglomerate and one of the leading industrial firms based in India with revenues of USD 17.8 Billion having 200,000 employees in over 100 countries across the globe. The Ultimate Group is diversified into various fields such aerospace, aftermarket, agribusiness, automotive, components, construction equipment, consulting services, defense, energy, farm equipment, finance and insurance, industrial equipment, information technology, leisure and hospitality, logistics, real estate, retail and two wheelers. The Ultimate Group is chaired by Mr. Anand Mahindra who is also the Chairman and Director of TechM. Ownership by the M&M Group provides comfort that TechM would have financial support in the event of any unforeseen contingencies. Also, as informed, the Group?s wider presence across diversified industries helps in leveraging offerings of the combined Group.

The Company has long track record of over 10 decades (operating since 1919) that demonstrates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. It started with manufacturing of fertilizers but later ventured into manufacturing of commodity and speciality chemicals. The Company is managed by Mr. Bimal Lalitsingh Goculdas (CEO and MD), a chemical engineer, having an experience of over two decades managing various functions like corporate finance, technology, supply chain management and others. The other members on the board are also well qualified with experience of more than a decade across varied sectors.

With rich experience of the management, the Company has been able to expand its product portfolio as well as its global footprint over the years. The experienced management provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities thereby driving business growth. Also, experienced management provides comfort that the Company would be able to carry out its R&D initiatives more effectively to continuously expand its product portfolio.
Established relationship with reputed customers and suppliers coupled with wide geographical reach

The Company has reputed clientele base comprising Aarti Industries Limited, Atul Limited, Alkem Laboratories Limited, BASF, United Phosphorus Limited, Dr. Reddy?s Laboratories, HPL additives Limited, Lanxess India Private Limited, Pidilite industries Limited, Aurobindo Pharma Limited and Mitsubishi Motor Corporation, amongst others. Long standing presence of the Company in the business has resulted in established relationship with customers and suppliers leading to repeat business and ease in sourcing of materials. The Company has been dealing with these customers for more than 2-3 decades. Strong relationship with the customers provides the Company with comfort of stability to the revenue streams. Additionally, the Company can further leverage its established clientele to scale up revenue from its new products. The customer profile is further strengthened by its well spread geographical reach across India and with exports to around 25 countries across five continents. Geographical diversification mitigates geographic concentration risk and helps the Company survive regulatory uncertainties related to a single geographical region.

The Company has an in-house R&D laboratory recognized by DSIR, Government of India, which undertakes activities pertaining to the development of new products, process and cost optimization of existing speciality chemicals so as to be competitive in domestic and international market. It also works on development of processes for making value added products. As informed, in specialty chemicals segment, the biggest value proposition for the client is the quality of product. Therefore, strong focus on R&D activities would enable the Company to develop high quality products which have higher contribution.

Being in the business for a long period of time coupled with its research and development capabilities, the Company has been able to expand its product portfolio. Although it commenced operations by manufacturing of sulphuric acid and phosphate fertilizers, it later ventured into manufacturing of commodity (bulk) and speciality chemicals. Its product basket includes base chemicals, functional chemicals, industrial intermediates such as chloro sulphonic acid, diethyl ether, sulphuric acid, benzene sulfonamide, benzene sulfonic acid and others.

Along with a wide product portfolio, the Company also caters to various industries such as polymers, emulsions, dyes, paints, pharmaceutical intermediaries, agro chemicals, construction chemicals, cosmetics, detergents, electroplating, fertilizers, fire retardents, ink, paper, pigments, textile processing, thermal paper coating, water treatment, steel, glass & ceramics, rubber, and others. As indicated by management, none of the sectors contributes for more than 8-10% of the topline, mitigating the risk of any sectoral concentration. These diversified product offerings coupled with applications across varied industries, reduce the risk of slowdown in any particular industry and demand for any particular product.

The financial profile of the Company improved significantly in FY 2019. It registered topline growth of ~31% and significant net profit growth of ~276% during the year. Operating profit margins and net profit margins improved from 10.45% and 6.93% in FY 2018 to 21.11% and 19.88% in FY 2019 mainly due to decline in cost of raw material consumed and better absorption of fixed cost. However, as informed by the management, FY 2019 was an exceptional year wherein in the first half the Company could benefit from exceptional finished product prices and very low raw material prices, which resulted to significant increase in profitability of the Company. This, consequently, led to adequate returns on funds employed by the Company as shown in table below:

However, during H1 FY 2020, the Company achieved de-growth of ~14% mainly due to decline in prices of finished products. Further, operating and net profit margins also declined to ~18.24% & 11.62% in H1 FY2020 compared to ~36.39% & 20.71% respectively in H1 FY 2019.

Moreover, backed by prudent management of the working capital requirements, the Company?s debt equity ratio improved during the review period and stood at 0.25 times as on 31st March 2019 along with a healthy interest coverage ratio of 18.00 times in FY 2019. Excluding long term loan from promoters, adjusted debt equity ratio stood at 0.22 times as on 31st March 2019.

Nevertheless, as indicated by management, the Company has debt-funded capital expenditure plans of around INR 100 crore over two years which will be funded by ~INR 70 crore of debt and hence it remains critical for the Company to successfully implement the same without any cost overruns and maintain its gearing over the near to medium term.
Robust track record driven by strong execution history and experienced management

The Group has been operating as a manufacturer of boiler since more than five decades. Over this period, it has integrated its operations and diversified its product portfolio to become a leading EPC contractor in the country. The Group benefits from its cost competitiveness, technical skills, technology tie-up with leading players and long and proven track record in the domestic market. The Group?s strength is also supported by its geographical reach. During FY2019, more than 30% of the revenue came from over 86 countries by providing diversified product solutions. Since beginning of operations its strong and dedicated management has been instrumental in guiding the Group to its current market position. The current Chairperson has been associated with the group since nearly a decade while the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer has been associated with the Company since 1982 (excluding a brief stint of 5 years working with Terrazzo Inc, UAE). Other than them, the group has an experienced board of directors assisted by a strong tier 1 and tier 2 management which has been instrumental in the group?s performance.

Currently, the group has increased focus on exports while recognizing the opportunities in developing countries across the world. Accordingly, the order inflow in the last two years has been heavily skewed towards export orders as the domestic orders have remained subdued. The efforts have borne results as apparent in the strong revenue growth seen in FY 2019.
Diverse range of products and services catering to numerous end-user industries from around the world

Thermax operates through three business segments viz. energy, environment and chemical segment. During FY 2019, the energy segment contributed ~80.00% to the total revenue while the environment and chemicals segments contributed ~13% and ~7% of total revenue respectively.

The energy segment comprises of heating solutions, cooling solutions, boilers for power generation, power EPC, solar heating and power generation, service arms for the businesses including power O&M services. The heating segment supplies boilers and solar thermal for an extensive range of applications. The cooling business provides industrial and commercial cooling making use of vapor absorption chillers as well as offerings for process cooling. The power business offers turnkey power plants including solar photovoltaic and solar thermal solutions.

The environment segment consists of air pollution control and water & waste solutions. The air pollution control business caters to a wide range of industries ? cement, steel and ferrous metals, petrochemicals, fertilizers, etc. The business offers products and solutions for both particulate and gaseous emissions. The water and wastewater solutions business support industry and commercial establishments to treat water for their process requirements and clean sewage and effluent.
The chemical segment comprises the following business segments ? boiler and water chemicals, resins, performance chemicals, construction chemicals and oil field chemicals.

Further, Thermax caters to wide range of industries such as oil and gas, steel, automobile, food, cement, chemicals, refinery and petrochemicals, power generation, textile, pharmaceutical, paper and pulp, tank farm heating, space heating, sugar, paint, rubber, and edible oil industries. This provides diversification to the group?s revenue streams and insulates from industry specific economic cycles.
Also, with presence in more than 86 countries and increasing y-o-y revenue from exports, the group has been embarking on minimizing its geographical concentration risk.
Adequate financial profile driven by Comfortable capital structure and liquidity position

The Group has maintained an adequate financial profile driven by low gearing with minimal external borrowings during the review period. The Group?s tangible networth stood healthy at INR 29,574,100 thousand as on 31st March 2019 against total debt of INR 3,150,000 thousand. The low external borrowing has also led to strong interest coverage. The gearing of the Group along with its interest coverage during the review period is mentioned in the table below.
Total debt comprised long term loans availed by a subsidiary of the Company along with some short-term borrowing used for working capital funding.

However, it should be noted that despite high receivables and unbilled revenue recorded, the working capital requirement is funded mainly through customer advances and payables to suppliers leading to minimum net working capital requirement. Effectively, only a small portion of the working capital requirement is thus funded through external borrowings limiting the impact on external debt due to the same.

Further, the Group?s liquidity position has remained adequate with cash and bank balance (including current investments) of INR 11,431,400 thousand against long term debt repayment obligations of INR 201,900 thousand as on 31st March 2019. The group?s liquidity ratios are given in the table below.

Current and quick ratios stood moderate as majority of the tangible networth has been utilized to fund the non-current assets in the form of fixed assets and investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures and associates during the review period.

Underleveraged capital structure and strong liquidity position provides cushion to the Group to further leverage in case of any business exigencies, or to fund any incremental working capital requirements.
Well established promoter and parent support aiding revenue growth

The Company benefits from being a part of Japan based Toyo group. Toyo Group, established in 1961, is a Japanese engineering, procurement and construction company serving mainly the hydrocarbons (oilÿandÿnatural gas) andÿpetrochemicalÿsectors worldwide. The group has major presence in China, India, Indonesia, Iran and Russia. On a consolidated basis, the group reported a total turnover of 294,993 million yen (around INR 19,000 crores) for FY 2019.

The group entered the Indian market in 1963 by establishing Toyo-India. Since then, leveraging on its parent?s execution expertise, the Company has established itself in the oil & gas, petrochemicals EPC industry domestically. The Company?s Chairman and MD - Mr. Itsuya Yanagi has around three decades of experience in execution of oil & gas and petrochemical projects worldwide. He is the group CEO also holding directorship in the main parent Company - Toyo Engineering Corporation. The other whole-time directors actively looking after the operations of the Company are Mr. R.Y Kulkarni and Mr. S.B. Shelke who too have a long standing experience of over 10 years in the EPC industry. Besides common management, the Company enjoys strong business linkages with the parent Company including technology transfer. Toyo Group is amongst the top license holders of process technology for fertilizer sector and its patented technology is made available to all its subsidiaries for the project execution. In addition, the parent - Toyo Engineering Corporation outsources engineering service contracts to Toyo India of INR 300-400 crores annually. Although, Toyo group faces business cyclicality due to EPC contract nature of business, however, financially the group is strong by revenue size and has long standing in the business. Entire profits earned by Toyo India has been retained in the business by the parent to support business growth. As informed, the parent is expected to provide funding support to Toyo-India in case of any exigency. Parent support will aid revenue growth.
Proven track record, end-to-end project execution capabilities and a good order book position provides revenue visibility

Toyo-India has its core expertise in engineering services. Over the last 3 decades, it has developed in-house design, engineering and construction capabilities to bid and execute large and complex projects. Wide offering including undertaking of EPC-LSTK contracts, PMS, EPCM, engineering services which makes it an integrated player in contract execution. Toyo-India has an adequate order book of INR 4,376 crores (as on 30th June 2019) mainly comprising of EPC. In the last three years ending FY 2019, about 80% revenue was from EPC and the balance 20% from the technical services. The current order book is to be executed over a span of 3-5 years thus providing medium term revenue visibility. It has a strong manpower strength of around 1,745 personnel) enabling it to undertake complex engineering projects. Wide gamut of offering with proven expertise enables the Company to bag large size contracts.
Negligible debt throughout the review period and comfortable liquidity position

The Company reported negligible debt for FY 2017 and had zero debt level in FY 2018 and FY 2019. The low gearing was on account of low capital expenditure which was mainly funded through internal accruals. In addition, the Company majorly funds its working capital requirement through interest free customer advances/ mobilization advances and stretched payables. The liquidity position remained comfortable with current ratio of around 1.98 times as on 31st March 2019 and it had positive cash flow from operations in FY 2018 and FY 2019. Cashflow from operations was positive and higher on account of higher PAT in FY 2019. It stood lower after adjustment for working capital changes due to higher receivables at end of FY 2019. Cash accruals retained in the business also supported the working capital requirement.

The Company has witnessed a significant increase in profitability in FY 2019 as compared to previous years. The increase in profitability at gross level was achieved owing to 44% reduction in the cost of material consumed in FY 2019 vis a vis FY 2018. The gross profit margin increased from 10% in FY 2018 to 20% in FY 2019. Even though the revenue of the Company has slumped in FY 2019, it has managed to keep its profitability indicators at a high level by control over expenses in FY 2019. At net level also, the Company has managed to improve its profitability to 10.9% which previously hovered around 3-4%. This increase in net profit margin was due to high non-operating income coupled with increasing operating profit margins. With increase in profitability and moderate requirement of capital in business, its return ratios also improved significantly during the review period.
Technical knowhow and capabilities backed by strong management experience

Gammon India Limited?s T&D business was transferred to TLL in two phases, the first being through an agreement and the second through a demerger. The senior management team having extensive experience of over three decades in the business was also retained in TLL.The demerger has resulted in retaining the technical capabilities and pre-qualification of Gammon and which in turn has helped to achieve the technical qualification requirements for bidding of projects. The Company has 5 state of the art manufacturing facilities of transmission towers, conductors and monopoles andstate-of-the-artintegratedtowertestingstation,design capabilities, and a well experienced team capable of erecting and commissioning transmission line upto 1,200 KV, distribution lines, substation and railway electrification. This gives an edge to the Company over other T&D EPC peers. As informed, it undertakes EPC contracts in-house with minimal 10-15% comprising of bought out components. Company has a proven execution track record in T&D line. It executed around 12,000 distribution transformers, constructed 25,300 Ckm transmission lines of upto 765 Kv/800 Kv and supplied 1,10,000 conductors for FY 2019.

Mr. Digambar Chunilal Bagde, Managing Director, has a Bachelor?s degree in civil engineering and an experience of more than four decades in transmission and distribution EPC business. Other directors of the Company also have a profound understanding on the industry dynamics and support the Company?s growth strategy.

The extensive experience of the management coupled with their exhaustive knowledge about the industry dynamics and the established presence of Gammon India has aided the Company in maintaining strong relationship with customers and suppliers, thus ensuring repeat orders and ease in procurement.

Being in the industry for more than three decades, TLL has established a strong relationship with its customers, which were a part of the Gammon?s customer profile. The Company has a client base which includes companies such as Larson & Toubro Limited, Siemens Limited, Adani Group, Shapoorji Pallonji group, Jaguar Overseas Limited, Reliance Infrastructure Limited, Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL), Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL), Power Grid Corporation, State Electricity Boards, Jindal Power among others. In the past, the Company has executed projects for Reliance Industries, supplied stadium masts for Pallakele Cricket Stadium, Candy, Srilanka, Subroto Roy Sahara Stadium, Pune (now known as Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium), Dhabel Cricket Stadium, etc. Relationship with such reputed customers and long term nature of contracts provides good revenue visibility. As informed, around 80% of the revenue is derived from domestic and international governments.

As on date, TLL?s order book position stood at approx. INR. 3,256 crores (2 times the revenue in FY19), which is to be executed over 18-24 months. The Company had an L1 position in contracts worth INR 538 crores. This provides healthy revenue visibility over the medium term. Further, geography-wise, the order book comprises 70%-75% domestic and balance as export orders. PGICL constitutes as major client contributing approx.24% of the order book in FY 2019. Further, in the export orders, TLL bids selectively for orders funded by multilateral agencies or where sales are entirely backed by Letter of Credit (L/C), thereby curtailing credit risk for the Company.

Strong order position from multiple contracts offers comfort about the future stream of revenues and provides revenue visibility to the Company. As informed, Company is projecting a revenue growth of 30% (around INR 2,400 crores) in FY 2019.

Traction in the domestic market and two large contracts from namely Adani Group and Tamil Nadu State Electricity Board aided the Company to grow its revenues by approx. 44% in FY 2018, despite deferral of orders by international clients. Though change in product mix (tower, bought outs, testing etc.) led to a drop in gross margins in FY 2018, the profitability of the Company improved at OPBITDA (operation profit before tax, depreciation, and interest), operating and net levels in the three-year review period. This was largely owing to a decline in bad debts write off (one-time expense in FY 2017) and a drop in interest expenses as a percentage of revenue on the back of lower working capital loans. Bad debts (including provision) stood at 2.23% of the total revenue in FY 2018 which reduced to less than 1% in FY 2019. Company?s net cash accruals has improved from INR 77crore in FY 2017 to INR 125 crore in FY 2019. Improving profitability resulted in high return indicators as highlighted below ?
Extensive management experience coupled with integrated operations and established position in the textile industry driving business growth

The Company has an established position with integrated operations across various business segments including home textiles, papers and chemicals. In the textile market the product categories are further diversified into yarn, bed linen and bath linen. Trident is one of the leading suppliers of bath linen in the US market with a manufacturing capacity of 90,000 MT per annum. The Company is also one of the largest manufacturers of wheat straw-based paper and roughly has around 10% market share in the branded copier segment. The Company has an established track record of almost three decades and has over the years established its marketing offices in USA and UK and caters to customers across 100 countries. Furthermore, Trident is led by Mr. Rajinder Gupta who holds a degree in advanced management program and has a rich experience of over two decades. He is ably supported by other board members who are well qualified with relevant industry experience. The long-standing experience of the management, coupled with their extensive knowledge of the industry dynamics has helped the Company to establish long lasting relationship with its customers and suppliers, thus providing the Company with the comfort of stable revenue streams and stable supply of raw materials.
Established relationships with reputed clients coupled with diversified geographic presence ensures revenue visibility

The long-standing presence of the Company of almost three decades in the textile industry has helped the Company to establish strong relationship with its customers. The Company has a large and reputed customer base across all industries, both in the domestic and overseas market, comprising of retailers, importers, garment & home textile manufacturers, etc. Trident?s customer base across the textile segment includes reputed clients including Wal-Mart Stores Inc., J.C Penney Private Brands Inc., IKEA Trading Hong Kong Limited, Raymond Limited, Arvind Limited, etc. Across the paper segment, key customers include Sarthak Vanijya India Private Limited, Navneet Dealers Private Limited, Mangal Papers Private Limited amongst many. Reputed clientele provides comfort about the ability of the Company to minimize realization risks and also aids in providing revenue visibility. Further, its business profile is strengthened by the fact that no single customer contributes for more than 15% in the Company?s topline, thereby ensuring no major concentration risk. Moreover, the Company has been associated with these customers for more than a decade which provides comfort over the recurring revenue streams of the Company. Moreover, the Company has a diversified geographic presence in over 100 countries and earned around 57.13% of the revenue from exports in FY 2019. For the home textile segment, it has presence in 33 countries, in the yarn segment it caters to 36 countries and in the paper segment, it caters to 54 segments. Major countries of export include the USA, Switzerland, Hong Kong, China, Pakistan amongst others. Geographic diversification of revenue streams helps in mitigating the risk of downturn and uncertainties related to a single geographical region.
Healthy and improving capital structure with adequate interest coverage and comfortable liquidity position provides financial flexibility

The total debt equity ratio of the Company has witnessed an improvement through FY 2017 ? FY 2019 and stood at 0.84 times as on 31st March 2019. The capital structure of the Company comprised of healthy tangible net worth of INR 28,877,500 thousand and total debt outstanding of INR 24,357,500 thousand as on 31st March 2019. The total debt equity ratio witnessed rise in FY 2016 primarily due to debt-funded capital expansion and has witnessed improvement thereafter owing to improvement in tangible networth coupled with partial repayment of long term borrowings. A lower debt component, when compared with the Company?s healthy tangible networth, would provide the Company financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expanding its scale of operation. Also, the interest coverage ratio witnessed an improving trend and stood at 5.99 times in FY 2019 indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations.

The comfortable liquidity position of the Company is witnessed in cash flow from operations which stood positive throughout the review period. Furthermore, net cash accruals of the Company stood at INR 7,833,300 thousand as on 31st March 2019 which was adequate against the near term debt obligation of INR 3,401,700 thousand for the period. Liquidity of the Company further stood supported in unencumbered cash balance and deposits of INR 238,600 thousand and current investments of INR 699,300 thousand as on 31st March 2019. However, solvency ratios stood moderate which current and quick ratio of 1.12 times and 0.56 times respectively in FY 2019 primarily due to high inventory holding due to seasonality of key raw materials.
Experienced track record and experienced management provides revenue visibility

The Group has a long track record of over two decades that demonstrates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Group is led by Mr. Anil Kumar Malhotra, a gold medallist in metallurgy with rich experience of over 25 years in the field of trading in metals. Under his leadership, the Group expanded its business operations to diversify its revenue streams and widened its geographic reach. In FY 2019, the Group has established a warehouse and manufacturing facility in Jabel Ali, UAE which would ensure improvement in delivery lead times of traded and manufactured goods in the Middle-East market. Further, in FY 2019, the Group has set-up another subsidiary in Germany to cater to its European clients and further tap prospective steel mills in the region. Now, it is setting up a new subsidiary in South Africa for ease in procurement. The long-standing experience of the management has helped the Group to establish long lasting relationship with its customers and suppliers, thus providing the Group with the comfort of stable revenue streams and stable supply of raw materials. The Group is expected to continue to benefit from the promoter?s vast experience in the industry coupled with the initiatives undertaken which would aid in scaling up its operations in the near to medium term.
Diversified product offerings coupled with diversified geographic presence

The product portfolio of the Group has diversified over the years. The Group started its operations by offering trading activities of ferro alloys and has ventured into manufacturing since 2010. The offerings include wide range of products which find usability in the steel manufacturing industries like bulk ferro alloys, manganese ore, coal, coke, refractories, carbon & graphite products, casting fluxes & covering compounds, amongst others. Under manufacturing, the Group undertakes manufacturing of cored wires. Across geographies, it derived ~72% of its revenue from overseas markets. Major regions of export include Middle East countries, Germany, Italy, Thailand, Egypt, Malaysia, Pakistan, Sweden, Kenya, Taiwan, Netherland, Japan, United Kingdom, Tanzania etc. This has led to geographic diversification of the revenue streams thereby mitigating the risk of fiscal policy change or regulatory uncertainties related to any single geography. Setting up subsidiaries in different geographies has helped Group to liaison with local producers/miners and expand reach and customers by operating out from local offices. As informed, the Group has entered into supply arrangements with the producers/miners and locks in a fixed quantity with its suppliers to ensure uninterrupted supplies.
Comfortable gearing and liquidity position provides financial flexibility

The Group?s financial risk profile is witnessed in the comfortable gearing throughout the review period. Despite increase in long term debt in FY 2019, debt equity ratio of the Group witnessed a decline due to lower utilisation of short term working capital loans. As on 31st March 2019, around 72% of the long term debt was from corporates and related parties (which as indicated are interest free) and are utilized towards meeting working capital needs. The Group has a sanctioned facility of INR 60 crores which on an average remains 60-65% utilized.

A lower debt component when compared with healthy tangible networth would provide financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expanding its scale of operation. Low debt also led to low incidence of interest expenditure resulting in adequate interest coverage ratio of 7.68 times during FY 2019. Comfortable interest cover indicates adequate earnings to service its interest obligations.

Further, the solvency ratios despite an uneven trend stood adequate as witnessed in the current ratio and quick ratio of 2.63 times and 1.97 times respectively during FY 2019. Unencumbered cash and bank balance of INR 356,288 thousand as on 31st March 2019 provides further cushion to its liquidity position. Further, the Group generated sufficient net cash accruals of INR 181,678 thousand during FY 2019 as against near term debt obligation of INR 33,884 thousand. Adequate liquidity will enable the Group to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and provide comfort towards servicing its near term obligations.

The Group?s working capital cycle has reduced from 92 days in FY 2017 to 44 days in FY 2019. Supplies are mostly against advance payment while considering the material transit time of 30-45 days, collection cycle lengthens to 60-90 days. Inventory days has ranged from 20 to 50 days. It enters into back to back orders for ferro alloy trading and hence keeps a minimal inventory of the same. However, it keeps a stock for trading of manganese ore and coal. The increase in inventory in FY 2019 was towards the stock and sell model adopted for other metals except ferro alloys. The working capital is funded through customer advances, internal accruals, related party loans and outside debt. In the last three years ending FY 2019, The Group has managed its working capital requirements through own funds resulting in minimal outside borrowings.
Parent TVS group, a leading supplier of auto components and BorgWarner, Inc, a global turbocharger manufacturer offering trade and technology support

The Company is a part of TVS group, formed as a joint venture between Brakes India Limited (32%), Sundaram Finance Limited (32%) and BorgWarner Turbo Systems Worldwide Headquartered at, Germany (32.6%) (a division of the globally active automotive supplier BorgWarner Inc., the United States of America). BorgWarner Inc. is one of the global suppliers of engineered systems as well as components primarily for powertrain applications and has its footprint in various countries. As informed, the Company receives technical support from BorgWarner Inc., which helps it to manufacture quality products as required by the OEM?s. Also, it supplies parts of turbochargers to BorgWarner Inc., which forms about 12% of the total revenue. The Company continuously undertakes R&D to upgrade product technology, in collaboration with the JV partner. This has assisted the Company to stay abreast with the technology changes and maintain its market leadership. Further, being a part of TVS group, it receives trade support in terms of supplies and manufacturing, 85% of the total raw material requirement were procured from Brakes India Limited and ABI showatech India Private Limited in FY 2019, this helps the Company to deliver quality products in a timely manner. As informed, the Company also outsources various processes like machining to the group concerns. Key dealings with the group entity enable the Company to enjoy flexible credit cycle, better cost control etc. TVS group is a large group having a turnover of over $ 6.5 bn and is amongst the leading suppliers of automotive components.

Thus, the Company is expected to continue to benefit from the sustained support from the group concerns and the technical collaboration with the global turbocharger manufacturer, which will help the Company increase its scale of operations. This is evident from the TEL?s revenue growth of ~19% and ~28% in FY 2018 and FY 2019.

TEL has a long standing presence in the industry, operating since 1982. Over the years, the Company has expanded its product range in collaboration with JV partner-BorgWarner Inc. Currently; it manufactures different types of turbocharger, which include wastegate, R2S, VTG, non-wastegate, gasoline as per the different technology, applications and fuel requirement. Recently, it has commenced with manufacturing of Turbocharger for small engines and CNG. Though, it caters to different segments including automobile, industrial and marine, about 90% of its revenue is contributed from automotive-diesel variants. It also has capabilities to manufacture gasoline turbocharger (currently produces 20,000) as per the OEM demand. TEL has four manufacturing locations with the capacity to produce 1.8 million turbochargers and 5 million turbocharger components per year. As on 31st March 2019, it manufactured 1.5 million turbo charger, a 6% increase compared to FY 2018. Further, long standing presence in the industry has helped it to build strong relations with the clients. It secures year on year repeat orders from its customers. As informed, the Company is the sole supplier of the turbochargers to its top 3 clients-Maruti Suzuki India Limited, Mahindra & Mahindra Limited, Renault and major suppliers to Tata, Ashok Leyland, Daimler, Ford, etc. It supplies to around 30 OEM?s and recently has added Hyundai Motor Company, John Deere, Volkswagen Group to its customer list. As informed, the Company enjoys a market share of above 60% in the domestic turbocharger industry and it is expected to maintain its strong business risk profile over the short to medium period in the industry due to its established market position in the industry.

The Company?s financial profile remained comfortable aided by healthy margins, adequate liquidity; large networth base and sound return indicators. The OPBDIT margins remained high between 16-21% during the review period. As informed, the Company was able to report a healthy profitability due to supply of technology intense product leading to stickiness nature of OEM, and ability to have a better bargaining power with them. In addition, it has high operating efficiencies as key dealing (raw material purchase and processes) are through the group entities (Brakes India Limited and Abi Showatech India Private Limited) and it has a better control over the costs. However, in FY 2019, the Company?s profitability dipped sharply with margins declining by 600 basis points. As informed, decline in profitability is owing to price reduction for some of its customers and change in product mix where raw material content was higher. This decline was majorly owing to surge in cost of raw materials consumed. With decline in profitability, returns also declined. Despite this decline, the profitability and returns still remained healthy at current level.

Moderate working capital requirements and healthy cash accruals y-o-y has led to low reliance on short term debt. Also, the Company till FY 2018 was able to meet its capex requirements (ranged from INR 40-240 crore) entirely through internal accruals. However, in FY 2019, the Company borrowed term loans from bank of around INR 120 crores for establishing a new facility in Vadodara, Gujarat. Despite this increase in borrowings, the capital structure remained underleveraged with debt equity ratio at 0.10 times as on 31st March 2019. Underleveraged capital structure provides financial flexibility to the Company and enables it to procure additional funds if required. Interest coverage ratio remained robust with low interest cost and increase in earnings before interest and tax (EBIT). However, in FY 2019, EBIT declined along with increase in interest expenses, this led to decline in interest coverage ratio. Despite this decline, it remained strong. Strong interest coverage ratio enables the Company to service its debt obligations effectively.
Moreover, current ratio and quick ratio of the Company were adequate throughout the review period as depicted in the table below:

The cash flows from operations of the Company remained positive throughout the review period indicating that the Company had generated adequate cash from operations to meet short term obligations, capex plans and dividend payout. Further, liquidity is supported by healthy cash and bank balance and current investments of about INR 641 crores as on March 31, 2019.
Qualified and experienced management coupled with financial and technical support from Velan group

The Company has an experienced management team, currently led by Mr. Ramesh Babu Rangarajan ?Managing Director, who holds a postgraduate degree in business administration with an extensive experience of more than 25 years in the valve industry. Other board members too are well qualified and have relevant industry experience. This extensive experience provides comfort about the execution and networking capabilities of the Company. This is reflected in increasing revenue trend during the review period except for FY 2018 where it declined significantly. The Company would continue to benefit from the extensive industry experience of promoters which could help on scaling up the operations as well as garner wider customer base going forward.

The Company is a subsidiary of Velan Luxembourg, SARL, which is held by Velan Inc (ultimate parent Company) which was established in the year 1950 and is engaged in manufacturing industrial steel valves. The ultimate parent company has fourteen manufacturing facilities located in Canada, USA, Europe and Asia. The group registered consolidated revenue of $ 366,865 thousand and has tangible networth $ 308,833 thousand as on 28th February 2019. As informed, the Company being a part of Velan group, receives operational & financial support. Further, being into similar line of business, the Company also gets technical support for product designing and development from Velan Inc. In FY 2019, the Company earned revenue of INR 220,684 thousand from ultimate parent and fellow subsidiaries which was 23.60% of its total revenue indicating reliance on the group for its operations. Additionally, Mr. Thomas Velan represents Velan Inc. on the Board of the Company. Thus, the Company draws significant financial and operational support from Velan group, which is evident from the y-o-y revenue growth (except for FY 2018) booked by the Company.

The Company?s financial risk profile is healthy supported by underleveraged capital structure and comfortable debt protection indicators. During the review period, total debt equity ratio improved from 2.77 times as on 31st March 2015 to 0.12 times as on 31st March 2019. Long term loans were from parent Company. In FY 2016, the same were converted in equity shares thereby drastically reducing the debt equity ratio. Further, low debt incidence is due to majority funding of capital expenditure are met through internal accruals, thus having low reliance on external borrowings. A lower debt component, when compared with Company?s healthy tangible networth, would provide the Company financial flexibility to procure additional funds for further expansion. Furthermore, low reliance on external debt has led to low incidence of interest costs resulting in comfortable interest coverage ratio of 3.07 times in FY 2019 thereby indicating sufficient safety margin with the Company to service its financial obligations. Thus, low debt-equity ratio will provide financial flexibility in terms of expansion through additional leverage to capitalize on future opportunities or business exigencies.

The current and quick ratio of the Company remained adequate throughout the review period. Although, Company?s working capital intensive operations were partly funded through short term borrowings, current ratio and quick ratio stood at 1.94 times and 1.03 times as on 31st March 2019 indicating adequate liquidity position. Moreover, net cash accruals stood at INR 89,125 thousand as on 31st March 2019 as against no near term debt obligations which provides cushion to its liquidity profile. However, the net cash flow from operating activities turned negative in FY 2019 owing to adverse working capital movements driven by inventories, trade receivables and short term loans and advances. Adequate liquidity will enable the Company to internally fund its organic and inorganic expansion plans and provide comfort towards servicing its near term obligations.

Venus Wire Industries Private Limited and Precision Metals is promoted and managed by same promoters and are in the same line of business (i.e. manufacturing and sale of stainless steel wire, wire rods and bars). Venus Wire Industries Private Limited has manufacturing capacity to manufacture stainless steel wire and wire rods, whereas Precision Metals has manufacturing capacity to manufacture stainless steel bars. Till FY 2017, group use to sell stainless steel wires & wire rods from Venus Wire Industries Private Limited and stainless steel bars were supplied from Precision Metals. However, during end of FY 2017, Company changed its business model and major business related to sale of stainless steel wire was transferred to Precision Metals. Now, Venus Wire Industries Private Limited operates as a processor of stainless steel wires/wire rods for Precision Metals on job work basis. Thus, significant operational synergy with its strong group company (Precision Metals), provides cushion to the Company.
Precision Metals achieved a revenue growth of ~41% CAGR and its net profit after tax grew at a CAGR of 49% during the review period.
Key financials elements of Precision Metals are as follows:
Experienced management coupled with established relationship with reputed customer base driving business growth

The Company is promoted and managed by Mr. Babulal Parasmal Bohra (Chairman and Director) and Mr. Ghevarchand Raghunath Sanghvi (Managing Director), who has experience of more than four and a half decades and three decades respectively in stainless steel industry. Under their leadership, the Company has grown from a trading Company to manufacturing Company catering to customers across the globe. At present, the Company has geographical presence across countries including the USA and Germany and has set up its own subsidiary Venus Edelstahl GmbH with an office in Hagen- Hohenlimburg, Germany. The promoters are also ably supported by other directors and a professional managerial team who have extensive business experiences in various fields. Being in the industry for around 29 years, the Company has established strong relations with the customers and secured repeat orders from them. As informed by the management, the Venus group is listed as an approved vendor with various OEM in the domestic as well as international markets. The group has a client base of more than 400 customers in domestic as well as international markets and has established relationship of more than 80% of its customers. This vast experience of the management and its healthy clientele base provides comfort to the revenue visibility of the Company.

The Company?s products find wide application in various industries such as like automotive, energy, nuclear, windmill, oil and gas, architecture, water pumps, defense, boats or ships, welding, pharmaceutical, machine components, conveyor, fencing, vineyard, power generation, boilers, paper industry, petrochemical, pipelines, building & construction and lighting sector amongst others. Hence, catering to diversified industry provides comfort to the Company from any adverse economic condition in a particular industry.

The Company?s financial risk profile is strengthened by unleveraged capital structure and strong debt protection metrics throughout the review period due to funding of working capital requirements mainly through internal accruals or stretching its payables. Also, healthy networth levels backed by accretion to reserves support financial profile of the Company.
An underleveraged capital structure provides an opportunity to the Company to fund the incremental working capital requirements using external borrowings.
Furthermore, low reliance on external debt led to low incidence of interest costs, thereby indicating sufficient safety margin to service its financial obligations.
Established track record and experienced management provides revenue visibility

The Company has a long track record of over 18 years that demonstrates its ability to survive economic and business cycles. The Company is engaged in the manufacturing of high-strength, multilayer flexible packaging films and provides customized packaging solutions to retail and industrial markets. It started its operation by manufacturing 3 layer films, it gradually expanded its portfolio by adding higher layer manufacturing of 5 layer, 7 layer (in the year 2003) and 9 layer (in the year 2009). The Company is led by Mr. Jigishkumar Doshi, a Chemical Engineer, with an experience of over three decades in the flexible packaging industry. The long-standing presence of the promoters in the industry has helped the Company to scale up its operations. He is ably supported by experienced management team undertaking operations of the Company. Under this leadership, the Company has been able to scale at a CAGR of 15.73% through FY 2019.

The Company is a joint collaboration with AWL and the Doshi Family, each holding 50% equity share. AWL is engaged in refining and production of edible oils. It also offers Vanaspati, packed basmati rice, pulses, soya chunks, amongst others. AWL has a market leadership position in edible oil segment in India. Over the years, the ?Fortune? brand of AWL has established leadership position in the branded edible oil segment. VPPL has advantage of supplying its products to one of the market leaders, AWL. Its sales to AWL accounted around 35% of total revenue and as informed, it caters to major requirement of AWL.

The Company also receives financial support in the form of loans (interest-bearing) from AWL. AWL has also funded other project of Vishakha Group and also is a shareholder in few other group companies apart from VPPL.

VPPL benefits from its association AWL, considered as one of the largest player in FMCG sector, and provides an edge over other players in terms of revenue visibility and eases in working capital requirements with financial support.

Over the years, the Company has built strong relations with the customers. The key corporate clientele of the Company includes AWL, Cargil, Scobie and Junor Group, The Vacuum Pouch Company Limited, Bidco Africa Limited, Promarks Inc. Master Buthcers Co-operative Limited. The Company would continue to benefit from its established relations with the customers which is expected to sustain the business profile of the Company over the near to medium term. Further, the Company caters to both the domestic and overseas markets with ~ 25% revenue derived from overseas markets in FY 2019. As indicated, export fetches better margins and on back of growing export demand of its products, Company sees the export share to increase to 40% over the medium term. The key regions of export include United Kingdom, Australia, Europe, United States of America, South Korea amongst others. The Company?s presence across various countries helps in mitigating the geographical concentration risk. Geographical diversification also helps the Company to survive regulatory uncertainties related to a single geographical region.
Established market position on the back of strong promoter background

WIL was established in 1960 and is a part of TVS group which is engaged into manufacturing of automotive components, two/three wheelers and also operates vehicle dealership and logistic services. Apart from TVS group which holds about 40% stake in the Company, Titan Europe Limited which is engaged into manufacturing and sale of wheels and undercarriages for construction, agricultural, and mining vehicles has around 34% stake in the Company.

Being a part of TVS group, which has a long-standing history in the global and domestic automotive industry helps the Company to enjoy the brand equity and recognition in the market. Moreover, this strengthens the competitive position of WIL in respect of sourcing of materials at competitive prices. On the back of long standing presence in the industry, the Company has been able to capture a significant market share in the passenger car wheels? segment which stood at around 43%. In case of agricultural tractor segment, WIL has a market share of around 61%.

Coupled with a strong promoter group, the Company is led by an experienced management which further enables it to explore and seize new opportunities. WIL is led by Mr. Santhanam Ram (Chairman) and Mr. Srivats Ram (Managing Director) having an experience of five and two decades respectively in the automotive industry. The long-standing presence of the Company in the industry and the vast experience of the management has helped the Company to establish healthy relationships with its customers and suppliers ensuring repeat business and ease in sourcing of materials. This relevant experience is expected to augur well for further improving the business profile of the Company.
Strategically located manufacturing facilities with established in-house research and development

The Company's products comprise of heavy materials and involve significant logistic costs. Hence, WIL's manufacturing facilities are strategically located close to its customers? plants which enable it to ensure on-time delivery with optimum costs thereby resulting into significant reduction in its operational costs. In the Chennai region, it has wheel and fabrication facilities to service the requirements of customer plants across industry segments located in the southern part of the country and international customers who are serviced through the Chennai port.

In Rampur, the Company has a plant to service agricultural tractors and commercial vehicle wheel requirements of customers in the northern part of the country. WIL?s facility at Pune is at close proximity to a major automobile hub in India. At Bawal, the Company has established a facility to service passenger car manufacturers in the NCR region. The most recent plant at Thirumudivakkam where the WIL manufactures dump truck bodies is also located close to the customer's manufacturing facility.

With strategically located manufacturing facilities which ensure timely delivery and reduction in operational costs, the Company also has an in-house research and development facility which is recognized by Department of Science & Technology since 1994. In FY 2019, the Company has developed a total of 414 new products and received patents for 6 amongst them. The Company has been investing substantially in testing facilities and the laboratory being NABL accredited, the product development cycle is relatively short.

Being in the industry for more than five decades and having an established market position, the Company has been able to build healthy relationships with its customers. WIL sells its products to the OEMs as well as in the aftermarket with majority derived from OEMs. It has a reputed clientele base comprising of Mahindra and Mahindra Limited, Tata Motors Limited, Ashok Leyland and others with whom it has a relation of over 5 decades. Having an Established relationship with its customers helps the Company to maintain a stable revenue because of the repeat business received from them. This is reflected in the year-on-year revenue growth, registering a CAGR of 15.11% over the past three years ended FY 2019. It also enables the Company to mitigate debtor?s realization risk, and helps in scouting prospective customers. The Company won performance and quality related awards from customers such as Caterpillar, John Deere, Tata Motors, Toyota Kirloskar and Volvo Eicher which indicates strong association with its customers.

WIL manufactures a wide range of products which includes steel wheels for passenger cars, utility vehicles, small trucks, commercial vehicles, agricultural tractors and others. The range of products varies from 8" diameter wheel up to a 49" diameter wheel with varying types from single piece for light vehicles to 5-piece wheels for construction equipment. In addition to standard wheels for these industry segments, the Company also manufactures wire wheels for classic cars, forged aluminum wheels for trucks and buses. Apart from manufacturing of steel wheels, the Company also manufactures air suspension systems for buses, vans, trucks and trailers.

Furthermore, it also is engaged in manufacturing of fabricated structures for thermal power plants and construction and mining equipment and components for wind energy equipment. It also started supplying wheels for two wheelers and lift air suspensions for multi-axle vehicles by improving capacity utilization of its existing plant. Wide product basket across diversified segments enables the Company to garner wide clientele base and have extended lock-in with existing clientele.
Underleveraged capital structure on the back of efficient working capital management

The financial position of the Company remained adequate during the year primarily on the back of its efficient working capital management. Furthermore, growing scale of operations has led to improvement in Company?s cash accruals, thus having lower reliance on external borrowings to fund its working capital requirements. Its working capital cycle remained in the range of 16 to 42 days over the past three years. The efficient working capital management emanated from its good collection cycle and through extended credit from suppliers and customer?s advances, thus leading to lower dependency on borrowings. Average working capital utilization, as informed, was around 65-70% with peak utilization of around 80%.

The Company?s capital structure remained comfortable at 0.81 times as on 31st March 2019. Backed by lower debt, the interest coverage ratio improved during the review period and remained adequate at 2.79 times during the same period.

Healthy cash accruals and low gearing levels provides financial flexibility to the Company to leverage further in case of any business exigencies or to fund its incremental working capital requirements.

The Company provides information technology services, consulting and business process services. It also provides third party IT products which include computing, platform and storage, networking solutions, enterprise information security and software products. Wipro is an integrated service player having capabilities across wide spectrum of services which include global infrastructure services, digital strategy advisory, customer centric design, technology consulting, IT consulting, custom application design, system integration and others. Integrated service offerings enable the Company to be a complete business solution provider resulting in extended lock-in with the clients.

The Company?s topline is diversified amongst various IT services along with consulting and business process services across industries which includes banking, manufacturing, consumer goods, health care, media and entertainment, pharmaceutical and life sciences, insurance, communication, energy and others.

Banking and Financial Services sector contributed 31% of the topline of the Company for FY 2019. . As informed by the management, BFSI and manufacturing sectors will remain the major contributors to the revenue of the Company primarily on account of their industry size. The Company also has an exposure towards aerospace, medical devices, network equipment providers and other sectors.

The financial profile of the Company remained strong backed by its unleveraged capital structure and healthy interest coverage ratio. Year-on-year increase in the topline, adequate profitability margins coupled with low interest expenditure led to healthy cash accruals for the Company. The profitability margins of the Company though declining marginally during the review period were adequate, with the operating margins in the range of 16% to 20% over the five years ended FY 2019. The decline in the profitability levels was primarily on account of high employee compensation costs, sub-contract charges, coupled with acquisition costs. The downward trend in profitability led to decline in the returns indicators but those remained adequate with Return on Capital Employed (RoCE) at 18.91% in FY 2019. Buyback of shares worth INR 11,000 crores in FY 2018 also helped the Company to trim its net worth and capital employed, thus aiding in better returns on funds invested.

Additionally, despite significant acquisitions, the Company?s capital structure remained comfortable with gearing of 0.10 times as on 31st March 2019; backed by its healthy cash accruals. Lower reliance on external debt coupled with adequate profitability levels led to strong coverage indictor which stood at 30.73 times in FY 2019.

The Company?s liquidity remained adequate with its current ratio at 2.96 times as on 31st March 2019 and more than adequate cash accruals against its minimalist debt obligations. Its liquidity position is further supported by its healthy cash and bank balance and liquid investments ( cash holding of INR 10.38 thousand crores and current investment of INR 22 thousand crores).
Diversified clientele base with year on year addition to number of clients

The Company has a well-diversified clientele base and caters to diversified industries such as manufacturing, banking and finance, retail and consumer goods, healthcare and life sciences and others. The top customer of the Company accounted for around 3.11% during FY 2018 which increased to 3.7% during FY 2019. The top five and ten clientele of the Company accounted for around 12.7% and 19.5% respectively of the Company?s topline for FY 2019.

Over the years, owing to addition of new customers, dependency on top customers has not been high mitigating the risk of customer concentration . Further, as informed, the Company has been able to increase its pocket share from newly added customers through cross selling of multiple services over multiple years. They have added three more clients to the $100 million annual revenue bucket and one client to $75 million plus bucket.ÿ This has helped to broaden the customer base and reduce dependence on top customers as well. Nevertheless, the Company?s revenue from its existing clientele base has remained at around 98% of the total revenue.
Healthy repeat business rate coupled with addition of new customers provides strong medium term revenue visibility to the Company.
Experienced management driving the business and foray in new technologies

Wipro was established in 1945 and ventured into the IT sector in 1980?s. For more than three decades, the Company, that was led by Mr. Azim Premji, became one of the leading players in the IT space. Mr. Azim Premji, the Founder, Non-Executive and Non Independent Director of the Company, has an experience of four decades in the IT field. He has been awarded with ?Padma Bhushan? for his outstanding work in trade and commerce in 2005; and ?Padma Vibhushan?, the second highest civilian award by Government of India in 2011. Furthermore, other members of the management team also have an experience of more than a decade in the IT industry. This vast experience has helped the Company to diversify its service portfolio and clientele base which has further led the Company to register revenue at a compounded annual growth rate of 3.90% over the five years ended FY 2019.
Strong global network of delivery centres strengthens the business risk profile of the Group

The Group has around 61 delivery centres as of 30th September 2019 catering to over 400 clients across industries. It caters to customers having presence across 23 countries viz. China, Costa Rica, India, the Philippines, Poland, Romania, South Africa, Turkey, Sri Lanka, the UK and the US. It also delivers through its subcontractor?s delivery centre in China.

The Group has shown a track record of continuous investments towards capex and expansion for setting up new delivery centers, expanding existing ones and developing new technology enabled solutions for efficient execution and management of clients? business processes. In 2016, additional delivery centres were opened in Philippines at Iloilo, and further expanded into France, Germany, and Turkey in FY 2017. In FY 2018, the Group added new facilities in Philippines; Romania; Pune and Vishakhapatnam, India and Shanghai, China. There was also expansion of facilities in Nashik and Pune, India and Guangzhou, China. In FY 2019, the Group added new facilities in the Philippines; Spain and Vizag, India. It also expanded its facilities in Bengaluru, Gurugram, Nashik and Pune, India.

The Group intends to continue to expand its global delivery capability through additional delivery centres in onshore, nearshore and offshore locations as well through collaborations with other providers. A strong network of delivery centres (spread across different geographies) coupled with an experienced program management team enables the Group to quickly transfer & execute the business processes of the client (most of which are critical) offshore, thus reaping the benefits of low cost bases. For example, a delivery center in Philippines, which is more closely aligned with the tradition, culture and language of the United States of America, enables the Group to win clients easily in its key market viz. the North America.
Consistent volume growth resulting in increasing revenue and profitability

The revenue of the Group increased at a CAGR of 17.81% in the past three years ended FY 2019 due to incremental business from existing and new customers, full integration post acquisitions of Value Edge, Denali, HealthHelp, improved farming activities, and revenue benefits from project extensions, gain sharing, and client transition work.

Following a decline in profitability in FY 2017 due to incremental expense from acquisitions such as higher headcount, wage inflation, non-recurring charge from goodwill impairment, and increase in subcontracting costs; overall profitability increased in FY 2018 and significantly in FY 2019. This increase was on account of operating leverage kicking in from full integration of acquisitions, increase in non-linear priced contracts resulting in higher employee productivity, and increased capacity utilization from the higher volumes.

Accordingly, the Group recorded 11% growth in H1 FY 2020 as against H1 FY 2019 coupled with sharp increase in profitability at all levels. It projects a double digit growth by the year ending FY 2020.
Underleveraged capital structure leading to strong liquidity position

The financial profile of the group has remained strong marked by an underleveraged capital structure with gearing below unity throughout the review period. The Group enjoys short term line of credit in its Indian delivery centre, however, its utilisation remains minimal. An underleveraged capital structure would provide financial flexibility to the Group and would make it easy to raise funds for any of its expansion plans, especially for the inorganic opportunities.

The liquidity position of the group was also comfortable; corroborated by high current ratio, positive cash flow from operations, and strong liquid investments (includes cash & bank and marketable securities) of USD 153,357 thousand as on 31st March 2019. The current ratio of the Group stood at 2.07 times as on 31st March 2019, depicting adequate short-term liquidity position. The Group?s cash accruals increased y-o-y over the past three years from USD 92,134 thousand in FY 2017 to USD 149,655 thousand in FY 2019.

The Group derives strength from the effective leadership of a global management team with diverse backgrounds including an extensive experience in outsourcing. The members on the board of the holding company have an average experience of more than 20 years in diverse industries including the outsourcing sector. The CEO of the Group Mr. Keshav Murugesh, a fellow of the Institute of Chartered Accountant of India, was earlier the President and Chief Executive Officer of Syntel Inc., one of the leading BPOs. He is presently the Chairman of NASSCOM. He joined the Company in 2009 and has been instrumental in turning it around from a staple outsourcing solutions provider to a more specialised solution oriented service provider like analytics, social media and machine learning layers to its clients. He realised the importance of making his employees as specialists from generalists by nurturing industry-relevant skills through its in-house training programs. Moreover, other directors on the Board are also qualified and have long experience in BPO industry. Such relevant experience and track record enables the Group to develop long standing client relationships and successfully integrate acquisitions which has aided in the y-o-y growth in the revenue of the Group.
Large clientele coupled with recurring nature of BPO business provides revenue visibility

As on 31st March 2019, the Group had around 403 clients (previous year: 386) present across various verticals and across revenue stack (i.e. different ticket sizes of contracts). The nature of processes that companies outsource are quite complex and require high degree of customization. It is often a multi-stage outsource transfer program. These companies would incur high switching costs to transfer the processes back to other business process outsourcing providers. Hence, once a BPO provider gains confidence of its client, it enters into multi-year contracts with predictable annual revenue. The Group?s long track record to cater a diverse customer base has enabled to increase its revenue throughout the review period on the back of repeat business, which accounts for majority of the total revenues and which also highlights its business strength to service its customers? dynamic requirements.

Further, a strong clientele along with longer duration of the contracts (owing to sticky nature of BPO business), with group entering into 3-8 years? contracts with its customers, provides revenue visibility to the Group. Moreover, the Group has been adding more customers across all revenue stacks to widen the client base.

As informed, the Group expands its relationships with existing clients by identifying additional processes that can be transferred to its global delivery centres, cross-selling of new services, adding technology based offerings and meeting to client?s needs by expanding to newer geographies as required by them. Along with this, its vertical focused domain specialization has enabled to it offer client centric solutions. As informed, the Group?s client-centric approach has helped it to bag a renewal contract withÿAviva MS, its largest client by revenues. It has entered into the Aviva master services agreement effective 1st April 2014 and expiring on 31st March 2022. For new clients, it seeks to provide value-added solutions by leveraging its industry knowledge and process expertise which helps it to increase its clientele base. Further, with acquisition of two new strategic business in Q4 FY 2017 namely Denali (enhancing high-end procurement capabilities), and Health Help (providing with a technology-led, analytics-driven offering in care management), the Group was able to improve its customer profile.
Diversified product portfolio coupled with concerted research and development focus

The Group has a diversified product portfolio with a strong presence in major therapeutic segments such as cardiology, dermatology, diabetes, respiratory and ophthalmology.ÿIt derives strength from its concerted focus on research and development activities which has enabled it to launch generic version of drugs across niche segments. Its R&D expenses, including capital expenditure were around 11% of its topline during FY 2019 indicating the emphasis on new product development. It has successfully developed an array of niche and NDDS (Novel Drug Delivery System) products such as Metoprolol ER, Divalproex ER, Tamsulosin ER and others. Further, the Group also has strong focus on developing intellectual property as evident from the fact that as on 31st March 2019, a combined pool of the group?s patent reached 3,132 filings and 694 grants. During FY 2019, the Group filed 95 patents of which 66 were granted. Also, the Group has filed 3 new products in UK and has received an approval for 2 new products (ANDAs) in US. Currently for the US business, the Group?s pipeline includes 58 products pending to be approved by US FDA. Pending ANDA?s include complex generics and modified release formulations.

Concerted focus on research and development has enabled the Group to consistently launch new products and widen its product portfolio. Also, as informed, the Group?s primary emphasis on new drug discovery program in anti-infective space aims to enhance the immunity power of the drugs in both regulated and unregulated markets.

Further, Wockhardt Group is the only Company in the world where USFDA has given QIDP status (Qualified Infectious Diseases Programme) for five drugs of its anti-bacterial discovery programme. As indicated by management, Group plans to launch one of the drugs in Indian market by Q3 FY 2020 on completion of Phase III clinical trials. Strong focus on R&D would enable the Group to consistently launch new products and scale up its revenues in increasingly competitive generic space.
Extensive experience and resourceful management to drive business

The Group is currently led by Dr. Habil Fakhruddin Khorakiwala who is the founder chairman. He has an experience of around 50 years in the pharmaceutical industry. The Managing Director, Dr. Murtaza Khorakiwala and Executive Director Dr. Huzaifa Khorakiwala have almost 20 years of experience in the related industry. Strong & experienced management provides comfort that the R&D initiatives would result in value addition for the Group and that it would be steered through in its challenging times through operational excellence (as evident from an operational turnaround post the Company went into CDR).

The promoters in FY 2019 had bought in INR 250 crore as preference shares at a coupon rate of 4% to support the group pay off existing outstanding preference shares which were due for repayment.
